title: 427: April 29-30, 2020

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan check in to see how Alex Jones decided to celebrate May Day. As it turns out, he was trying pretty hard to cheer on a literal war with China, desperately asking people to be his successor, and pretending that his outburst about eating his neighbors was actually genius satire.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss Alex Jones' growing insistence that Trump declare war on China, and how the media played directly into Alex's hands with the "eating his neighbors" thing.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/5/4/episode-428-may-1-2020 Episode 428: May 1, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex doesn't understand [https://www.bbc.com/future/article/20181002-how-long-did-ancient-people-live-life-span-versus-longevity the difference between lifespan and life-expectancy]. He also seems to think that people only lived to 30 back in the 1930's, [https://u.demog.berkeley.edu/~andrew/1918/figure2.html which is not true].
*Alex pretends that his outburst about eating his neighbors was satire, not recognizing that satire requires a point. The most generous description of what he was doing is trolling, and honestly, it's most likely it was an outburst that he's turned into a PR opportunity.
*Alex and Owen discuss the doctors in CA who say the virus is all overblown, [https://www.mercurynews.com/2020/05/03/cue-the-debunking-two-bakersfield-doctors-go-viral-with-dubious-covid-test-conclusions-2/ who have been widely discredited].
*Alex pretends that a Facebook post by Jair Bolsonaro revealed real information that the WHO recommends doctors masturbate infants. [https://www.businessinsider.com/bolsonaro-says-who-sexualizing-young-children-deleted-post-2020-4 It's all nonsense], to the point where Bolsonaro even deleted the post.
*Leo Zagami shows up to talk to Alex about how these are the end times, and how in 2025 the saints will return and the inevitable Armageddon will be upon us. Leo has also declared himself Jesus, took credit for 9/11, and was big into 2012 conspiracies, so take his predictions with a grain of salt.
*Leo shows his racism by calling Mark Zuckerberg's wife Priscilla Chan, [https://qz.com/1402697/the-amazing-ascent-of-priscilla-chan/ who was born in Massachusetts], "a Chinese."

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss the last few days of The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex forces Dan to critically engage with the idea that his cannibalism rant was satire, and decides that a dumb op-ed is a revelation of the Globalists' plan for the 2020 election.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss a couple days of Alex Jones' show that ends up being much more about Alex's cannibalism publicity stunt than anyone would like.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/5/5/episode-429-may-3-4-2020 Episode 429: May 3-4, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex's lawyer Norm Pattis [https://www.ctpost.com/local/article/Pattis-drops-Alex-Jones-in-Sandy-Hook-defamation-15246570.php has filed to withdraw as his lawyer] in the Sandy Hook case.
*Alex discusses a supposed dossier put together by the 5 Eyes, which was covered in [https://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/coronavirus/bombshell-dossier-lays-out-case-against-chinese-bat-virus-program/news-story/55add857058731c9c71c0e96ad17da60 The Daily Telegraph] and [https://www.foxnews.com/politics/five-eyes-dossier-chinese-coronavirus-coverup-u-s-findings Fox News]. It's also mentioned in [https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/05/04/coronavirus-lab-leak-trump-five-eyes/ Foreign Policy], where it's discussed how the dossier contradicts three of the 5 Eyes countries' stated conclusions.
*Alex lies about the CDC supposedly cutting the number of Covid-deaths in the US. [https://cdc.gov/nchs/nvss/vsrr/covid19/index.htm The website this comes from] explicitly says the numbers on the page are weeks behind.
*Alex thinks [https://www.cltampa.com/news-views/article/20759757/tampa-tribune-fires-conservative-columnist-douglas-mackinnon an op-ed in The Hill] about the possibility of a Hillary-Obama ticket is the revelation of the Globalists' plan. In reality, it was written by a republican speechwriter who previously has written pro-Trump columns for the Daily Caller, and [https://www.rightwingwatch.org/post/author-wants-southern-states-to-secede-over-gay-rights-name-new-country-reagan/ a book about how the South should secede] in response to rising LGBTQ acceptance.
*Alex misrepresents [https://www.forbes.com/sites/sethcohen/2020/05/02/please-dont-eat-your-neighbor--why-what-alex-jones-just-said-is-so-dangerous/#7c721e885810 an article about his cannibalism rant in Forbes].
*Alex probably has a bad grasp on A Modest Proposal. The target of Jonathan Swift's satire is discussed in [https://www.jstor.org/stable/90014752 Elizabeth Hedrick's paper].
*Francis Boyle brings up a pretty good point about the number of excess deaths that countries around the world have seen since the beginning of the outbreak. [https://www.ft.com/content/0ed8ea34-ebc5-4425-b86a-7a29447de57b Two articles] in [https://www.ft.com/content/6bd88b7d-3386-4543-b2e9-0d5c6fac846c the Financial Times] discuss research into this phenomenon.
*Dan critically deconstructs Alex's cannibalism rant to determine if there was any possibility of satire to be found therein. Spoiler alert: there is not.
*Jonathan Swift's non-satire work, like [https://celt.ucc.ie/published/E700001-009/text001.html A Proposal for Giving Badges to the Beggars in all the Parishes of Dublin], shows a distaste for the poor.
*Alex plays almost an hour of an interview from London Real with David Icke, even though that interview was Icke saying that there is no coronavirus, which is a massive contradiction of everything Alex believes

title: 429: May 3-4, 2020

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss a couple episodes from this week on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex continues his coronavirus games, decides that maybe the world doesn't deserve to know who Q is, and dips his toe into a hot new viral conspiracy sensation.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss a bit of a holding pattern stretch on the Alex Jones Show.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/5/8/episode-430-may-5-7-2020 Episode 430: May 5-7, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Michael Savage is not a medical doctor. [http://catalogue.nla.gov.au/Record/3287378 His dissertation] was about plants in Fiji.
*Alex claims that there is a normal number of deaths happening right now. This is not true, and it is very clearly laid out [https://www.ft.com/content/a26fbf7e-48f8-11ea-aeb3-955839e06441 by the Financial Times].
*Alex claims that there were a bunch of scandals in the 1990's about doctors killing patients to steal their organs. He appears to be misremembering a bit of debate about organ donation guidelines that was covered [https://www.nytimes.com/1997/04/13/us/controversy-erupts-over-organ-removals.html by the New York Times] in 1997.
*Alex and David Knight pretend that the inevitable additional cases of coronavirus and deaths that come after states open up prematurely are proof of some kind of conspiracy. In reality, they will be the expected thing that happens, [https://www.cnn.com/2020/03/23/asia/hong-kong-coronavirus-quarantine-intl-hnk/index.html as it did in Hong Kong], as well as elsewhere.
*Alex lies about the antibody tests that we have for Covid-19. [https://www.discovermagazine.com/health/covid-19-antibody-testing-tougher-than-true-false They aren't perfectly accurate at this point], but his narratives about them turning up positive if you had a cold in the past decade is complete nonsense.
*Chinese President Xi Jinping's daughter [https://www.newyorker.com/news/news-desk/what-did-chinas-first-daughter-find-in-america did study at Harvard under an assumed name], but that is not secret information, and she's not attending classes there currently, as Alex believes.
*The US and UK did release [https://www.ncsc.gov.uk/news/apt-groups-target-healthcare-essential-services-advisory an advisory warning about hacking], but they did not specify that they were Chinese hackers, as Alex is reporting. They just say they are Advanced Persistent Threat Groups of hackers, which is not country specific.
*Alex's story from the "Financial Telegraph" is actually from the "[https://www.businesslive.co.za/fm/features/2020-05-05-lockdown-disaster-dwarfs-covid-19-say-sa-actuaries/ Financial Mail]." It discusses the effects of the virus outbreak vs. the effects of the lockdown, as it relates to South Africa, but it paints a pretty different picture than Alex paints.
*Alex is correct that Marie Antoinette didn't actually say "let them eat cake," but his theories about who actually did [https://www.britannica.com/story/did-marie-antoinette-really-say-let-them-eat-cake are not supported by historians].
*Alex's complaints about Marie Antoinette playing badminton while her people starved is way too much of a parallel with Trump [https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2020/04/17/fact-check-trump-had-rallies-golfed-covid-19-outbreak-grew/5126918002/ going golfing frequently during the pandemic]
*Alex tries to get in on the action with the new hot "documentary" Plandemic. Mostly he's just interested in Dr. Mikovits, who has taken a past where she [https://science.sciencemag.org/content/334/6063/1636.1 got a paper retracted for being flawed], then [https://www.sciencemag.org/news/2011/10/chronic-fatigue-syndrome-researcher-fired-amidst-new-controversy getting fired], then getting sued for taking company property, and arrested because of noncompliance with the suit, into a tale of her own persecution and (I guess) how evil Anthony Fauci is
*There is no "Event 200" in [https://pdf.usaid.gov/pdf_docs/PCAAB500.pdf Memorandum 200]

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss how the week began on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex gets freaked out by bill numbers he thinks are satanic, falls for an internet hoax about New Guinea, and gets intensely hung up on the idea of men wearing pink.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss the beginning of the week on Alex Jones' show, which is pretty all over the place.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/5/12/episode-432-may-10-11-2020 Episode 432: May 10-11, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex discusses a Swedish company that allows people who already have implanted microchips to [https://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/sj-rail-train-tickets-hand-implant-microchip-biometric-sweden-a7793641.html use them to store train tickets]. He views this as the same thing as [https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/benjamin-netanyahu-suggests-to-microchip-kids-slammed-by-experts-627381 Netanyahu saying that Israel should put geo-locating chips into all school-children] as a part of reopening from Covid-19. They are not anywhere near similar.
*Alex has some erroneous ideas about [https://www.history.com/news/how-did-the-vikings-honor-their-dead Viking funerals], which [https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VikingFuneral actually come from movies]. He also has some inaccurate beliefs about [http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/ancient/vikings/women_01.shtml women in Viking communities].
*Alex tries to push warmed over Seth Rich conspiracies and pretends that they are new information, as opposed to long debunked garbage.
*Alex freaks out about [https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/6666/text?r=2&s=1 House Resolution 6666], mostly because of the bill number. It doesn't appear that he's actually read it though.
*Alex erroneously claims that Tanzanian president John Magufuli is a "top biologist," and discusses his unproven claim to have tested a goat and a papaya for Covid-19. There's no evidence that he did this. Also, if Alex actually cares about press freedom, [https://mg.co.za/article/2018-07-02-tanzanias-illiberal-tilt/ he should be super against Magufuli].
*Alex discusses the [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/nbcblk/video-appears-show-georgia-man-shot-while-jogging-lawyers-call-n1201301 killing of Ahmad Arbury], poorly.
*Alex fell for [https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-factcheck-guinea-vaccine/false-claim-video-shows-aftermath-of-fatal-covid-19-vaccination-in-guinea-idUSKBN22D67U a hoax video that was going around], purporting to show the aftermath of a Covid-19 vaccine trial in New Guinea. He never looked into the video, and reported a completely false story about it to his audience.
*Alex doesn't understand the [https://www.bbc.com/future/article/20160501-how-its-possible-for-an-ordinary-person-to-lift-a-car phenomenon of hysterical strength]
*Alex, though he is a noted military historian, is unaware that some Army uniforms used to be called "[https://www.military.com/daily-news/2018/11/23/just-greens-heres-why-army-changed-name-new-wwii-style-uniform.html Pink and Greens]."
*Alex lies about a city council resolution in San Antonio, pretending that they were going to arrest people who said "Chinese virus." [https://www.ktsa.com/san-antonio-city-council-to-vote-on-resolution-combating-hate-speech/ This is not true].
*Alex [https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/publicerat-material/publikationsarkiv/i/influenza-in-sweden/?pub=63511 completely exaggerates statistics] about [https://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?artikel=5436335&programid=2054 Swedish flu death numbers].
*Alex lies that the CDC is no longer recording flu cases or flu deaths. This is not true, [https://www.cdc.gov/flu/weekly/weeklyarchives2019-2020/data/whoAllregt_cl18.html flu counts] and [https://www.cdc.gov/flu/weekly/#S2 flu death counts] are easy to find if you want to look, which Alex strangely hasn't done apparently.
*Alex's "8 Pack Power Stack" is [https://www.infowarsstore.com/8-pack-power-stack the most confusing product he sells]

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss a couple days of this week on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex fails in a valiant attempt to make a point, possibly warns the world of a fake alien invasion, and gets a little too specific about what movie he pretends he was offered a starring role in.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss a particularly frustrating couple days on The Alex Jones Show.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/5/15/episode-433-may-12-13-2020 Episode 433: May 12-13, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex thinks that amateur astronomers discover most of the Near Earth Objects, and that professionals do not do much. This [https://www.nasa.gov/vision/universe/watchtheskies/neo.html is definitely] [https://arxiv.org/pdf/1503.04272.pdf not true].
*Alex claims that Mark Cuban was threatened with indictment because he was going to distribute Loose Change. The emails Cuban received [https://www.reuters.com/article/sec-norris-decision/fired-sec-lawyer-wins-reversal-in-case-over-emails-idUSL2E8FA9OL20120410 were unrelated to his insider trading case], which had nothing to do with Loose Change. The guy just [https://www.businessinsider.com/2008/11/new-light-on-the-bizarre-mark-cuban-emails seemed to hate Mark Cuban].
*Also, the director of Loose Change [https://theoutline.com/post/2179/reflecting-on-loose-change-in-the-age-of-fake-news-9-11-inside-job doesn't care much for Alex], and [http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/trutherism/2011/09/the_rise_of_truth.html isn't as much of a conspiracy theorist anymore].
*Alex claims that he was offered the starring role in Guardians of the Galaxy, but turned it down. This is a completely absurd claim, for a hundred different reasons.
*[https://www.who.int/immunization/monitoring_surveillance/resources/milstien.pdf Explanation from the WHO] about the roots of the misrepresentation that there is hCG in vaccines
*Alex's [http://www.oalib.com/articles/5290033#.Xr4uRmhKhPY primary source paper], "HCG Found In WHO Tetanus Vaccine In Kenya Raises Concern In the Developing World," is a bad paper. It's authors have [http://retractionwatch.com/2016/02/25/removed-paper-linking-hpv-vaccine-to-behavioral-issues-gets-retracted/ a history of having papers about vaccines retracted], and [https://retractionwatch.com/2018/01/30/second-time-researchers-retract-republish-vaccine-paper/ the paper itself is not good].
*Alex claims that Bill Gates was thrown out of India and Pakistan. He in fact has [https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/gates-org-kicked-out-of-india/ not been thrown out of India], [https://philanthropynewsdigest.org/news/gates-foundation-commits-200-million-to-combat-poverty-in-pakistan nor Pakistan]. These are both lies Alex is reporting.
*Alex lies about how [https://www.jsonline.com/story/news/2020/05/08/second-wisconsin-meatpacking-worker-dies-of-coronavirus-800-infected/3095122001/ no meat-packing plant employees] are [https://www.businessinsider.com/meatpacking-plants-12000-coronavirus-cases-48-deaths-2020-5 dying from Covid-19]. At least one employee at [https://www.kq2.com/content/news/16-workers-at-Triumph-Foods-under-quarantine-after-testing-positive-for-COVID-19-569925561.html the specific Triumph Food plant] that he brings up repeatedly [https://www.kmov.com/news/man-who-worked-at-missouri-pork-plant-dies-from-coronavirus/article_7e38c62c-907a-11ea-bc67-4b2f72b2745c.html has died].
*Alex references [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12266649 a 1985 paper] about a birth control vaccine that he claims is an instance of the Globalists putting sterilants into vaccine, and that Anthony Fauci was involved. There doesn't appear to be a connection, and his interpretation is incorrect.
*Alex claims hCG comes from the ovaries and testicles. [https://www.hormone.org/your-health-and-hormones/glands-and-hormones-a-to-z/hormones/human-chorionic-gonadotropin-hormone-hcg This does not appear to be true].
*Alex's First Headline doesn't make his argument. It is [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/7683889 a 1993 article about Gursaran Talwar's research] into a birth control vaccine.
*Alex's Second Headline doesn't make his argument. It is [https://www.cell.com/trends/immunology/comments/S1471-4906(02)02182-8 an article in Trends in Immunology] about research into birth control shots.
*Alex's Third Headline doesn't make his argument. It is about [https://www.pbs.org/independentlens/blog/unwanted-sterilization-and-eugenics-programs-in-the-united-states/ some dark moments in American history] that involve sterilization, but still is unrelated to the claims he's presenting.
*Alex's Fourth Headline doesn't make his argument. It is [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/nov/12/india-sterilisation-deaths-women-forced-camps-relatives about sterilizations in India], but is unrelated to the larger point Alex is trying to present.
*Alex's Fifth Headline doesn't make his argument. It is just about a government reorganization in India, where [https://www.reuters.com/article/us-india-health-bmgf/india-cuts-some-funding-ties-with-gates-foundation-on-immunization-idUSKBN15N13K the state took on the responsibility of some of the funding for programs that the Gates foundation had previously been funding]. The Gates Foundation stayed involved in the program afterwards, and according to Alex, Gates should have been thrown out of India at this point already.
*Alex's Sixth Headline doesn't make his argument. It is just another article, [https://academic.oup.com/humupd/article/3/4/301/632859 from the July 1997 issue of Human Reproduction Update], about Gursaran Talwar's research into birth control shots.
*Alex's Seventh Headline doesn't make his argument. It is a product of the Population Research Institute, which is disqualifying on its face.
*Alex's Eighth Headline doesn't make his argument. It is just Alex saying "contraceptive vaccines," which is meaningless.
*Alex's Ninth Headline doesn't make his argument. He just says "Special Programme of Research, Development and Research Training in Human Reproduction" and pretends it's something he's read. It's not something he could read, [https://www.who.int/reproductivehealth/hrp/en/ it is an entire organization], so I have no idea what text he's even referring to.
*Alex's Tenth Headline doesn't make his argument. It is [https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(05)60336-4/fulltext an article about opposition to birth control shots in India]. Alex claims that this 1998 article involves the HPV vaccine, which did not exist until 2006.
*Alex's Eleventh Headline doesn't make his argument. There are two articles titled "Antifertility Vaccines" on Science Direct. One of them is just [https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1471490602021828 the same article as his Second Headline], which he already cited when it was posted on a different website. The other is [https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0264410X89900431 a 1989 article by Gursaran Talwar] about his research into birth control shots.
*Alex's Twelfth Headline doesn't make his argument. I think it's something about ink cartridges making you sterile, but I have no idea what he's talking about.
*Alex's Thirteenth Headline doesn't make his argument. It is just the original paper from the Open Access Library Journal that started all of this.
*Alex's Fourteenth Headline doesn't make his argument. It is [https://www.sundayguardianlive.com/news/ethical-questions-surround-vaccine-reduce-fertility an op-ed in the Sunday Guardian] which miscites an [https://www.nature.com/articles/nm0218-118 article in Nature Medicine] about Gursaran Talwar's continuing research into birth control shots, even though he was older than 90.
*Alex's argument about Globalists putting sterilants into the vaccines has not been made in any way, this was a complete failure on his part.
*Alex's guest, Rich Granville, [https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2019/08/michael-flynn-and-george-papadopoulos-are-scheduled-to-speak-at-a-conference-organized-by-a-qanon-supporter/ organized a very-clearly QAnon themed conference], then [https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2019/08/michael-flynn-wants-a-judge-to-allow-him-to-travel-to-a-conference-held-by-a-qanon-fan/ got mad at Mother Jones for calling it that].

details_html: Today, to supplement their coverage of Alex Jones, Dan and Jordan begin an exploration of how things played out on Bill Cooper's radio show The Hour of the Time on the days immediately following the bombing of the Murrah building in Oklahoma City. This installment covers the day of the bombing, April 19, 1995, as well as April 20-21.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan begin an exploration of how Bill Cooper covered the bombing of the Murrah building in Oklahoma City on April 19, 1995.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/5/18/episode-434-bill-cooper-does-okc-part-1 Episode 434: Bill Cooper Does OKC Part 1]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Bill Cooper is concerned about a bill supposedly going through the Minnesota legislature that would convene a Conference of States. There is [https://www.revisor.mn.gov/laws/1995/0/ no such bill] that appears to have passed the MN state house or senate in 1995. This was all about a plan being put together by the National Association of Governors to gather state legislatures to assert state power, but [https://www.riponsociety.org/article/the-unbridled-growth-of-federal-power-and-the-complacency-of-the-states/ the idea had been largely deflated] after the GOP won control of Congress in the 1994 midterms. It lingered as a paranoia among [https://www.phyllisschlafly.com/constitution/article-v-convention/the-phyllis-schlafly-report-april-1995/ folks like Phyllis Schlafly] after this point, however.
*Bill is upset about death estimates going around in the media. It's unclear what exactly he was referring to, but [https://www.upi.com/Archives/1995/04/19/Bomb-tears-apart-Oklahoma-City-federal- UPI's reporting] reflects responsible coverage. Bill appears to be talking about estimates from Washington by 4:30, which was when Bill Clinton and Janet Reno held a press conference. No estimates matching Bill's version was [https://www.c-span.org/video/?64650-1%2Foklahoma-city-bombing in the conference].
*Bill is correct that [https://bombing.newsok.com/bombing/article/1175328/?template=bombing%2Fmain 50 Penn Place in Oklahoma City was evacuated], as well as Penn Square Mall across the street. He is unclear about the subject, and it's not suspicious.
*Times of various events are from the [http://murderpedia.org/male.M/images/m/mcveigh/docs/okcfr_App_F.pdf Document Management Team's report].
*The anchors who discussed a phone call claiming that the Nation of Islam took responsibility for the bombing also [https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1995-04-21-ca-57299-story.html were clear it could have been a prank call]. Also, Dave McCurdy [https://www.upi.com/Archives/1995/04/19/Bomb-tears-apart-Oklahoma-City-federal-building/9530023433931/ made reference to Hamas].
*The ATF [https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/1996/05/06/after-the-bombing-an-ostracized-atf/55f5f973-5a92-423b-8deb-8498dff417c7/ has gone on the record] that there were no explosives in their office. Mike Shannon testified that one of the devices that was suspected to have been found [https://oklahoman.com/article/1074860/okc-bombing-trial-transcript-05211997-1631-cdtcst was a desk clock].
*There was [https://web.archive.org/web/20090511115014/http://www.terrorisminfo.mipt.org/pdf/okcfr_part2.pdf a rocket launcher found in the debris]. It was not hidden, nor unexplained.
*The Medallion Hotel does exist. It started a renovation project [https://www.questia.com/newspaper/1P2-5676129/medallion-hotel-slated-for-renovation-project in Feb. 1995], and completed it [https://oklahoman.com/article/2553209/medallion-hotel-shows-off-plush-renovation in October 1996]. Also, while there covering the bombing, [https://www.nydailynews.com/bs-xpm-1995-05-07-1995127008-story.html Tom Brokaw allegedly yelled at a clerk for losing his reservations]. There is no reason that Bill's investigative team should be confused about whether or not this is a real hotel.
*Bill claims that an April 20 bombing in Prince Edward Island was connected with the OKC bombing. This is definitely not true. It was the work of [https://www.theguardian.pe.ca/news/local/convicted-bomber-roger-bells-reign-of-terror-began-30-years-ago-251945/ a serial bomber named Roger Charles Bell], who [https://www.theguardian.pe.ca/news/local/how-loki-7-bomber-roger-bell-became-a-police-task-forces-top-priority-251954/ taunted the police] under the alias, Loki 7.
*The Omnibus Counterterrorism Act of 1995 [https://www.congress.gov/bill/104th-congress/senate-bill/00390 did not pass the Senate] as S390. It also [https://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/104/s761 did not pass when it was introduced again] as S761.
*There is no solid evidence that there is any security camera footage of the bomb detonating. The [https://www.koco.com/article/witnesses-no-security-camera-videos-show-oklahoma-city-bombing-blast/4299527 former assistant building manager Richard Williams] testified that the cameras on the outside of the building had been not functional for two years at the point of the bombing. A Secret Service log references a tape of suspects exiting the Ryder truck, but it has been explained that [https://www.enidnews.com/news/local_news/trial-opening-over-video-of-oklahoma-city-bombing/article_f070fe71-783a-54ef-8cef-911e1506632d.html this log contained unconfirmed reports], and it is possible that this piece of information has been misconstrued.
*OKC Police Lt. Bill Martin, who had been quoted in Relevance saying that there had been fulminate of mercury taken out of the building, [https://oklahoman.com/article/2610442/lieutenant-tells-grand-jury-he-saw-no-explosive testified to a grand jury] that this was a "complete falsehood."
*There were two wave signals approximately 10 seconds apart on the morning of April 19, but [https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1029/96EO00269 subsequent studies have demonstrated] that this is [https://ui.adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2002AGUSM.U22A..05H/abstract indicative of one explosion, not two].

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan regroup and discuss the bizarre week that was on the Alex Jones Show.  In this installment, Alex discusses being too drunk to meet with the Secret Service at the RNC, tries to make Joe Rogan's Spotify contract about himself, and lets two dullards fill in for him. Also, Dan becomes drunk with power after uncovering a few new drops.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss the past week on the Alex Jones Show, where Alex repeatedly said he was going to take a few days off, then kept showing back up for cameos on the show.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/5/21/episode-435-may-18-21-2020 Episode 435: May 18-21, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex has a new pre-publish study from Australia (or Austria?) that he is using to argue that the coronavirus was man-made. This is [https://www.theweek.in/news/world/2020/05/19/novel-coronavirus-is-human-made-says-australia-study.html much less definitive] than he is reporting.
*Alex discusses Alex Azar saying that there aren't spikes being seen in areas that have reopened, but failed to point out that [https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa/no-spike-in-coronavirus-in-places-reopening-u-s-health-secretary-says-idUSKBN22T0HN he also said it was too early to determine the effects] of reopening.
*Alex misrepresents news about [https://www.kiro7.com/news/local/fda-halts-covid-19-in-home-test-kits-seattle/6ECNJ3HJYJFLJG6JCFBXW4ABHY/ a lab that was recently put on a temporary hold] by the FDA. They weren't shut down due to faulty tests, it was [https://www.geekwire.com/2020/coronavirus-tracking-project-backed-bill-gates-gets-put-hold-due-fda-concerns/ a technical matter about them having authorization to release results] to people who send in samples.
*Alex is mad at Melinda Gates wearing an upside-down cross in a recent TV interview. Alex thinks it's Satanic, but seems to be completely unaware that [https://www.catholic.com/magazine/online-edition/the-upside-down-cross-satanic-or-symbolic it is a very important symbol in Catholicism], the Cross of St. Peter. Incidentally, [https://www.worldvision.org/gender-equality-news-stories/melinda-gates-interview Melinda Gates is a very public member of the Catholic church].
*Alex makes up a Norse history for the peace symbol. In reality, [https://theweek.com/captured/737372/origin-story-peace-sign it was designed by artist Gerald Holtom in 1958], largely motivated by the nuclear disarmament movement. Alex thinks the peace symbol is the Norse symbol for death, because it looks like a tree. Alex is mixing up [https://norse-mythology.org/symbols/ Valknut] (a symbol of death) and [https://publicdomainreview.org/collection/yggdrasil-the-sacred-ash-tree-of-norse-mythology Yggdrasil] (which is a tree, but not a symbol of death).
*Alex misrepresents a story about a man wanted by the police in the UK for kissing a woman on the cheek. The reality of the story is that [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8326633/Police-launch-sexual-assault-appeal-lorry-driver-kisses-pensioner-woman-cheek.html the woman in question reported it to the police] and was distressed by the man's gesture.
*Alex claims that Hydroxychloroquine is one of the only treatments for respiratory conditions. [https://www.rtmagazine.com/products-treatment/pharmaceuticals/us-pharmaceuticals/pharmacological-treatment-of-respiratory-disorders/ This is not true].
*Alex claims that Hydroxychloroquine is one of the only treatments for lupus. While it is prescribed to manage lupus, [https://www.lupus.org/resources/medications-used-to-treat-lupus it is only one of many medications that are used in that context].
*Alex claims that hundreds and hundreds of studies have shown Hydroxychloroquine is 100% effective in treating coronavirus. There aren't even hundreds of studies about this question, and [https://www.cidrap.umn.edu/news-perspective/2020/05/studies-find-further-lack-covid-benefit-hydroxychloroquine the most recent ones have indicated that the medication doesn't do anything].
*Alex misrepresents [https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2020/05/200507121353.htm a study about Covid-19 mortality and Vitamin D deficiency]. Also, he mentions a doctor who got arrested for giving patients Vitamin C. [https://www.thedailybeast.com/detroit-doctor-charles-mok-charged-after-pushing-bogus-vitamin-c-infusions-as-covid-19-cure The story is more about fraud].
*Alex recommended his listeners take 100 mg of zinc daily, which will protect them from coronavirus, and apparently have no negative effects. [https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/2407097/ That dose can definitely have some negative effects].
*Greg Reece and Harrison Smith reveal that they don't know much about [https://www.healthknowledge.org.uk/public-health-textbook/research-methods/1a-epidemiology/epidemic-theory a virus's "basic reproduction number" and "effective reproduction number,]" and that neither of them thought to look into it before speculating about nonsense on air.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan explore some issues related to the end of last week on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Joe Rogan says that Alex is lying about his move to Spotify, Alex indicates a lack of awareness about the country's founding documents, and reveals that he may be communicating with Trump telepathically.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss the end of last week on the Alex Jones Show.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/5/24/episode-436-may-22-2020 Episode 436: May 22, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Joe Rogan completely contradicts Alex's narratives about his move to Spotify on a new episode of his podcast, featuring David Pakman.
*Owen Shroyer jokingly declares that his next rally has a goal of spreading the virus to as many people as possible. This joke is not funny now, and will be less so when we hear about the first cases that trace back to the rally.
*Alex appears to not know the difference between the [https://constitutionus.com/ Constitution] and the [https://www.archives.gov/founding-docs/declaration-transcript Declaration of Independence]. He also seems to think the amendments are the beginning of the Constitution.
*There are some pastors that are in favor of the stay-at-home orders, [https://www.baltimoresun.com/maryland/carroll/lifestyles/cc-rl-piel-050920-20200509-rzvmvq7uizfcnbwj2bz7cvgg5i-story.html like Rev. Piel].
*Churches are a particularly dangerous location for transmission, and there have been [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/apr/03/california-church-coronvirus-outbreak-sacramento cases of spread tracing back to churches,] and [https://nypost.com/2020/04/13/virginia-pastor-who-held-packed-church-service-dies-of-coronavirus/ a pastor who denied stay-at-home orders has died from Covid-19].
*Alex did not make up the [https://www.insider.com/mississippi-church-violated-coronavirus-orders-burnt-down-2020-5 story about a church being burned].
*Alex tries to use [https://time.com/5838863/ahmaud-arbery-police-tase-video/ a tape of Ahmaud Arbury from 2017] to make it seem like his being killed is less of an injustice. It is disgraceful.
*The man who beat up an elderly man at a hospital [https://www.foxnews.com/us/patient-beat-elderly-man-suffers-mental-issues suffered from mental illness] and [https://www.detroitnews.com/story/news/local/detroit-city/2020/05/24/man-20-faces-charges-beating-75-year-old-nursing-home-roommate/5252345002/ has been charged with a crime].
*[https://www.theguardian.com/science/2020/may/22/hydroxychloroquine-trumps-covid-19-cure-increases-deaths-global-study-finds A new study about hydroxychloroquine] appears to indicate a higher death rate of people who have taken the medication opposed to people who have not.
*There is [https://www.statnews.com/2020/03/11/researchers-rush-to-start-moderna-coronavirus-vaccine-trial-without-usual-animal-testing/ no law that says animal trials are required] for medical testing.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss a recent bit of news about their favorite Wacky Wednesday topic, the land of space weirdos called Project Camelot. In this installment, the gents take what could be their last walk through Camelot.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss an update to things in the world of Project Camelot. Kerry Cassidy announces that she is going to a subscription model with her videos behind a pay-wall, and thus the show's coverage of her interviews is likely coming to a close.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/1/episode-437-gawain-with-a-telescope Episode 437: Gawain With a Telescope]</ref>

For a last right, Dan and Jordan listen to her be interviewed by an Infowars associate named Shepard Ambeliss, which is very dumb.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss the week that was on the Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex attempts to take credit for Trump's executive order about social media, accuses Democrats of killing people in nursing homes, and the gents discuss Alex's response to the evolving situation in Minneapolis.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss the stretch of time where Alex responds to Trump finally seeming to come to his social media defense, and the protests in response to the killing of George Floyd begins.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/1/episode-438-may-26-28-2020 Episode 438: May 26-28, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex reports on [https://www.freedomfoundation.com/washington/washington-health-officials-gunshot-victims-counted-as-covid-19-deaths/ a report from the Freedom Foundation] about a few Covid-19 deaths being gunshot victims. This report itself is a misrepresentation of [https://www.freedomfoundation.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DOH-COVID-19-telebriefing.mp3 a Washington Department of Health press briefing], and this foundation is an anti-union think tank [https://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/Freedom_Foundation funded by right-wing billionaires].
*Alex complains that a murder victim was listed in the New York Times list of Covid-19 deaths, failing to recognize that [https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2020/may/24/new-york-times-lists-homicide-victim-coronavirus-d/ they released a correction] and fixed their error before the release of the late edition of the paper.
*Alex claims that 80% of Covid-19 deaths are people over 85. [https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/nvss/vsrr/covid_weekly/index.htm This is not true].
*[https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/69/wr/mm6919e5.htm The CDC's report] on excess deaths in New York City.
*Alex misrepresents [https://www.mlive.com/public-interest/2020/04/whitmer-orders-nursing-homes-to-transfer-coronavirus-patients-to-separate-units-or-special-facilities.html Michigan governor Gretchen Whitmer's April executive order] about [https://content.govdelivery.com/attachments/MIEOG/2020/04/15/file_attachments/1428213/EO%202020-50%20Emerg%20order%20-%20long-term%20care%20facilities.pdf nursing homes creating dedicated units] to treat Covid-19 patients.
*Alex gets very anti-Islam about [https://metro.co.uk/2020/05/05/call-prayer-broadcast-first-time-london-borough-lockdown-ramadan-12658639/ a few mosques being allowed to broadcast their call to prayer during Ramadan in London]. Alex pretends that anyone trying to broadcast some kind of Christianity would be shut down, which means he's never heard of [https://www.dnainfo.com/chicago/20160314/downtown/state-street-preacher-emblem-of-free-speech-chicago-after-trump-rally/ Chicago's "State Street Preacher.]"
*Alex is mad that some UK politicians are fasting in solidarity with Muslims during Ramadan, but he completely missed the story where [https://metro.co.uk/2020/04/27/lib-dem-tweets-picture-bacon-solidarity-muslims-fasting-ramadan-12616236/ one of them accidentally tweeted out a picture of bacon] to celebrate the beginning of the fast.
*Alex discusses Trump's antagonism toward mail-in voting. The reality is that [https://www.ncsl.org/research/elections-and-campaigns/all-mail-elections.aspx many states already use mail-in voting primarily], we have a well-established absentee voting process, and [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kayleigh-mcenany-vote-by-mail-record-comments-absentee/ Trump's spokesperson has used it in every election since 2008].
*The Brennan Center for Justice has cited [https://www.brennancenter.org/our-work/analysis-opinion/false-narrative-vote-mail-fraud rates of fraud related to mail-in voting] as being lower than [https://www.brennancenter.org/our-work/research-reports/debunking-voter-fraud-myth rates of in-person voting fraud].
*Alex complains that NY Health Department deleted something from their website. [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8360381/New-York-Health-Department-website-deletes-order-stating-nursing-homes-shouldnt-deny-admissions.html A spokesperson explained] that they just updated the guidance from the original declaration.
*Alex discusses [https://www.organicconsumers.org/news/another-gates-vaccine-bites-dust a Robert Kennedy Jr. article] about two Bill Gates-linked vaccine trials. [https://investors.modernatx.com/news-releases/news-release-details/moderna-announces-positive-interim-phase-1-data-its-mrna-vaccine Two of the primary sources] [https://www.immunology.ox.ac.uk/covid-19/covid-19-immunology-literature-reviews/chadox1-ncov-19-vaccination-prevents-sars-cov-2-pneumonia-in-rhesus-macaques cited in this article] seem to not match the content of the article, which is super suspicious.
*Alex appears to have admitted to being a lobbyist, and if he isn't lying, [https://smallbusiness.chron.com/federal-lobbying-guidelines-14110.html he may have committed a crime] if he didn't report these expenses.
*Alex begins to build a number of very racist narratives about the murder of George Floyd. Dan and Jordan discuss the ways he does so by comparing his use of language surrounding this event, as compared to instances where a non-white person kills a white person. It's like night and day.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss Alex Jones' coverage of the ongoing situation with nation-wide protests that have broken out. In this installment, Alex brings back his fake Soros/Antifa contracts in order to reintroduce Soros as his primary villain, responds to his fake tank getting chased away from a protest, and makes up stories about video clips he's seen online.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan continue their coverage of Alex's take on the ongoing protests in response to the killing of George Floyd.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/1/episode-439-may-29-31-2020 Episode 439: May 29-31, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex brings back his old Antifa/Soros contracts, which his intern found on 4chan and are very fake, in order to build the narrative that Soros is paying people to protest in order to cause chaos and take out Trump.
*Alex discusses how Floyd and the cop worked at the same bar, and decides they had to know each other. [https://kstp.com/news/george-floyd-fired-officer-overlapped-security-shifts-at-south-minneapolis-club-may-28-2020/5743990/ This is an unfair reading of the quote behind this story] from the bar's owner. Alex suggests that the killing was secretly an inter-gang thing involving a secret police gang.
*The cop [https://www.thedailybeast.com/minneapolis-man-alleges-derek-chauvin-tried-to-kill-him-before-he-kneeled-on-george-floyd had shot another dude in the past] when it didn't seem necessary.
*Some businesses in the area in Minneapolis are man, but others, like [https://indianexpress.com/article/trending/trending-globally/gandhi-mahal-restaurant-minneapolis-george-floyd-6434319/ Gandhi Mahal] and [https://corporate.target.com/article/2020/05/supporting-communities-minnesota-beyond Target], seem to be taking the long-view on things and are responding well.
*The government released [https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/29/politics/flynn-kislyak-transcripts-sent-to-congress/index.html transcripts of Gen. Flynn's phone calls] with Russian ambassador Sergei Kislyak, and they aren't great.
*Alex claims that the Rothschilds own The Economist, and use it to give out marching orders to their minions. The reality is that [https://www.politico.eu/article/agnellis-rothschilds-close-in-on-economist-magazine-sale-pearson/ the Economist's ownership is pretty complicated].
*Alex's friend from Blackwater was named in [https://www.wired.com/2012/07/blackwater-lawsuit/ a lawsuit alleging he falsified testing about contractors]. He was also [https://www.texastacticaltraininginstitute.com/pages/our-team with Blackwater from 2004-2012], so Alex should totally hate him.
*Alex appears to have taken a claim that Xi Jinping admires Hitler from a book by Bill Gertz. Gertz was recently fired by the Washington Free Beacon because [https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/rosiegray/a-conservative-journalist-admitted-to-taking-100000-from he took undisclosed payment from someone he covered]. This person happened to be the same person who [https://fortune.com/2018/12/18/stone-infowars-spread-lies-chinese-billionaire/ sued Roger Stone a while back for $100 million].
*Alex claims that Omar Jimenez, the CNN reporter who got arrested on air, was arrested because he was an operative running the protest behind the scenes. [https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/29/us/minneapolis-cnn-crew-arrested/index.html This is nonsense]. There are many incidents happening that [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8373001/Journalist-left-blind-one-eye-shot-rubber-bullet-Minneapolis-protest.html imply a targeting of journalist]s by police.
*Alex has heard that [https://www.kare11.com/article/news/local/george-floyd/minnneapolis-leaders-speak-on-riots-george-floyd/89-8dfdf050-39ef-4af8-8f00-0b0074df8fe2 some officials were saying that the protesters in Minneapolis were almost all from out of state]. An [https://www.kare11.com/article/news/investigations/kare-11-investigates-records-show-arrests-mostly-minnesotans-as-george-floyd-protests-riots-continue-minneapolis-st-paul/89-73f3e0e8-0664-41d5-8d3e-4467d04da7cb analysis of people arrested over the course of the protests] seems to contradict these claims and some officials have walked their comments back.
*Claims are made that George Floyd overdosed on cocaine. This is a misrepresentation of the [https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/6933246-Derek-Chauvin-Complaint.html preliminary coroner's report], combined with reports that [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8366533/George-Floyd-moved-Minneapolis-start-new-life-released-prison-Texas.html Floyd was arrested in 2005 with under a gram of cocaine].
*Alex uses black and white crime statistics, devoid of context, to try to dispute the point of the protests across the country. This is completely unrelated to the topic at hand, and is [https://www.splcenter.org/20180614/biggest-lie-white-supremacist-propaganda-playbook-unraveling-truth-about-%E2%80%98black-white-crime a standard tactic of the white supremacist community].
*Alex discusses a Twitter video someone posted saying that bricks were put somewhere to be used in a protest. The claims made in this video are not substantiated, but Alex is repeating them as if they are.
*Alex lies about a guy in Dallas who got beat up by protesters. Alex claims that he was beat up because he was white, when in reality, he was beaten up because [https://dfw.cbslocal.com/2020/05/31/victim-assault-video-dallas-confronted-protesters-machete-protect-neighborhood-police-say/amp/?__twitter_impression=true he was charging people with a machete].
*Alex reports on a QAnon conspiracy theory about MN Gov. Walz's daughter secretly commanding Antifa through her Twitter account.
*Millie Weaver shows up with a very confusing conspiracy theory that Alex doesn't seem to understand or care for.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan continue to track the abhorrent behavior of Alex Jones in the present day. In this installment, Alex is accused of burning a mattress, Alex and his staff make peace with military arresting citizens for breaking curfew, and Dan abuses Jordan with more fun drops.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss Alex Jones' descent into acceptance of military police arresting protesters for being out past curfew, which seems counter to any number of films called "Police State" that he sold earlier in his career.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/3/episode-440-june-1-2-2020 Episode 440: June 1-2, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex and Infowars have been accused of setting fire to a mattress owned by a man experiencing homelessness. There doesn't appear to be any proof that Alex or anyone from Infowars did this, and Dan discusses how making this accusation without proof is a detrimental strategy.
*Alex reports on a video he claims shows George Floyd dropping a bag of white powder while in police custody. The video is inconclusive, and Alex cannot prove that this is a bag of white powder, or even that Floyd dropped anything. (Not going to link to Alex's site, but you can find the video on his sites)
*Alex claims to have researched Floyd, but seems to have missed the part about [https://www.christianitytoday.com/news/2020/may/george-floyd-ministry-houston-third-ward-church.html his involvement in ministry].
*Alex's employee Savannah Hernandez expresses a position that if you don't resist arrest, police won't kill you. This is particularly dumb, considering [https://www.motherjones.com/crime-justice/2020/05/breonna-taylor-is-one-of-a-shocking-number-of-black-people-to-see-armed-police-barge-into-their-homes/ the case of Breonna Taylor], and this kind of position is absolutely counter to everything Infowars supposedly stands for.
*Alex claims that Acme Brick is setting up pallets of bricks for protesters to use around the country. He claims that Acme is owned by Bill Gates. The [https://brick.com/history-acme-brick history of the ownership of the company] is complicated, but ultimately it [https://www.berkshirehathaway.com/news/jun2000.html has been a subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway since 2000].
*Alex found the narrative about Acme Brick from a random QAnon twitter account named Elyse Cane. Elyse in no way proves that Acme Brick is dropping off bricks, and Alex can in no way demonstrate this claim.
*A new [https://www.newsweek.com/george-floyd-was-fentanyl-medical-examiner-says-experts-dispute-cause-death-1507982 release] from [https://www.nytimes.com/article/george-floyd-autopsy-michael-baden.html the Hennepin County Medical Examiner] has claimed that George Floyd had fentanyl in his system. Alex exaggerates this. There is uncertainty surrounding the various autopsies, but they all say it was murder.
*[https://www.kmov.com/news/4-st-louis-police-officers-shot-during-violent-protests-downtown/article_d8af5b24-a494-11ea-879e-bfa4a029a5ac.html 4 cops were shot in St. Louis], and [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/las-vegas-police-officer-shot-head/ one in Las Vegas]. Alex covers these stories, but refuses to acknowledge that [https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/01/us/louisville-protests-man-shot-dead/index.html a restaurateur was killed by cops in Louisville], and countless instances of police brutality were experienced by protesters around the country.
*Millie Weaver breaks a new scoop about having a mole inside the Sunrise Movement, but doesn't reveal anything interesting. Apparently, that is coming eventually.
*Millie also thinks that protesters become terrorists just by staying out past curfew. Something tells me she would not be a big fan of various instances of nonviolent resistance over history.
*Alex has his son on the show to discuss how he beat up someone at a convenience store.
*Alan Keys drops by to advocate for Trump calling up citizens to form militias. He also thinks Trump should deputize people.

title: 440: June 1-2, 2020

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan keep up with the current goings-on in the world of Alex Jones. In this installment, Alex interviews a couple doomed Congressional candidates, decides that Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump are Democrats and villains, and treads water with his anti-Antifa (pro-fa?) narratives.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss a couple of days in the middle of a very eventful week, and see how Alex Jones tries to deal with things.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/7/episode-441-june-3-4-2020 Episode 441: June 3-4, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex interviews Tom Speciale and Laura Loomer, who are both fringe candidates who are most likely destined to lose their Republican primaries. Going on Infowars isn't going to help their campaigns.
*Alex claims there are no right-wingers who are trying to infiltrate or impersonate antifa in order to make people scared of left-wing protesters. This is incorrect, since there is [https://www.fastcompany.com/90512186/white-nationalists-are-using-fake-antifa-twitter-accounts-to-disrupt-protests at least one concrete example of the American Identity Movement making a fake antifa Twitter account] to scare people and demonize protesters.
*Alex plays a clip of Ted Cruz yelling at Rod Rosenstein, but cuts the clip off before Rosenstein has a chance to respond. You can find the transcript [https://www.rev.com/blog/transcripts/rod-rosenstein-testimony-transcript-on-russia-investigation here].
*Alex and Laura Loomer pretend that people were offended that Trump held a Bible. In reality, people, including [https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/02/politics/gini-gerbasi-trump-church-cnntv/index.html Episcopal ministers] and [https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/jun/02/outrageous-christian-leaders-reject-trump-use-of-church-as-prop-during-george-floyd-protests bishops], were offended that Trump tear-gassed protesters to clear out the front of a church for a photo-op.
*Alex embellishes [https://www.statnews.com/2020/05/26/moderna-vaccine-candidate-trial-participant-severe-reaction/ the story of Ian Haydon], the Covid-19 vaccine volunteer who had an adverse reaction to the vaccine.
*Alex pretends that the stand-off at Tienanmen Square just happened, as opposed to it being the culmination of a student movement that he would almost certainly have been against if he was around back then.
*Alex interviews Hotep Jesus, who [https://www.rightwingwatch.org/post/right-wing-media-promote-an-anti-semitic-extremist-to-mock-starbucks-controversy/ seems to have some problems with Jews] and [https://www.thedailybeast.com/turning-point-usa-courts-activist-who-said-jews-want-the-destruction-of-the-black-community may be a bit of a Holocaust denier].
*Chris Redd has set up a GoFundMe to help support any protesters who may contract Covid-19 at the protests. [https://www.gofundme.com/f/covid19-protest-relief-fund/ Feel free to chip in].

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss Friday's episode of the Alex Jones Show and encounter some real stupidity. In this installment, Alex misrepresents some news about a retracted study and fails to explain a skull on his desk adequately. Also, Dan takes issue with Alex's vocabulary.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss a very word-heavy episode of The Alex Jones Show.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/8/episode-442-june-5-2020 Episode 442: June 5, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*A study about hydroxychloroquine has been [https://www.statnews.com/2020/06/04/lancet-retracts-major-covid-19-paper-that-raised-safety-concerns-about-malaria-drugs/ retracted by Lancet]. Alex misrepresents this retraction, and seems to be arguing that the original study was an attack on Trump. The reality is that [https://www.statnews.com/2020/06/03/hydroxychloroquine-does-not-prevent-covid-19-infection-in-people-who-have-been-exposed-study-says/ multiple] [https://www.statnews.com/2020/06/05/hydroxychloroquine-had-no-benefit-for-hospitalized-covid-19-patients-possibly-closing-door-to-use-of-drug/ studies] have come out recently that indicate that hydroxychloroquine is not an effective treatment for Covid-19.
*There was another [https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMoa2007621 study retracted by the New England Journal of Medicine], which Alex thinks was also about hydroxychloroquine, but it was actually about blood pressure medications. Alex does not understand [https://www.theguardian.com/science/2020/may/28/questions-raised-over-hydroxychloroquine-study-which-caused-who-to-halt-trials-for-covid-19 how these retractions came to happen], and how it all traces back to a company called Surgisphere, whose owner [https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/peteraldhous/image-manipulation-surgisphere-sapan-desai may or may not be shady].
*[https://nypost.com/2020/05/27/moderna-coronavirus-vaccine-tester-fainted-had-high-fever/ New York Post story] about Ian Haydon, who retweeted [https://investors.modernatx.com/news-releases/news-release-details/moderna-announces-first-participants-each-age-cohort-dosed-phase a Moderna press release] about the Covid-19 vaccine entering phase 2.
*Alex talks about the World Economic Forum's Great Reset idea. This is [https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2020/06/now-is-the-time-for-a-great-reset/ an op-ed] on their website as well as [https://intelligence.weforum.org/topics/a1G0X000006OLciUAG?tab=publications a gigantic information visualization]. Alex is making up stuff about both.
*Alex pretends that the current protesters want to kill cops, when in reality they are mostly arguing in favor of defunding and disbanding police departments. Conversely, Alex himself has frequently threatened the lives of literally all police in the country if they enforce hypothetical future gun regulations.
*Alex tries to explain why he has a chess board, a skull, and a rose on his desk. He is unsuccessful.
*Alex arbitrarily decides to announce that Bill Gates was running Epstein's entire operation, and thus accuses him, with no evidence, of engaging in rampant child abuse and making snuff films. He's lucky his targets are too busy to sue him.
*Alex plays Project Veritas's new video which pretends to expose antifa. This video [https://www.thedailybeast.com/project-veritas-uses-bookstore-from-portlandia-as-nefarious-antifa-hq is a complete load of shit], and most likely is a total fraud.
*Without evidence, Alex reports that George Floyd's death is being listed as a Covid-19 death. It is true that [https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/04/health/george-floyd-coronavirus-autopsy/index.html Floyd did test positive for Covid-19], but if you review [https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/nvss/vsrg/vsrg03-508.pdf the guidelines that the state of Minnesota released in April] about how to fill out death certificates, it seems incredibly unlikely that he would be listed as a Covid-19 death.
*Alex claims that the police in Melbourne are mostly minorities, but that does not appear to be true. Melbourne is a part of Victoria, and analyses from [http://johnbraithwaite.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/Note%20on%20the%20Demographic%20Composition%20of%20Australian%20Police%20Forces%20and%20Prisons%20Services.pdf 1979] and [https://researchbank.swinburne.edu.au/file/cbac5752-a103-44b8-acda-1bd155166f30/1/PDF%20%28Published%20version%29.pdf 2008] both show police departments that are definitely not mostly minorities. Beyond that, [http://www.policeaccountability.org.au/racial-profiling/will-a-more-diverse-police-force-reduce-racial-profiling/ there is not compelling evidence] that police officers of color are less likely to police in racially biased ways.
*Alex has no idea what happened regarding [https://ksltv.com/438915/utah-national-guardsmen-evicted-from-dc-hotels/ National Guard troops in Washington DC]. The mayor did not evict troops, [https://www.wusa9.com/article/news/verify/verify-no-dc-mayor-bowser-did-not-evict-national-guard-members-from-a-marriott-hotel/65-202afda1-1b47-4101-a4d2-7a9a0be6b7ed just refused to pay for their lodging].
*Alex claims that Lego has pulled sets including cops from the shelves. [https://factcheck.thedispatch.com/p/did-lego-pull-products-featuring This is not true], and is just a dumb propaganda narrative that was pushed by Trump's campaign staff, and failed congressional candidate Deanna Lorraine.
*Alex has learned how to pronounce the name Bolsonaro.
*Alex wants to outlaw "liberalism," which he seems to think means democrats, which it does not.
*Alex reads the Wikipedia page for Ochlocracy, thinking he's reading the definition of Oligarchy. He doesn't know what any of these words mean, and is just pulling things out of his ass.
*A caller from Northern Ireland thinks that Trump's election was prophesied by the Illuminati Card Game. This is very silly.
*A caller explains to Alex that his skull, chess board and rose could be easily interpreted as an occult altar, based on her experience as a former occult follower. Alex explains he was just trying to get attention.

title: 442: June 5, 2020

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss Alex Jones' half-day shift on his show from Tuesday. In this installment, Alex floats a weird Kennedy assassination theory and attempts to find some reformed leftists in his audience to call in to the show.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss Alex's half-shift at the job.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/10/episode-443-june-9-2020 Episode 443: June 9, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex believes that protesters are throwing themselves on cars in an attempt to recreate the events of the Unite the Right rally. This is nonsense, and over the weekend, a man in Seattle [https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/crime/man-shot-after-gunman-drives-car-into-capitol-hill-protesters/ drove into a crowd of protesters], and [https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/crime/gunman-accused-of-driving-into-george-floyd-protesters-and-shooting-a-man-held-on-investigation-of-assault/ then shot at them]. Alex is trying to provide cover for people attempting to hurt and kill protesters.
*Alex speculates that JFK was killed possibly because he supported disarming the American people. This is absurd. Alex discusses a CIA page referencing [https://famguardian.org/Subjects/GunControl/Law/freedom-from-war-state-dept-pub-7277.pdf Memorandum 7277], which is just a reading room entry that includes [https://www.cia.gov/library/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP88-01315R000300540023-8.pdf a newsletter from the Minutemen about the memo]. It means nothing.
*Alex discusses the case of James Marshall. You can find the video of him apparently shooting a man in a car [https://krdo.com/news/2020/06/06/video-shows-moments-surrounding-alamosa-protest-shooting/ here].
*Alex tries to take calls from "former leftists" or "former antifa members" who have woken up. This doesn't really work out.
*Alex complains that GoFundMe pages for David Dorn aren't making enough money, but as the [https://www.foxnews.com/us/st-louis-police-fake-gofundme-george-floyd-riots-david-dorn St. Louis police] and [https://kmox.radio.com/articles/news/scam-fake-gofundme-accounts-made-for-man-killed-by-looters St. Louis media] have reported, these are unauthorized fundraisers that they family is not involved in. They are scams, but Alex has no idea what he's talking about. Also, the Dorn family [https://backstoppers.org/assistance-to-the-family-of-capt-ret-david-dorn/ received $50,000 from BackStoppers].
*Steve Pieczenik thinks that Al Sharpton's name is Alan. It is not. It's Alfred.
*Steve Pieczenik thinks that there have been no US rocket launches in the US in the last 40 years. This is [https://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/shuttle/shuttlemissions/sts135/launch/sts-135_mission-overview.html absolutely not true].

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss a troubling day on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex becomes obsessed with a new video a nurse put out pushing Covid-19 conspiracies, declares that a "warlord" has taken over most of a US city, and Dan gets confused by InfoWars editing decisions.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss a troubling day on the Alex Jones Show where Alex is obsessed with a new video a nurse released about how Covid-19 is not real.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/23/episode-444-june-11-2020 Episode 444: June 11, 2020]</ref>

*The nurse who made the video in question, Marie Olszewski, has [https://opencorporates.com/companies/us_fl/N18000011610 founded multiple] [http://search.sunbiz.org/Inquiry/corporationsearch/SearchResultDetail?aggregateId=flal-l18000284117-c6d5c74a-e3f5-43e0-951b-d31ed09050dc&directionType=ForwardList&inquirytype=EntityName&listNameOrder=MYNTMOBILEYACHTSERVICES%20L190000529230&searchNameOrder=MYNURSEADVOCATE%20L180002841170&searchTerm=MYNT%20ALIGNMENT%20LLC anti-vax organizations] and [https://vaccinesworkblog.wordpress.com/2018/10/26/mrs-antivaxer-goes-to-atlanta/ made regular] [https://www.blogtalkradio.com/freedomizerradio/2018/11/12/forsaken-generation-on-with-erin-marie-rn media appearances] about the evils of vaccines in the past.
*Olszewski also has a tell-all book that is [https://www.amazon.com/Undercover-Epicenter-Nurse-Marie-Olszewski/dp/151076366X currently in pre-sales].
*There are many instances of attempted attacks or threats against hospitals recently. There was [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/missouri-man-planned-bomb-hospital-during-pandemic-get-attention-white-n1172346 a bomb plot in Missouri] that was foiled, the New York man who [https://www.foxnews.com/us/ny-man-homemade-bombs-stony-brook showed up at Stony Book hospital with weapons] and homemade bombs, and hospitals in [https://chicago.suntimes.com/2020/6/11/21288777/uic-hospital-cleared-bomb-threat-taylor Chicago] and [https://napavalleyregister.com/news/local/authorities-bomb-threat-phoned-to-st-helena-hospital-no-device-found/article_bbecb982-e1f1-54bd-a03d-bb3ca025b12c.html Napa Valley] that had to be evacuated after threats.
*The Seattle Coronavirus Assessment Network is [https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/health/seattles-coronavirus-surveillance-program-resumes-after-being-shut-down-by-the-fda/ back up and running], despite Alex's claims that they were shut down for fraud, which they were not.
*There are many accounts of medical professionals at the same hospital where Erin Olszewski worked, Elmhurst Hospital, who [https://zdoggmd.com/elmhurst-hospital/ do not have nice things to say about her].
*Prematurely born babies are at [https://www.verywellfamily.com/vaccines-in-premature-babies-2748584 a greater need for vaccines], and [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4685684/ research has not shown most vaccines to be any increased danger] for non-full term births.
*Alex accuses Seattle rapper Raz Simone of being an "African warlord" in the Seattle Autonomous Zone. This is just an expression of Alex's racism.
*Alex thinks a second wave of the coronavirus is coming, when in reality, most experts [https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/06/12/876224115/coronavirus-second-wave-nope-were-still-stuck-in-the-first-one don't think we've even actually made it through the first wave]. There are [https://projects.propublica.org/reopening-america/ many states] where cases are spiking.
*Alex discusses a man who was hit by a statue at a Portsmouth, VA protest. He misses [https://www.pilotonline.com/news/vp-nw-man-injured-20200611-3mp5z4smffanni7qr4dxkpja34-story.html a lot of the details] though.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss how last week ended on the Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex is convinced that a coup was announced on The Daily Show, reveals that he doesn't know anything about the Lincoln assassination, and Dan imagines what Alex's conversation with the Secret Service was like.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss the day after Alex Jones was obsessed about a video a nurse put out claiming doctors were killing Covid-19 patients. He seems to have completely forgotten about it already.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/23/episode-445-june-12-2020 Episode 445: June 12, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex believes that [https://www.forbes.com/sites/jackbrewster/2020/06/11/biden-warns-trump-may-try-to-steal-election/#18f54aa548c4 Joe Biden has announced a coup] against Trump while being a guest on the Daily Show.
*Dan unveils a sketch he wrote about Alex's interview with the Secret Service.
*Dan and Jordan argue about whether "turd blossom" is a compliment or insult.
*Alex thinks that Samuel Mudd was the only person other than John Wilkes Booth to be convicted in the assassination of Lincoln. This is very not true.
*Alex talks a lot about how great Robert E Lee was. He was not great, [https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2017/06/the-myth-of-the-kindly-general-lee/529038/ he was a piece of shit].

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan ease back into the recording with a bit of a wacky Infowars outing. In this installment, Owen Shroyer found a replica WWE championship belt and decides to hold an office-wide push-up contest, which of course Alex has to derail.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss Owen Shroyer's attempt at a fun WWE-style push up contest.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/23/episode-446-the-super-alpha-male-championship Episode 446: The Super Alpha Male Championship]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Owen doesn't realize that he's using a tag team belt for an individual competition, which makes no sense. The current holders of that belt are The New Day, who are one of the most important black groups in WWE history.
*Dan discusses how Owen's attempt at cutting a wrestling promo about the contest is a failure, by juxtaposing it with two classic promos.
*Alex bum-rushes Owen's show to try to steal the belt, which leads to a fake fight, and ultimately Owen pretending to murder Alex by strangulation. Alex is clearly very impaired, and it's embarrassing all around.

details_html: Today, after too long a time since Part 1, Dan and Jordan get back on track with trying to follow the path of Bill Cooper's coverage of the bombing of the Murrah Building in Oklahoma City. In this installment, the gents gain some extra insight into Bill from his biography, learn about one of Bill's listener's relationship with their dad, and reveal what Dan learned that made him dance around his apartment.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan get back to exploring Bill Cooper's coverage in the days after the bombing of the Murrah Building in Oklahoma City. Much of the information discussed in this episode comes from the excellent book by Mark Jacobson called [https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00OQS4DYQ/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1 Pale Horse Rider].<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/23/episode-447-bill-cooper-covers-okc-part-2 Episode 447: Bill Cooper Covers OKC Part 2]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Bill recognizes that his audience is growing since the bombing, which is a common phenomenon among conspiracy broadcasters.
*Bill is convinced that the bomb had to have destroyed the axle that investigators found. Early on in the morning, [https://www.the-review.com/news/20200417/25-years-later-canal-fulton-officer-remembers-oklahoma-bombing a firefighter noticed the axle], which wasn't considered important until later.
*Bill believes that Clinton folks did the OKC bombing to take control of Congress. The GOP retained control of both the House and Senate in the 1996 election.
*Bill continues to make the "multiple sound waves" evidence the central piece of his conspiracy theory. The source of his information seemed to refute Bill's interpretation when [https://oklahoman.com/article/2500802/conspiracy-theories-flourish-on-radical-shortwave-radio contacted by The Oklahoman].
*Bill probably met Timothy McVeigh prior to the bombing.
*Bill mentions Larry Nichols.
*Bill's [https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/1995/07/09/oklahoma-bombing-conspiracy-theories-ripple-across-the-nation/4aa19b55-7004-41d9-b840-f0e486adadd3/ theory about Hillary being indicted] is [https://www.factcheck.org/2019/03/baseless-oklahoma-city-bombing-conspiracy-theory/ gaining a new life in 2020]. Time is a flat circle.
*Almost all of Bill's information is coming from Michelle Moore, a ballet teacher from Oklahoma, who he's decided to call his "station chief." Her messages are often overly-familiar in their tone, as in this episode where she complains that her dad doesn't like militias, and is therefore the enemy.
*Bill is into the Constitution Party, which is a real weak party.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss Alex Jones' triumphant (horrible) return to studio after his vacation. In this installment, Alex insists that Trump's Tulsa rally was actually a big success, gets really sloppy about making up details about stories, and repeatedly prays for the deaths of his imagined enemies.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss Alex's return to the studio after a week off, which was apparently spent on vacation at the Gulf of Mexico.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/23/episode-448-june-21-22-2020 Episode 448: June 21-22, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*In an attempt to sound not racist, Alex says there are no races of humans, but there are breeds. This is way more racist, and scientifically [https://evolution-outreach.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12052-019-0109-y makes no sense].
*Alex claims he had advance knowledge of [https://www.npr.org/2020/06/20/881148365/geoffrey-berman-u-s-attorney-who-prosecuted-trump-allies-says-he-wont-quit Trump's plan to fire SDNY prosecutor Geoffrey Berman]. If he's not lying, he may end up having to testify about that.
*Alex discusses the story about homeless German children being given to pedophile foster parents. This is [https://www.dw.com/en/germany-allowed-pedophiles-to-foster-children/a-53839291 a real story], and a serious matter, but Alex's version of it does not match any available information.
*This story has been [https://www.irishtimes.com/life-and-style/health-family/germany-s-secret-paedophilia-experiment-1.2897942 reported as far back as 2016], but there is new information available now, after the release of a report by the University of Hildesheim ([https://hildok.bsz-bw.de/frontdoor/index/index/searchtype/latest/docId/1092/start/0/rows/1 German]/[https://scholar.googleusercontent.com/scholar?as_sdt=0%2C14&as_yhi=2020&as_ylo=2020&hl=en&q=cache%3Aled2SuL_HqsJ%3Ascholar.google.com%2F English])
*Alex claims the children affected were taken from their mostly Christian parents, but none of the available information supports that, and he has not demonstrated it at all.
*Alex claims that this was happening all around Western Germany, but in reality, the reports available are all about West Berlin. Berlin is in the East of Germany.
*Alex desperately tries to pretend that Trump's rally was a huge victory and the turn-out would have been great if not for the sabotage of the internet teens, who were working for the Democrats.
*[https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/22/politics/two-staffers-coronavirus-trump-rally/index.html Two Trump staffers who were at his Tulsa rally] have tested positive for the coronavirus since the rally. This brings the total of confirmed cases just in Trump's staff for the Tulsa rally to 8.
*Alex claims that Dr. Fauci released HIV. The first human case [https://www.theaidsinstitute.org/education/aids-101/where-did-hiv-come-0#:~:text=The%20earliest%20known%20case%20of,became%20infected%20is%20not%20known.) traces back to 1959], when Fauci was 19.
*Trump said at his rally that he asked his administration to slow down Covid-19 testing. His spokesperson then said he said that in jest. Then [https://www.cnn.com/videos/politics/2020/06/23/donald-trump-i-dont-kid-contradicts-officials-joke-bash-crn-sot-vpx.cnn Trump said he wasn't joking]. Trump has a deep [https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/497846-trump-says-testing-may-be-frankly-overrated history of being opposed to testing], reportedly because [https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-news/trump-coronavirus-testing-reelection-966872/ he doesn't like how high numbers make him look bad].
*Alex constantly prays for God's vengeance to be enacted on his enemies. Alex often talks about how his listeners can be instruments of God's vengeance, so it's pretty easy to see this as him begging his audience to kill his enemies.
*Alex lies about a story involving 150 cannery workers who [https://ktla.com/news/local-news/150-cannery-workers-are-in-forced-quarantine-at-l-a-hotel-without-pay-suit-claims/ were held at an LA hotel] without pay due to coronavirus quarantine. The story is about a company mistreating migrant labor, but Alex reports it as a story about California Gov. Newsom being evil.
*Alex reports on a troll Facebook page called Disciples of Lucifer, who had made a bunch of events for fake marches to create a One World Government in various cities. They did this back in Feb. 2019, and no marches ever seem to have materialized. In 2019, [https://texarkanafyi.com/only-christians-show-up-for-planned-luciferian-march-in-texarkana/ folks showed up in Texarkana] to counter-protest the non-existent march, and [https://ranchmatterscrr.com/luciferian-march-salem-oregon/ people in Salem] did the same thing this year.
*Trump claimed that Biden apologized to him for saying that the travel ban from China was xenophobic. This apology [https://www.statesman.com/news/20200505/fact-check-did-biden-send-trump-apology-letter-over-china-ban never happened], and neither did [https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/27/donald-trump/fact-checking-whether-biden-called-trump-xenophobi/ Biden calling the ban that].
*Alex gets freaked out by a [https://www.wsj.com/articles/looking-forward-to-the-end-of-humanity-11592625661 Wall Street Journal article about transhumanism] that he didn't read. He just spends his time on air making up stuff about the article.
