details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan check in on a very exhausting couple days on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex tries to launch a distasteful and racist national movement destined for failure, decides he now hates Gov. Abbott, and consoles two of his friends who've recently lost their social media.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss a couple episodes of the Alex Jones Show, where Alex spends most of his time trying to console his friends who've been kicked off social media.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/6/25/episode-449-june-23-24-2020 Episode 449: June 23-24, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex is trying to start a new national movement against mask-wearing called [https://wecantbreathe.news/ We Can't Breathe]. It's a disgraceful and racist idea, and is almost certainly going to be a giant failure. [http://wecantbreathe.org/ We Can't Breathe] is already the name of a community organization.
*Alex's movement seems to mostly about a march in Austin against mask-wearing. [https://dshs.texas.gov/coronavirus/additionaldata/ Covid-19 cases are currently exploding in Texas], so this is probably going to end poorly.
*Alex implies that the [https://pagesix.com/2020/06/23/steve-bing-suicide-spurred-by-money-drugs-and-mental-health-struggle/ recent death by suicide of producer Steve Bing] was somehow related to pedophilia. There is no evidence to support this claim.
*Alex interviews Gavin McInnes about how he got kicked off YouTube. It's very sad, and is mostly a plug for Gavin's depressing subscription site Censored Dot Tv.
*[https://twitter.com/goldsbie/status/1174767491261898753?lang=en Gavin McInnes has done blackface]. Also, he's written op-eds [https://www.fivefeetoffury.com/2014/03/07/gavin-mcinnes-whats-wrong-with-blackface/ defending blackface].
*Alex interviews James O'Keefe and his new "Facebook whistleblower" Zach McElroy. Zach actually worked for Cognizant, which is a different company, which Facebook contracted to do moderation work. All of the information Zach has revealed is inconclusive, and at worst implicates Cognizant, not necessarily Facebook.
*It was widely reported in late 2019 that [https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-50247540 Cognizant was stepping away from content moderation] on social media. They [https://www.crn.com/news/channel-programs/cognizant-laying-off-6-000-as-it-exits-content-moderation-business-linked-with-facebook laid off 6,000 employees], and much of the work is now done by [https://www.cnet.com/news/facebook-content-moderation-is-an-ugly-business-heres-who-does-it/ the many other companies who Facebook contracts], where Zach did not work.
*California does have [https://abc7.com/masks-face-coverings-order-statewide/6254439/ a number of exemptions] for certain people who are not required to wear masks.
*California was not the state that set a precedence about making rules for mask-wearing. [https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/19/us/states-face-mask-coronavirus-trnd/index.html The first state was New Jersey], back on April 8.
*[https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/24/us/oregon-county-people-of-color-mask-trnd/index.html Lincoln County in Oregon] had an exemption for people of color not having to wear masks. They were bombarded with complaints, and [https://www.statesmanjournal.com/story/news/2020/06/24/oregon-coronavirus-lincoln-county-mask-ordinance-covid-19/3247895001/ retracted that exemption].
*Arthur Koestler's book [https://archive.org/details/TheGhostInTheMachine/mode/2up The Ghost In The Machine] does not argue in favor of cannibalism and human sacrifice.
*Bubba Wallace [https://www.al.com/motorsports/2020/06/timeline-of-how-bubba-wallace-noose-was-found-and-reported.html did not report the noose] that was found in his garage. He only became aware of it after NASCAR officials were alerted to it.
*Alex got tricked by the [https://www.newsweek.com/face-mask-exemption-cards-fake-1513402 fake Mask Exemption Cards] that people were posting on social media. This was a fraud carried out by a group called the [https://web.archive.org/web/20200624214535/https://www.ftbagency.com/ Freedom To Breathe Agency], which isn't a real agency.
*Carpe Donktum is [https://forbes.com/sites/rachelsandler/2020/06/24/parents-to-sue-trump-meme-creator-carpe-donktum-over-manipulated-video-of-toddlers/#299ef8241e27 probably getting sued] by the parents of children that he used in a recently popular race-baiting meme that Trump retweeted.

title: 449: June 23-24, 2020

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan check in on how last week ended on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex desperately tries to attack the idea of wearing masks, promotes his anti-mask rally, and gets humiliated by one of his anti-communist heroes.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss a couple days on The Alex Jones Show where Alex is trying very hard to demonize the idea of wearing masks to limit the spread of Covid-19.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/7/19/episode-450-june-25-26-2020 Episode 450: June 25-26, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex has seen some viral videos purporting to show that wearing masks raises CO2 levels you're breathing to dangerous levels. This [https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/masks-dangerous-health/ has been debunked], and is kind of silly even just at face value. If wearing a mask for a short period of time had any legitimate health risks, there would be many activities that would be nearly impossible, like motorcycle trips or skiing.
*Alex rewrites the story of the noose that was found at Bubba Wallace's NASCAR garage in order to turn it into a story of a racism-hoax. His details of the story are inaccurate.
*Alex hand-waives the rising cases of Covid-19 in the US because there are not also sharply increasing death numbers. This does not take into account that deaths are a lagging indicator when it comes to health emergencies. Typically death numbers do not rise immediately, it takes a while after case numbers rise.
*Alex says that his enemies need to "go on helicopter rides," which is a reference to the way Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet would kill his political rivals. Pinochet has become a bit of a hero of the current fascist right-wing, mostly because they know they can't get away with wearing shirts that say "Hitler Did Nothing Wrong."
*Alex thinks that Hillary Clinton and Obama are going to run for president and vice president in the 2020 election. It is too late for them to run within the Democratic party, and it seems entirely unbelievable to think they'd run third party. Alex is kind of just making stuff up.
*Alex claims that Black Lives Matter wants to destroy the nuclear family. This is just an intentional misrepresentation of [https://www.mediamatters.org/black-lives-matter/right-wing-media-claim-black-lives-matter-advocates-against-family-through their actual position]. If you read their statement of beliefs, it's clear that it's about viewing each other as family, regardless of blood relation, not about destroying any family structure. They're also very explicit about respecting parental relations, which upholds familial structures.
*Alex and his guest, Rev. Childress, discuss how Martin Luther King Jr. was against riots. This is in opposition to one of [https://time.com/3838515/baltimore-riots-language-unheard-quote/ his most famous quotes], and [https://timeline.com/by-the-end-of-his-life-martin-luther-king-realized-the-validity-of-violence-4de177a8c87b the later positions he was coming to] before his assassination. It's a longstanding tradition to shame protesters for not being saintly enough to have their concerns heard, and this is just Alex's racist version of it.
*Alex and Childress lie about the relationship between Hitler and Planned Parenthood founder Margaret Sanger. Sanger was [https://www.nyu.edu/projects/sanger/articles/sanger-hitler_equation.php explicitly anti-Nazi], and Hitler hated Sanger because she worked to increase access to birth control. If all the Aryan women were able to make their own decisions about reproduction, it would hurt the growth of the Third Reich, which was a big concern of his. Sanger and Hitler were not on the same page, regardless of what anti-abortion liars say over and over.
*Alex pretends that Joe Biden actually said that 120 million people in the US have died from Covid-19, when in reality he had just misspoke. Alex forgot to cut off the part of the clip where Biden begins to correct himself, because he's terrible at his job.
*Alex incorrectly reports that the CDC says that masks don't work at all. He claims that they admit that you wearing a mask will not stop you from spreading the virus, if you're sick. In reality, [https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prevent-getting-sick/cloth-face-cover.html the page he's found on the CDC website] is about masks with valves, which most everyday masks do not have. This story is a dud. You can find [https://www.insider.com/masks-with-a-breathable-valve-are-useless-experts-warn-2020-5 tons of stories] from [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-8266171/Bay-Area-says-masks-valves-not-acceptable-face-protection-amid-coronavirus-pandemic.html back in April] and [https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/05/27/nation/wearing-face-mask-with-valve-it-might-be-time-find-something-else-some-experts-say/ May about how] [https://www.fastcompany.com/90496717/what-is-a-mask-valve-and-why-are-cities-banning-them masks with valves are not effective] at stopping viral transmission.
*Alex has started a website called We Can't Breathe, attempting to hijack the police brutality movement and use it against masks. It's pathetic, racist, and also doesn't seem to be working. Anyway, [https://www.statesman.com/news/20200627/adler-austin-has-nationrsquos-highest-7-day-metro-positivity-rate-of-coronavirus-tests?fbclid=IwAR3eVRaU0q5ar41HreYzSjKRrLTQP_pi8Df5mfqOQUHa_fdp_ssduAK9d5Q&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=web_push cases of Covid-19 in Austin are exploding], so this is a really bad idea.
*Alex tries to interview his anti-communist hero G. Edward Griffin, but unfortunately Griffin is not really all that into Trump. Because Alex is a coward and can't argue with someone with as high of stature as Griffin, and because Griffin doesn't give a shit about Alex's scam, this leads to Alex suggesting that the Globalists actually wanted Trump to get elected to negotiate a better position with China. He will absolutely forget about this and never bring it up again.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan take an exhaustive look at two shows Alex Jones recorded on July 2nd. In his morning show, Alex rambles about cyborgs and puts off covering big news about the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell. To make up for not getting to it on his normal show, Alex returns to air in the evening and tries to cover the big news of the day, with depressing results.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss two shows that Alex Jones recorded on July 2, one in the daytime, and one in the depressing nighttime hours.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/7/19/episode-453-july-2-2020 Episode 453: July 2, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex claims that he's been covering Jefferey Epstein for 15 years. There is no evidence of that on Infowars' website, nor on his mirror site, Prison Planet.

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/1595218479899-Z46PF38RH7KLDYH27GLR/NoEpsteinOnPrisonPlanet.JPG|thumb|none]]

*Alex has absolutely no idea how to pronounce Ghislaine Maxwell's name.
*Alex pretends that the removal of Geoffrey Berman, attorney at the Southern District of NY, was due to Berman not allowing the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell to happen. No evidence for this is provided, and it seems more likely that he was removed because he was investigating Trump's associates.
*Alex interviews a guy named Larry Gaiters, who claims that various words have completely made up roots. He says that "negro" comes from the Greek word "necro" ([https://www.etymonline.com/word/negro it does not]) and that the word media comes from the Hebrew word for witches.
*Alex misrepresents [https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2020/05/cdc-and-states-are-misreporting-covid-19-test-data-pennsylvania-georgia-texas/611935/ an Atlantic article from May] about Covid test reporting inconsistencies. He claims that numbers are all just being made up, but this article is about how there were some states that were reporting negative results to viral and antibody tests as a single figure, which makes the data difficult to interpret. This was brought up, and corrected.
*Alex [https://www.nber.org/papers/w27408.pdf lies about a study] about how cities that had Black Lives Matter protests in them actually saw increased social distancing behavior, and it may have helped decrease transmission. Alex hasn't read the study, and is just making up what it says.
*Alex realized that he did a bad job on his regular show, so he returns in the evening to do a 2 hour special emergency report about Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest. He seems very drunk, says nothing meaningful, rants about his ex-wife, almost starts crying a few times, and bails with half an hour left in the planned show. It was an absolutely embarrassing and childish display, but far from the worst Alex has been on air.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan travel back to the past for a special requested episode. In this installment, Alex Jones discusses every fact on Earth about soil, reveals that he's never read the book his worldview is based on, and hero-worships someone who would end up suing him a few years later.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan go back to 2013 to create a time capsule for a listener.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/7/20/episode-454-december-17-2013 Episode 454: December 17, 2013]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex lies about a headline regarding the repayment of money GM got in the bailout. The confusion is about the head of GM saying that [https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/cars/2013/12/16/general-motors-gm-bailout-repayment/4043607/ the company will not pay back all $10 billion] that was part of the package. This is because not all of that money was a loan, and there was no obligation for them to repay money that wasn't a loan. A lot of the money that was used to bail out GM was in the form of government buying stock, and GM is not required to repay that. Ultimately, [https://money.cnn.com/2014/05/29/news/companies/gm-profit-bailout/index.html GM did pay back everything they owed]. If you want to argue that they should have paid back more, that's an okay position to have, but it's a different point than Alex was trying to make.
*Alex lies about GM plants in China creating cars for the US market. There are factories in China because there is a giant car market in China. [https://www.cnn.com/2019/09/05/business/trump-barra-gm-fact-check/index.html Approximately 1% of US GM sales are cars from China].
*Alex tries to scare his audience about Google buying robotics companies, saying they're trying to create a robot army. Google had [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/google-buys-8-robotics-companies-in-6-months-why/ recently bought some robotics companies], but [https://www.vox.com/2017/6/8/15766440/softbank-alphabet-google-robotics-boston-dynamics-schaft they've since sold them]. They were investments and part of their developmental wing.
*Alex exaggerates the level of scurvy that people in the US experience in the present day. There are [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2567249/#:~:text=8-,Deficiency,of%20irregular%20or%20inadequate%20intake. some people who will get scurvy], but most people who are at risk are people who have other related factors in their lives, like alcoholism or drug abuse, which affect their body's absorption of vitamin C.
*Alex lies about salt not having iodine in it. He specifically uses a sea salt to make his point, but fails to clarify that it's a commonly-known fact that [https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/nutrition-and-healthy-eating/expert-answers/sea-salt/faq-20058512 sea salt doesn't contain iodine]. Table salt still does, and almost everyone in the US gets plenty of iodine that way.
*Alex lies about [https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/soil-depletion-and-nutrition-loss/ an article in Scientific American] about soil depletion. The short version of this is that scientists have studied soil depletion, and they initially believed that it was likely the result of non-organic agricultural practices. Subsequent research has shown that [https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/observations/vanishing-nutrients/ it is more likely that the phenomenon is related to climate change], and that vitamin/mineral depletion is connected to increased levels of CO2.
*Alex insults Caitlin Upton, the woman who competed at the 2007 Miss Teen USA pageant and had a bad answer about education. Two people who Alex loves in 2020 were big fans of Ms. Upton. [https://web.archive.org/web/20071029125549/http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/story/0%2C23663%2C22450632-10229%2C00.html Trump signed her to a lucrative modeling contract] (and owned the pageant at the time), and [https://www.refinery29.com/en-us/2019/03/226869/tucker-carlson-miss-teen-usa-comments Tucker Carlson went on a radio show] and said that Upton would make a good wife because she was so dumb.
*Alex talks to Anthony Guciardi, who is basically just there to do an infomercial for Alex's supplement line.
*Alex interviews the guy who owns the radio station that airs his show in the Chicago area.
*Alex interviews Larry Klayman, who would go on to sue Alex in 2019.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan check back on what's been going on in the present day of The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex reveals that he's been an enemy of antifa for 20 years and discusses having his mind blown out on a boat on July 4th, possibly because of "planets aligning."
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss some episodes of The Alex Jones Show where Alex discusses his Fourth of July experiences.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/7/20/episode-455-july-7-8-2020 Episode 455: July 7-8, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex lies about CNN not covering the stories about the Chinese government's treatment of the Uyghur people. If you take any time at all to look into it, you'll find a lot of reporting on CNN about the story, like [https://www.cnn.com/interactive/2020/02/asia/xinjiang-china-karakax-document-intl-hnk/ this], [https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/19/asia/xinjiang-explainer-intl-hnk-scli/index.html this], [https://www.cnn.com/2019/01/18/asia/uyghur-china-detention-center-intl/index.html this] or [https://www.cnn.com/2018/02/02/asia/china-xinjiang-detention-camps-intl/index.html this].
*Alex claims his friend Steve Mason warned him about antifa 20 years ago. This is almost certainly bullshit.
*Roger Stone appears to beg for a pardon, and claims that Bill Clinton was having an affair with Ghislaine Maxwell, whose name he also does not know how to pronounce.
*Alex claims that on July 4, the planets aligned, which won't happen again until 2161. It is actually impossible for the planets to physically align, that's just an expression that is used to describe a situation when planets appear in the same area in the sky. Alex just got this 2161 nonsense from a Facebook meme.
*Alex claims that crime goes up during full moons. [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1444800/?page=1 A study from 1984] did find a correlation between crime and the full moon, but subsequent studies have been very mixed in their findings.
*Alex claims that he inspired the Foo Fighter's song The Pretender. This seems very unlikely.
*A caller asks Alex to name the members of the "council of 12" that he's said run the world. Alex cannot come up with anything better than "there are two Rothschilds' on there." It's pathetic.

title: 455: July 7-8, 2020

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss the end of the last week on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex wrestles with the "Wayfair Conspiracy" and celebrates Roger Stone's clemency by interviewing Mancow.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan check in on Alex's show to see how he handles the news of Roger Stone receiving clemency.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/7/20/episode-456-july-9-11-2020 Episode 456: July 9-11, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Alex [https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/testimony-biotech-company/ lies about Stanford] ordering beating baby hearts.
*Alex misleadingly discusses the [https://www.texasrighttolife.com/newly-uncovered-documents-show-fda-spent-nearly-100000-on-baby-body-parts-to-make-humanized-mice/ FDA having contracts] for stem cell research.
*Alex lies about Roger Stone getting booted from social media. [https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-53347793 According to Facebook], he was operating over 50 pages in coordination, which is against terms of service.
*Alex lies about [https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/united-states/2020-06-15/americas-democratic-unraveling an article in Foreign Affairs] titled America's Democratic Unraveling. Alex says this article is about signaling a military coup against Trump, but he's just making that up.
*Alex lies about [https://www.stamfordadvocate.com/opinion/article/Trump-could-lose-and-not-leave-But-Cabinet-15396854.php an article] which was discussing the possibility of Trump not leaving office after losing the 2020 election. The article is just about how if executive branch employees aided Trump in not leaving office, they would be open to criminal prosecution. Alex claims that this is about threatening anyone who supports Trump.
*Alex claims that the CDC has admitted Covid-19 is not an epidemic. This is just cherry-picking and playing games with [https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/covid-data/covidview/index.html information actually on the CDC's website].
*Alex lies about [https://www.npr.org/2020/07/09/889562040/supreme-court-rules-that-about-half-of-oklahoma-is-indian-land the lawsuit involving the Supreme Court] ruling that about half of Oklahoma is technically Creek land.
*Alex got [https://www.ndtv.com/offbeat/this-video-of-a-monkey-wearing-a-face-mask-will-leave-you-in-stitches-2259016 tricked by an old viral video] of a monkey wearing a scarf on its head, which he claims is the result of monkeys seeing us wearing masks. The video predates Covid, and Alex is very dumb.
*Alex lies about [https://news4sanantonio.com/news/local/tdem-you-should-consider-wearing-a-mask-even-when-youre-in-your-own-home a Texas official suggesting that people should wear masks at home]. The official, Nim Kidd, suggested this could be a good idea if you're in a multi-generational home and are not able to distance/protect yourself when you're in public, but Alex pretends that he's saying everyone should always wear a mask at home, which is a lie.
*Alex makes up that the Texas Division of Emergency Management takes orders from the WHO Health Emergencies Program. This is not true, [https://tdem.texas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/2020-Emergency-Management-Annex-ESF-5.pdf they are under the governor of Texas].
*Alex misrepresents [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2v3vlw14NbM comments made by Dr. Michael Ryan], Executive Director of the WHO Health Emergencies Program, back in March. In proper context, Ryan's comments in no way apply to the current situation in the US. He was talking about late-stage monitoring of cases once an outbreak has been gotten under control.
*Alex claims that Goldman Sachs is getting ready for a coup against Trump. The reality is that they're just [https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/08/goldman-warns-delayed-election-results-this-november-similar-to-bush-gore-could-rock-the-market.html advising their customers that they should hedge their investments until the end of the year], largely because of uncertainty around the election. Factors like mail-in voting and the virus make it so it is very likely that results will be delayed, which [https://www.marketwatch.com/story/how-wall-street-reacts-to-election-recounts-2016-11-28 caused market volatility in 2000].
*Savannah Hernandez claims that Hillary Clinton planted the seed that Trump wouldn't leave office. In reality, [https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2020/02/trump-jokes-rigged-elections-chaos.html Trump has joked constantly about not leaving office]. It's one of his favorite jokes.
*Owen Shroyer calls left-wing protesters "obstacles to freedom." He expresses support for running people over, which is [https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/07/08/vehicle-ramming-attacks-66-us-since-may-27/5397700002/ something that has happened at least 66 times] since May 27.
*Alex lies about the CIA running the newsletter On Target. That was actually [https://www.columbiatribune.com/article/20090806/News/308069706 written by The Minutemen], the violent right-wing anti-communist militia ran by Robert DePugh. An issue of On Target appears in the CIA's online reading room because it was part of their observation of DePugh, not because they wrote it. The fact that Alex is reporting that is very troubling.
*Alex reveals that he thinks all news stories he reads are Globalist psych warfare, and thus, when he reads a story he knows that it's a white-wash, so he's free to make up his own exaggerated version of the story, which must be reality. This is incredibly troubling to hear, because it's basically Alex saying "I have created a rationalization for why it's cool for me to lie about everything."

title: 456: July 9-11, 2020

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan keep track of two ongoing storylines on The Alex Jones Show that probably shouldn't be ongoing storylines. The first is the conspicuous absence of Roger Stone on Alex's show since he got saved from prison. The second is Alex weirdly trying to talk himself into promoting the Wayfair Conspiracy. No reason for any of this to be happening.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan track the stories happening on the Alex Jones Show.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/7/20/episode-457-july-12-13-2020 Episode 457: July 12-13, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Roger Stone continues to not appear on Infowars, most likely because he got a nice check to give Sean Hannity the exclusive first interview, and Alex is an afterthought to him.
*After initially declaring the Wayfair conspiracy a Globalist honey-trap, Alex has decided that there's more to this story, and Wayfair is most likely actually selling humans. It's very sad.
*Alex reports [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8515507/Young-mother-24-shot-dead-fianc-saying-lives-matter.html a false, and racist, version of a story] of a woman who was killed in Indianapolis. The story is very sad, but Alex has created aspects of the story, and ignored others, to make it seem like the victim was killed because she was white. The way he reports on this story is a fingerprint of his racism.
*Alex reports on another story in a racist fashion. [https://nypost.com/2020/07/13/bronx-man-charged-for-stabbing-pair-of-elders-on-subway/ A man stabbed two elderly men on a train] in New York. In Alex's reporting, the man stabbed the victims because they were white. This is not clear from any reporting on the story, and appears to be his own creation which he does not prove at all.
*Alex is upset that the couple in St. Louis [https://www.foxnews.com/us/missouri-couple-who-defended-home-have-rifle-seized-during-police-search-report had their home searched]. There's [https://www.thetrace.org/2020/07/armed-st-louis-missouri-couple-threat-brandishing-self-defense/ an open question] about whether or not Patricia McCloskey pointing a gun at protesters constituted illegal brandishing of a gun.
*Alex claims that antifa protested an anti-pedophilia rally in Ireland. In reality, the rally was being run by Justin Barrett, who is a pretty well known fascist, [https://the-beacon.ie/2020/01/31/in-the-mind-of-justin-barrett-ireland-will-be-saved-by-installing-a-catholic-dictatorship/ who believes that Ireland should be a Catholic dictatorship]. Barrett has [https://www.irishtimes.com/news/neo-nazis-affirm-links-with-youth-defence-1.1098966 spoken multiple times at events] held by the German Neo-Nazi party NDP, once even sharing the bill with William Luther Pierce, author of The Turner Diaries. His rally was not an anti-pedophilia rally, and protesting him is not supporting pedophilia.
*Alex thinks everyone is trying to "cancel" Tucker Carlson, because it got revealed that his top writer, Blake Neff, [https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/10/media/tucker-carlson-writer-blake-neff/index.html had been posting racist shit online under an alias]. Tucker went on an allegedly planned vacation, [https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/tucker-carlson-now-vacation-could-face-more-advertiser-defections-1230312 which is weirdly exactly what he did the last time] he was in hot water and was losing advertisers.
*Alex pretends that cats are getting mail-in ballots.
*Alex makes excuses for why Roger hasn't shown up, even though he totally should have, given how tight he and Alex are supposed to be. It's very sad.

title: 457: July 12-13, 2020

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan end the week-long "Will They/Won't They" about when Roger Stone would finally show up on Infowars after being saved from prison last Friday. Also, Alex does ads for a product he can't sell yet, lies about Covid news, and accidentally reveals that he has no idea who Haile Selassie is.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan finally get to hear Roger Stone appear on The Alex Jones Show.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/7/20/episode-458-july-14-2020 Episode 458: July 14, 2020]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Roger shows up and tries to make Alex feel special by signing his alleged commutation papers on air. It's a sad display that impresses no one. Alex is eating lunch through most of his interview with Roger.
*Alex doesn't know the difference between "rite" and "right."
*Alex lies about David Rockefeller's 1973 New York Times op-ed. [https://www.nytimes.com/1973/08/10/archives/from-a-china-traveler.html It doesn't say any of the things Alex claims].
*Alex claims that flu deaths going down is a conspiracy, and not just the result of the fact that it's July. Flu season ends generally in May.
*Alex clearly has no idea who Haile Salassie is, which is embarrassing.
*Alex has a "Christmas In July" sale going, which seems sacrilegious for someone like him to do. There really should only be one Christmas, since it's Jesus's birthday and all.
*Alex lies about [https://www.nbcmiami.com/news/local/conspiracy-theorists-and-virus-deniers-amplify-and-distort-minor-data-error/2262792/ a data entry issue with Florida labs] to pretend that all Covid-19 data is fraudulent. The labs in question did not realize that in a pandemic they are also expected to report negative test results, so [https://www.fox13news.com/news/doh-some-florida-labs-only-reported-positive-covid-19-results-not-negatives some small privately owned labs were only reporting positive results]. This led to some labs having a positive rate of 100%, but data analysis has shown that there's no way that this had any impact on the state's positive test rate. Alex makes up numbers about this story [https://www.fox35orlando.com/news/fox-35-investigates-florida-department-of-health-says-some-labs-have-not-reported-negative-covid-19-results that in no way match the actual data] you can find easily if you look.
*Alex interviews Jim Hoft's brother, who he keeps calling "Jim Hoft's brother," which is honestly sad for both of them.
*Alex and Jim Hoft's brother deny that there are [https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamainternalmedicine/fullarticle/2767980 tens of thousands of excess deaths] being reported in the US this year.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan take a look at the new documentary created by Infowars reporter Millie Weaver, which was released shortly after her arrest on Friday. In this installment, the gents try to decide whether this is in fact the whistleblowing event of the century, or a shoddy disaster that proves nothing.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan discuss Millie Weaver's new documentary, which some people are pretending are involved in her recent arrest.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/8/17/episode-470-shadow-gate Episode 470: Shadow Gate]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Millie Weaver and her husband Gavin Wince [https://heavy.com/news/2020/08/millie-weaver/ were arrested on August 14], on felony charges of burglary, tampering with evidence, obstruction of justice, and domestic violence.
*Millie claims that government contractors are not subject to FOIA requests. [https://washingtontechnology.com/articles/2017/02/17/insights-proxmire-foia-advice.aspx This is not true]. You can find all sorts of information about government contractors on [https://foiaonline.gov/foiaonline/action/public/home the FOIA portal].
*One of Millie's experts, Patrick Bergy alleges to be [https://www.tampabay.com/archive/2005/10/27/bound-for-boot-camp-he-s-booted-from-his-job/ the first 40 year old private in the US military]. He also ran for [https://www.tampabay.com/archive/2004/10/11/independent-candidate-strives-to-be-heard/ Pasco County Election Supervisor], which [https://www.pascovotes.gov/portals/pasco/Results/gen04all.htm did not result in a victory]. After the campaign, Bergy [http://www.fec.state.fl.us/FECWebFi.nsf/0/EB6EA80B40C7CA6485257C2F00735CDA/$file/158.pdf didn't pay a fine] when told to by the commission, and eventually [http://www.fec.state.fl.us/FECWebFi.nsf/0/7C014BB7366B7E6785257C0E00587C5B/$file/206.pdf negotiated a settlement].
*Patrick Bergy's story largely relies on appeals to stories about IIA, or Interactive Internet Activity. The primary source about this is [https://fas.org/sgp/othergov/dod/dod060807.pdf a 2007 memo] which discusses public relations guidelines for interactive internet engagement of DoD personnel in certain foreign countries. It does not appear to be anything close to what they claim.
*Patrick Bergy wrote a book called [https://www.amazon.com/Victim-Swamp-State-Destroyed-Private/dp/1977646468 Victim Of The Swamp].
*Millie says that upstream collection of data is a large part of what the NSA does, but this is not accurate. A 2011 report found that [https://www.aclu.org/files/assets/fisc_opinion_10.3.2011.pdf 9% of internet data collected] was upstream collection, as opposed to stuff acquired directly from ISPs. Also, the NSA reported that they [https://www.nsa.gov/news-features/press-room/Article/1618699/nsa-stops-certain-section-702-upstream-activities/ amended their upstream collection practices] in April 2017.
*The [https://www.nytimes.com/2008/03/22/us/politics/22passport.html 2008 passport data breach] involved contractors from [https://web.archive.org/web/20080324040415/http://deepbackground.msnbc.msn.com/archive/2008/03/21/794799.aspx Stanley Inc and The Analysis Group]. It did not involve CGI, although [https://washingtontechnology.com/articles/2010/05/07/cgi-buys-stanley.aspx CGI did acquire Stanley in 2010], two years later.
*The Analysis Corporation is a [https://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/The_Analysis_Corporation wholly-owned subsidiary of Global Strategies Group].
*Millie thinks that CGI stands for Canadian Global Information, because those words are in the first line of their Wikipedia page. The name actually stands for [https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2013/10/16/meet-cgi-federal-the-company-behind-the-botched-launch-of-healthcare-gov/ Conseillers en Gestion et Informatique].
*The John Brennan quid-pro-quo theory does not make sense, given that [https://web.archive.org/web/20110507023129/http://www.northjersey.com/news/120509_North_Bergen_man_is_homeland_security_assistant_for_President_Obama.html he was a high level Obama advisor prior to the passport breach], and was clearly on a short-list to be in the administration.
*The PRISM program did not involve upstream collections of data.
*Dynology has received [https://www.usaspending.gov/#/search/b174b27784aef45c8a6b0640ee63792c many government contracts] over the years. [https://www.usaspending.gov/#/award/CONT_AWD_W912PE08P7083_9700_-NONE-_-NONE- One of these contracts] involves work that was performed in Germany, which Millie is claiming involves the Congressional Knowledge Management Service. This is based on her seeing the acronym "CMKS" on the contract, which she took to mean Congressional Knowledge Management Service, although the acronym for that should be CKMS. In cloud computing, CMKS is an abbreviation for Customer Master Keys, so it is entirely possible that this is what this contract was for, and there's no evidence provided that it has anything to do with the Congressional Knowledge Management Service.
*Patrick Bergy asserts that the Smith-Mundt Modernization Act of 2012 made it legal for the US government to propagandize the US population. This is [https://foreignpolicy.com/2013/07/14/u-s-repeals-propaganda-ban-spreads-government-made-news-to-americans/ a misunderstanding that apparently began with a sloppy column in Buzzfeed], which took on a life of its own. The Smith-Mundt Act of 2012 only made it so programs created by the Broadcasting Board of Governors could be accessible in the US, primarily because with the internet as it is, there's basically no way to stop it, and because these programs may be the preferred news sources of diaspora communities in the US. The Act itself explicitly lays out that [https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/BILLS-112hr5736ih/pdf/BILLS-112hr5736ih.pdf money allocated to these organizations cannot be used to sway public opinion in the US].
*Patrick Bergy seems to think that every recent instance of non-white communities expressing dissatisfaction with things like police violence are examples of people being swayed by Department of Defense IIA operations. The documentary doesn't include instances of white identity protests being accused of being IIA, which is weird.
*Patrick Bergy's story seems to [https://www.victimoftheswamp.com/2020/02/22/the-witness-obamas-shadownet/ include a whole lot of instances] of him being rebuffed by prominent people, like Matt Gaetz and Dan Bongino, after he approaches them about ShadowNet. The fact that they won't sign onto his conspiracy theory seems to consistently be taken as evidence that they themselves are involved in the ShadowNet conspiracy.
*Millie's other expert, Tore, [https://www.infowars.com/breaking-new-evidence-confirms-kentucky-election-fraud/ was also Millie's primary source] for her "reporting" about questions surrounding the 2019 election in Kentucky.
*Tore's [https://www.propublica.org/article/misinformation-efforts-over-kentucky-vote-could-be-playbook-for-2020 full name is Terpsichore Lindeman], and her claims about voter roll discrepancy were debunked by ProPublica.
*Tore was [https://attorneygeneral.nd.gov/news/attorney-general-details-investigation-unlicensed-business-alleged-fraud-tore-maras-lindeman investigated by the North Dakota attorney general] for inappropriately soliciting charitable donations in 2018. She also decided to [https://www.kfyrtv.com/content/news/Second-candidate-running-in-Minot-mayoral-race-468072953.html run for mayor of Minot, North Dakota] on a platform of Make Minot Great Again. [https://www.minotdailynews.com/news/local-news/2018/06/election-results-upheld-in-official-tally/ She did not make it to the ballot]. Fellow citizens started [https://www.change.org/p/concerned-citizens-of-minot-prohibit-tore-maras-lindeman-from-running-for-mayor-in-minot-nd a Change.org petition] to stop her from running for mayor.
*In 2011, Tore is listed as an undergraduate student in biology at the University of Kentucky, in the [https://www.uky.edu/chellgren/sites/www.uky.edu.chellgren/files/FINAL%20ABSTRACT%20BOOK.pdf program for their Showcase of Undergraduate Scholars].
*However, [https://medium.com/immigration-policy/usa-language-confidential-8aec1c253d96 according to her own Medium page], she claims that she was in medical school in 2008. In Millie's documentary, she also claims that she was working on secret projects for John Brennan in 2008, which seems like a problem. [https://navy.togetherweserved.com/usn/servlet/tws.webapp.WebApp?ID=506419&cmd=ShadowBoxProfile&type=Person Her page on TogetherWeServed] also claims to have been attending the University of Kentucky in 2008.
*[https://medium.com/@drlindeman Tore's Medium page] was largely about issues related to foreign language interpreting and serving immigrant communities, until August 2016, when the tone completely changed and it became a very intense conspiracy, pro-Trump blog. Even as her writing shifted into being about the evil forces conspiring about Trump, she did not claim to have first-hand knowledge of these evil forces, which she does claim now, which seems weird.
*Robert Storch was [https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/president-donald-j-trump-announces-key-additions-administration-2/ re-nominated by Trump in June 2017]. In December, [https://www.nsa.gov/news-features/press-room/Article/1618765/robert-storch-confirmed-as-national-security-agency-inspector-general/ he was confirmed by the Senate] as the Inspector General of the NSA. Millie says that it "appears he was never actually confirmed," which makes no sense.
*Paul Manafort was not the only [https://www.thedailybeast.com/rick-gates-tells-mueller-about-trump-teams-dealings-with-israeli-intelligence-firm Trump campaign connection to Psy-Group].
*Shawn Lucas was in a video serving papers to the DNC, but he was [https://heavy.com/news/2016/11/shawn-lucas-cause-of-death-drugs-released-kratom-fentanyl-dnc-process-server-democratic-national-committee-hillary-clinton-conspiracy-theory-theories-seth-rich/ just employed as a process server]. It was not his lawsuit. Though tragic, the claim that his death was suspicious or a murder has not been substantiated at all.
*Trump did not make it so people lose their security clearances when they leave their jobs. Because of [https://clearedjobs.net/security-clearance-faqs how clearances work], this would be a logistical and administrative nightmare and create so much more bureaucracy.
*Millie read the first paragraph of [https://www.europarl.europa.eu/cmsdata/196207/UNICRI%20-%20Artificial%20intelligence%20and%20robotics%20for%20law%20enforcement.pdf an Interpol report] about robotics and law enforcement and reported on it. She neglects to mention any of the relevant content of the report.
*Millie found a [https://patents.justia.com/patent/20170061345 2017 patent] for employee surveillance technology owned by Dynology. She presents this outside of the workplace context, and misrepresents the patent. She also fails to point out this is just an updating of an existing 2015 patent.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan come in on their day off to see what happened when Alex Jones showed back up on Rogan's podcast. A short review: not enough Bravo.
mediawiki_citations:
Dan and Jordan explore Alex Jones' latest visit to Joe Rogan's podcast, where all sorts of bullshit got discussed.<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2020/10/30/episode-497-joe-rogan-part-3 Episode 497: Joe Rogan Part 3]</ref>

Topics covered include:

*Jim McKelvey, co-founder of Square, which owns Cash App, is [https://www.stlouisfed.org/about-us/leadership-governance/board-of-directors a board member of the St. Louis Federal Reserve Bank].
*Discussion of [https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2019/aug/22/the-murky-life-and-death-of-robert-maxwell-and-how-it-shaped-his-daughter-ghislaine the death of Robert Maxwell].
*[https://www.baltimoresun.com/news/bs-xpm-2002-12-08-0212110428-story.html Michael Pakenham's review] of the book about Robert Maxwell being a spy.
*A [https://web.archive.org/web/20040215191237/http://www.crimelibrary.com/criminal_mind/psychology/mcmartin_daycare/5.html?sect=19 breakdown of the events] in the McMartin Preschool trial
*[http://law2.umkc.edu/faculty/projects/ftrials/mcmartin/mcmartinaccount.html Further discussion] of the McMartin trial
*[https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1990-05-06-op-35-story.html 1990 LA Times article] about the political background of the McMartin prosecution
*Ted Gunderson [http://rigorousintuition.blogspot.com/2005/07/interview-with-jackie-mcgauley-part_19.html lived with one of the parents of a McMartin student] who was involved with the project to dig up the alleged tunnels
*The [https://mds.marshall.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1006&context=psychology_faculty&httpsredir=1&referer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2F archaeological report on the McMartin tunnels] is questionable
*[https://www.propublica.org/article/we-found-a-staggering-281-lobbyists-whove-worked-in-the-trump-administration ProPublica article] about the 281 lobbyists who Trump has hired
*[https://www.politico.com/news/2020/07/08/trump-administration-veteranslobbying-348273 Politico article] about the 82 former Trump administration members who went on to be lobbyists
*[https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-daniels-at-t-exclusive/att-ceo-we-made-big-mistake-hiring-cohen-chief-lobbyist-out-idUSKBN1IC1L6 Reuters article] about ATT&T's payments to Michael Cohen
*There were articles about [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-54151712 the recent peace deals]
*[https://www.justice.gov/archive/tax/usaopress/2004/txdv04kush0818_r.htm Jared Kushner's dad pled guilty] to trying to blackmail his sister's husband, who was a collaborating witness against him
*The magical Utah coal mine doesn't seem to be in [https://pubs.usgs.gov/pp/p1625b/Reports/Chapters/Chapter_B.pdf the USGS report]
*[https://www.americangeosciences.org/critical-issues/faq/which-states-are-largest-producers-and-consumers-coal Utah produces 2% of the US's annual coal]
*[https://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/infrastructure/news/a27886/how-does-clean-coal-work/ Clean coal doesn't mean what Alex thinks it does]
*The idea that [https://www.theguardian.com/weather/ng-interactive/2018/sep/11/atlantic-hurricanes-are-storms-getting-worse hurricanes are getting worse] is not "media hype"
*Alex is making things up about the Club of Rome's [http://www.donellameadows.org/wp-content/userfiles/Limits-to-Growth-digital-scan-version.pdf Limitations of Growth document]
*[https://vault.fbi.gov/the-finders The FBI's Finders files]
*[https://yaledailynews.com/blog/2010/08/09/judge-dismisses-apache-suit-against-skull-and-bones-2/ More information about the lawsuit] filed by Geronimo's great-grandson
*[https://news.google.com/newspapers?dat=19960430&hl=en&id=yDcxAAAAIBAJ&nid=348&pg=2925%2C9479409 AP article] about the search for William Colby's body
*[https://big.assets.huffingtonpost.com/PostMortem.pdf Medical Examiner's report] about William Colby
*The Rockefeller document that [https://www.rockefellerfoundation.org/wp-content/uploads/Annual-Report-2010-1.pdf Alex's conspiracy is not based on]
*The Rockefeller document that [https://issuu.com/dueprocesstv/docs/scenario-for_the-future Alex's Lock Step conspiracy is based on]
*An explanation of [https://www.who.int/news-room/q-a-detail/poliomyelitis-vaccine-derived-polio what vaccine-derived polio actually is]

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on the past.  In this installment, Alex reveals that some of his more sensible-sounding positions are actually dumb, interviews a guy his audience clearly hates, and gets a call from a guy who recently lost a tiger.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics Covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/7/6/episode-574-may-28-29-2003 Episode 574: May 28-29, 2003]</ref>:

*Alex reveals some details about his positions on the death penalty and drug legalization.
*Alex is opposed to federal executions, but supports state executions. [https://www.bop.gov/about/history/federal_executions.jsp Almost all executions] are carried out by states, and federal executions had stopped for 17 years [https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-wildlife-coronavirus-pandemic-crime-terre-haute-28e44cc5c026dc16472751bbde0ead50 before Donald Trump began the practice again].
*[https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/pressroom/sosmap/homicide_mortality/homicide.htm CDC numbers] do not reflect a deterrent effect for states that have the death penalty. Studies consistently find that there is no deterrent effect.
*"[https://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.472.2455&rep=rep1&type=pdf The Context of Family Planning in Brazil]"
*[https://pdf.usaid.gov/pdf_docs/PCAAB500.pdf National Security Study Memorandum 200]
*[https://www.jstor.org/stable/3401499 Population and Development Review article]
*[https://www.cleveland19.com/story/2885663/fingerprint-school-lunch-programs-raise-concern/ Fingerprinting for school lunches in Ohio was not mandatory]
*[https://www.peta.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/02/cub-incidents-us-factsheet.pdf PETA list of tiger incidents]
*[https://buffalonews.com/news/woman-hospitalized-in-attack-by-tigers/article_de2d28d1-2f27-5df7-b60d-d3b29b6e2d69.html Grant arrested in 2005 after another tiger attacks]
*[https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/minnesota-tiger-man#/ Trailer for documentary about Alex's caller who had their tigers seized]

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan end up so disappointed by Alex Jones' 4th of July video that they decide to check in on the Baby Bigot section of his website to see what kind of content Alex is associating himself with these days. (Content warning: transphobia, homophobia...a bunch of other stuff that may be unpleasant)

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/7/8/episode-575-july-4-2021 Episode 575: July 4, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex released a 4th of July video that is basically a plug for a two-week old episode of the Joe Rogan Experience
*The Defender is a publication put out by [https://childrenshealthdefense.org/about-us/board-directors/ an anti-vaccine group] called Children's Health Defense
*[https://founders.archives.gov/documents/Jefferson/01-32-02-0102 Alex's favorite Thomas Jefferson quote] is actually about fighting those in early America who were seeking to have a national religion
*Nick Fuentes is mad about [https://www.marketwatch.com/story/for-juneteenth-its-time-for-a-new-flag-11623958522 an op-ed written by Macy Gray]
*Nick Fuentes seems to be confused about [https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/03/08/reparations-black-farmers-stimulus/ government aid to black farmers]
*Articles about the Darriynn Brown case: [https://www.fox4news.com/news/attorney-claims-man-accused-of-killing-dallas-4-year-old-is-schizophrenic 1], [https://www.thedailybeast.com/the-strange-new-turn-in-the-case-of-darriynn-brown-and-4-year-old-cash-gernon 2], [https://www.wfaa.com/article/news/crime/murder-evidence-darriyn-brown-cash-gernon-blood/287-a7db8527-f220-4d0e-a4a0-90b7dd1106f9 3], [https://meaww.com/who-is-kamron-mori-cash-gernon-brother-went-school-darriynn-brown-friend-murder-no-reason-evil 4]

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan reunite to discuss Alex Jones' Sunday broadcast.  In this installment, Alex can't keep his conspiracies about scenario-based exercises straight, misreports a couple of stories, and makes a noise that that Jordan was unprepared for.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/8/3/episode-583-august-1-2021 Episode #583: August 1, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex reports on [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-9844701/SAGE-Covid-variant-kill-one-three-people.html a Daily Mail article] about a sensationalized version of [https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1007484/S1325_SPI-M-O_Concerns_for_the_next_few_months.pdf guidance released by SAGE]
*Alex doesn't remember the difference between "[https://archive.org/details/crimson-contagion-2019/mode/2up Crimson Contagion]" and "[https://jhsphcenterforhealthsecurity.s3.amazonaws.com/spars-pandemic-scenario.pdf SPARS]"
*Alex fear-mongers about [https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1201971220307311 Antibody Dependent Enhancement] killing people who have received Covid vaccines
*Alex misreports a story about the CDC [https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/70/wr/pdfs/mm7031e2-H.pdf releasing a study] covering the recent cluster of Covid cases in Massachusetts
*Alex pretends to cover [https://www.eurosurveillance.org/content/10.2807/1560-7917.ES.2021.26.30.2100636;jsessionid=q2OYxdwnQe5eKoXbefP1iKYe.i-0b3d9850f4681504f-ecdclive a study about a cluster of Covid cases in a hospital in Finland], but he is actually just reading a tweet:

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/1628048209402-WAES1S6ZG4R2FLBK6ORK/BostomTweet.JPG|thumb|none]]

*Alex teases a story about "the dean of the Baylor Medical School" coming out and saying that the Covid vaccine is evil. He never actually covers the story, but it doesn't seem like it's Dr. Hotez, who happens to be a dean of one of the medical schools at Baylor, and has been a public figure [https://www.click2houston.com/news/local/2021/07/31/it-put-me-in-a-dark-scary-place-dr-hotez-reveals-what-it-was-like-to-fight-covid-19-disinformation/ trying to fight Covid pandemic misinformation]
*Alex's guest Chris Sky [https://www.vice.com/en/article/wxqanq/a-rich-anti-masker-chris-saccoccia-is-starting-a-mask-free-private-school-system-for-his-followers-kids wanted to start a mask-free schoo]l, and also does not seem like a cool guy
*Mike Adams shows up to say some truly bizarre things about what he thinks is going on with Covid and where things are going
*The first man who received the Pfizer vaccine was [https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-coventry-warwickshire-57234741 named Bill Shakespeare], and he didn't die a month after vaccination

title: 583: August 1, 2021

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on things from the end of the week on the Alex Jones Show.  In this installment, Alex has a very definite prediction based on amazing source, which actually may not happen, and even if it doesn't happen, he's still right if you think about it.  Also, Alex gets defensive about his financial ties with the MyPillow Guy.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/8/8/episode-584-august-5-2021 Episode #584: August 5, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex makes very insistent predictions that Biden will declare martial law lockdowns on August 11. If this doesn't happen or happens on another date, Alex believes that he's still correct in his reporting because him covering the idea of martial law being declared on the 11th is what made martial law not be declared on the 11th.
*Alex uses [https://www.fema.gov/press-release/20210611/fema-and-fcc-plan-nationwide-emergency-alert-test-aug-11-test-messages-will an upcoming Emergency Alert System test] to reinforce his predictions about August 11.
*Alex's new benefactor Mike Lindell is running [https://www.dakotanewsnow.com/2021/07/23/mike-lindell-says-his-sioux-falls-cyber-symposium-will-prove-election-fraud-experts-have-doubts/ an absurd Cyber Symposium] Aug. 10-12
*DHS has [https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/06/politics/homeland-security-warning-political-conspiracy-threat-violence/index.html warned of increased online threats] of violence surrounding election conspiracies
*Bild editor-in-chief [https://de.rt.com/inland/121789-bild-chef-entschuldigt-sich-fur/ apologized for Covid coverage] back in May
*"[https://www.bild.de/politik/kolumnen/kolumne/kommentar-von-bild-chef-julian-reichelt-donald-trump-wird-in-schande-leben-74784700.bild.html Donald Trump Will Live In Shame]"
*[https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP83M00914R002800050073-1.pdf 1982 letter of introduction] for Bild founder to the Director of the CIA
*Alex is endorsing Karen Kingston's Covid vaccine conspiracies, [https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/graphene-oxide-mrna-vaccines/ which are dumb]
*Some people [https://www.cdc.gov/plague/maps/index.html do still get the bubonic plague]
*The media [https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/24/us/colorado-plague-10-year-old-death/index.html did cover the recent CO death] related to the plague
*[https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2021/aug/03/lake-tahoe-chipmunks-bubonic-plague South Lake Tahoe was closed] over concerns about plague-infected chipmunks
*Alex warns that NY is going to roll out vaccine passports, but he's just misreporting a story about the Excelsior Pass, which NY introduced in March, and [https://www.governor.ny.gov/news/governor-cuomo-announces-launch-excelsior-pass-help-fast-track-reopening-businesses-and is entirely voluntary]
*Alex interviews [https://www.thedailybeast.com/local-fox-reporter-ivory-hecker-suspended-for-live-on-air-project-veritas-stunt Ivory Hecker], the local Houston Fox reporter who quit on air, revealing that she was going to spill the beans to Project Veritas
*Ivory may have not been censored by CPAC, [https://www.thedailybeast.com/cpac-attendees-turn-on-conference-sponsorfox-news nor by Fox Nation]
*The TX Secretary of State has reviewed Dominion election software [https://www.sos.texas.gov/elections/laws/dominion.shtml three times], in 2012 and two times in [https://www.sos.texas.gov/elections/forms/sysexam/oct2019-watson.pdf 2019]. Each time, various concerns were raised, and Texas decided not to use their system.
*The [https://www.eac.gov/voting-equipment/democracy-suite-55-modification Election Assistance Commission], as well as the states of [https://www.votespa.com/About-Elections/Pages/Dominion-Democracy-Suite-55A.aspx Pennsylvania] and [https://www.sos.wa.gov/_assets/elections/research/democracy-suite-5.5-report.pdf Washington] have also reviewed the same software and found it to be satisfactory
*Alex's Orwell quote [https://quoteinvestigator.com/2013/02/24/truth-revolutionary/ is not an actual Orwell quote]

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in to get more information about the imminent martial law that is kicking off on Aug. 11.  In this installment, Alex makes one of the more embarrassing oversights of his recent career, says "ejaculate" again, and finds a new song to rant over.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/8/10/episode-585-august-8-2021 Episode #585: August 8, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex reports on and embellishes the [https://www.augsburger-allgemeine.de/panorama/Corona-Chef-Pathologe-der-Uni-Heidelberg-draengt-auf-mehr-Obduktionen-von-Geimpften-id60235361.html comments of a German pathologist]
*Alex is terrified of [https://www.epw.senate.gov/public/_cache/files/e/a/ea1eb2e4-56bd-45f1-a260-9d6ee951bc96/F8A7C77D69BE09151F210EB4DFE872CD.edw21a09.pdf the infrastructure bill]
*The infrastructure bill [https://www.wusa9.com/article/news/verify/infrastructure-bill-would-mandate-alcohol-monitoring-in-cars-congress-biden/65-ab85122d-c5c6-42ce-8b12-fcb5a24c0278 does include] impaired driving reduction initiatives

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on how things have been going in InfoWars world.  In this installment, the date of Alex Jones' maybe-prediction of martial law being announced comes and goes, Alex has to rationalize Mike Lindell's symposium going poorly, and imaginary meetings with Globalists are discussed.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/8/15/episode-586-august-11-12-2021 Episode #586: August 11-12, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex misrepresents [https://www.wusa9.com/article/news/verify/verify-why-a-face-mask-box-says-it-provides-no-protection-to-the-wearer/507-d5070a18-0146-4ef9-9d22-afe9fa7759a0 a warning on the back of a box of masks] that he saw in a meme
*The Surgeon General did [https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/29/health/coronavirus-n95-face-masks.html advise against people buying up masks], but that was back in Feb. 2020, before asymptomatic transmission was understood
*Rand Paul's wife's [https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/08/11/rand-paul-gilead-stock/ suspicious stock purchases]
*Rumble is [https://thehill.com/policy/technology/567607-youtube-rival-rumble-strikes-deals-with-tulsi-gabbard-glenn-greenwald paying off influencers] like Glenn Greenwald and Tulsi Gabbard
*JAMA found over [https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jama/fullarticle/2778361 500,000 excess deaths] in the US in 2020

*[https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/70/wr/mm7014e1.htm Provisional CDC data] on 2020 US deaths

*The COP26 Climate Summit has some [https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-scotland-58153616 slightly loosened Covid guidelines], but there are still [https://ukcop26.org/the-conference/delegates/ a lot of precautions in place]
*Alex misrepresents [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/atlanta-mom-files-complaint-alleging-daughter-s-grade-school-segregated-n1276584 a story about allegations of segregation] in an Atlanta elementary school

*The FDA [https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2018/09/28/2018-21210/richard-m-fleming-denial-of-hearing-final-debarment-order disbarred Fleming in 2018]

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on what Alex has been up to. In this installment, the gents discuss why guest vetting is important, why Owen Shroyer isn't a "political prisoner," and get into what Dan has dubbed Shadow-Dumbass-Gate.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/8/26/episode-590-august-24-2021 Episode #590: August 24, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex spends a lot of time talking about clips from Bill Maher's show and a recent CNN interview with Brett Favre
*Alex misrepresents issues related to proposed [https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2021/s0818-covid-19-booster-shots.html Covid vaccine boosters]
*Alex cherry-picks a [https://www.forbes.com/sites/roberthart/2021/07/23/pfizer-shot-just-39-effective-against-delta-infection-but-largely-prevents-severe-illness-israel-study-suggests/?sh=548f36a6584f month old article] about Covid vaccine efficacy
*Alex claims that most people deliver children by C-section. [https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2019/10/c-section-rate-high/600172/ This is not true].
*Alex claims that most people do not breastfeed. [https://www.cdc.gov/breastfeeding/data/reportcard.htm This is not true].
*[https://investor.regeneron.com/index.php/news-releases/news-release-details/regeneron-announces-us-government-agreement-purchase-additional Regeneron themselves admit] that there were some side-effects recorded in their trials
*FL Gov. DeSantis has some [https://www.tcpalm.com/story/news/local/2021/08/24/what-to-know-regeneron-clinic-monoclonal-antibody-treatment-covid-desantis-fort-pierce/8254784002/ suspicious financial ties] to a hedge fund with heavy investment in Regeneron
*Regeneron was [https://www.cnn.com/world/live-news/coronavirus-pandemic-07-07-20-intl/h_5ea1d11bcd09fec62c4d9bc32cd07b7f awarded a $450 million contract] to produce their cocktail, and reached an agreement to [https://investor.regeneron.com/index.php/news-releases/news-release-details/regeneron-announces-us-government-agreement-purchase-additional sell the federal government all their product] for over $2 billion
*Alex claims that "the Globalists" eat "vats of poop." This is just not medically possible
*Alex fearmongers about [https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/everything-you-need-to-know-about-israels-green-passport-program-659437 news about Israel's green passports]
*Alex defends himself against accusations that he called Trump a dumbass by explaining that he was trying to imply that Trump is an evil traitor
*Sean Brooks does not understand [https://www.insidehighered.com/sites/default/server_files/media/indiana_lawsuit.pdf the Indiana University lawsuit], which was [https://www.supremecourt.gov/search.aspx?filename=%2Fdocket%2Fdocketfiles%2Fhtml%2Fpublic%2F21a15.html rejected] to be heard by the Supreme Court
*Sean Brooks seems like a person who has undisclosed reasons for his opposition to public education, like [https://data.tallahassee.com/troubled-teachers/charlotte/brooks-sean-mccalla/15-0142-RT/ his history of disciplinary violations] from back when he was a teacher (h/t [https://heavy.com/news/dr-sean-brooks-phd-oxford-ohio-video/ Heavy])
*[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=68Sz3PH3FLE The Brody Stevens Interview Challenge] holds up

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check back in on how things are going on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex helps a Florida grocer beg for a meeting with Gov. DeSantis, covers multiple fake stories he found on social media, and misreports an about three month old story about vaccines.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/9/16/episode-597-september-14-2021 Episode #597: September 14, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex misreports the [https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/03/17/usps-ballot-fraud-investigation/ 2020 elections scandal] involving a PA postal worker
*Alex is mad about AOC's dress at the Met Gala, but likes Nicki Minaj's vaccine tweet, which the Health Minister of Trinidad [https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/16/americas/nicki-minaj-vaccine-story-false-scli-intl/index.html has said was not true]
*Alex misreports [https://www.reuters.com/world/us/heart-inflammation-after-covid-19-shots-higher-than-expected-study-us-military-2021-06-29/ a story about a military study] on heart inflammation after vaccination ([https://www.pennlive.com/nation-world/2021/06/rate-of-heart-inflammation-among-us-military-following-covid-19-shots-higher-than-expected-study-finds.html alternate link])
*Alex reports on [https://factcheck.afp.com/http%253A%252F%252Fdoc.afp.com%252F9MU3HH-1 a hoax Facebook meme] about Canadian Walmarts requiring proof of vaccination for people to shop in their stores
*Alex reports on [https://twitter.com/yinonw/status/1437439928326033411 a misleading graph] that he found on a random person's twitter account. The printout he's using to cover the story is just a tweet:

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/1631852525639-VKBE1D9SXWLS9P4JV9X2/Mongolia.JPG|thumb|none]]

*Alex reports on [https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/550/text?r=6&s=1 a house resolution] introduced in January as if it is breaking news

title: 603: October 3-4, 2021

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on the deteriorating situation on The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex makes up a giant story about a video one of his interns found on C-SPAN, interviews a mega-creep, and announces that he's going to have to sell his tank.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/10/10/episode-604-october-5-2021 Episode #604: October 5, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex has found "the smoking gun of smoking guns of smoking guns," which turns out to be a [https://www.c-span.org/video/?465845-1%2Funiversal-flu-vaccine 2019 C-SPAN video] that he makes up a bunch of stuff about
*Alex thinks that [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/rothschild-libel-why-has-it-taken-200-years-anti-semitic-slur-emerged-battle-waterloo-be-dismissed-10216101.html anti-Semitic smears against Nathan Rothschild] are real history
*Instead of really focusing on the smoking gun C-SPAN video, Alex interviews Ted Nugent, Dr. Bartlett, and a random comedian who [https://www.dailydot.com/debug/comedian-tweets-imperil-military-base-tour-derek-richards/ got kicked off a tour] for bad tweets
*Alex cites [https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2020/04/22/coronavirus-ventilators-survival/ an old statistic] about ventilators, which is [https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/05/15/856768020/new-evidence-suggests-covid-19-patients-on-ventilators-usually-survive devoid of context]
*The NIH's [https://files.covid19treatmentguidelines.nih.gov/guidelines/covid19treatmentguidelines.pdf Covid-19 Treatment Guidelines]

title: 604: October 5, 2021

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan take a little jaunt back to the past. In this installment, Alex freestyles a bunch of incorrect facts, lies about Porton Down, and warns that special education classes are a plot to kidnap children.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/10/12/episode-605-june-17-2003 Episode #605: June 17, 2003]</ref>:

*Alex makes up a [https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2001/feb/26/footandmouth.peterhetherington bunch of nonsense] about [https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2001/mar/22/footandmouth.paulbrown Porton Down releasing foot-and-mouth]
*[https://web.archive.org/web/20071025031456/http://www.defra.gov.uk/footandmouth/investigations/pdf/spratt_final.pdf 2007 UK government report] on the foot-and-mouth outbreak
*Not sure if Janes covered race-specific bioweapons, but [https://sites.google.com/site/bioterrorbible/BIO-WEAPONS/RACE-SPECIFIC-BIO-WEAPONS American Free Press did]
*Alex thinks that a subsidiary of the Carlyle Group purchased Porton Down, which is not true. Porton Down is actually [https://www.portonsciencepark.com/tenants/ a large science park], the lab Alex is thinking of is called the Defense Science and Technology Laboratory
*Alex covers [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/1432366/Famine-struck-N-Koreans-eating-children.html stories of cannibalism] in North Korea
*Alex mixes up the story of Kim Jong Il [https://www.history.com/news/north-korea-kim-jong-il-kidnapped-actress-obsessed-films kidnapping two South Korean movie-makers], and a story about Kim Jong Il apologizing for [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2002/sep/18/japan.northkorea special forces agents kidnapping Japanese nationals] in the 1970's and 80's
*Alex thinks that North Korea is a major exporter of opium. [https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/CHRG-109shrg28241/html/CHRG-109shrg28241.htm It is not]. Afghanistan (and Myanmar back in 2003) were [https://www.unodc.org/res/wdr2021/field/WDR21_Booklet_3.pdf by far the world leaders] on that front
*Alex is wrong about [https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-does-someone-get-two/ why some people have two different colored eyes]
*Alex is wrong about John Dewey creating the Dewey Decimal System. That was Melvil Dewey, and [https://americanlibrariesmagazine.org/2018/06/01/melvil-dewey-bringing-harassment-out-of-the-history-books/ he really sucks]
*Coalition forces needed to print dinars with Saddam's face on them because the [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/2979906.stm people in Iraq had lost confidence] in the only other currency

title: 605: June 17, 2003

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan stick around in the past to learn a bit about Alex Jones. In this installment, Alex floats an outrageous 9/11 conspiracy theory, misreports at least two Supreme Court decisions, and takes (bad) aim at UNESCO.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/10/14/episode-606-june-18-19-2003 Episode #606: June 18-19, 2003]</ref>:

*Alex hates cops and is ACAB
*Alex misrepresents the [https://supreme.justia.com/cases/federal/us/539/166/ Supreme Court decision] regarding the involuntary medicating of Dr. Charles Sell
*Alex discusses Jane Roe, who has come out against abortion, but would later say she just did that because [https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/jane-roe-from-roe-v-wade-made-a-stunning-deathbed-confession-now-what/2020/05/20/fad9d296-9a09-11ea-89fd-28fb313d1886_story.html anti-abortion groups paid her to]
*Alex misrepresents a Supreme Court decision in the case of [https://www.law.cornell.edu/supct/html/01-1444.ZO.html Chavez v. Martinez]
*Alex thinks that there were no passengers on the planes on 9/11
*Alex lies about the [https://web.archive.org/web/20121024095423/http://www.archives.gov/research/9-11/staff-report-sept2005.pdf number of passengers] on the planes on 9/11
*Alex reports on a [https://zannerman.files.wordpress.com/2008/12/unesco-toward-world-understanding.pdf UNESCO report from 1949] by reading [https://www.newsmax.com/pre-2008/unescostrangle-this-monster/2003/06/17/id/675953/ an op-ed in Newsmax]
*The outrage about this UNESCO report [https://books.google.com/books?dq=Toward%20World%20Understanding%20unesco&hl=en&id=mf8ZAQAAMAAJ&lpg=PA729&ots=nJq0CRjswE&pg=PA729&sa=X&sig=ACfU3U2BJ8pQn-JxCl6eyfg5B57GviZdcA&source=bl&ved=2ahUKEwjl1dTe-MjzAhVxYjUKHWFxC0oQ6AF6BAgQEAM#v=onepage&q=Toward%20World%20Understanding%20unesco&f=false traces back] to an old time anti-Semite named W. Henry McFarland
*W. Henry McFarland published [https://archive.org/details/macfarlandjr.williamhenryhq1057857/page/n8/mode/1up many very troubling newsletters]
*Congressman John Wood from Idaho (not Ohio, Dan misspoke) introduced the article that McFarland published in his newsletter for the American Flag Committee [https://books.google.com/books?dq=%22join%20with%20the%20american%20flag%20committee%20in%20demanding%20that%20your%20united%20states%20senators%22&hl=en&id=vBPSI3Ttv_wC&lpg=SL1-PA6552&ots=1tlumBbsba&pg=SL1-PA6552&sa=X&sig=ACfU3U03Eb1GWXxtm6rnNg0-nLXcxce7Yg&source=bl&ved=2ahUKEwi4mte9k8nzAhV2mHIEHT1XAc8Q6AF6BAgCEAM#v=onepage&q=%22join%20with%20the%20american%20flag%20committee%20in%20demanding%20that%20your%20united%20states%20senators%22&f=false into the Congressional Record] in 1951
*Alex interviews Jane Roe's lawyer, and the conversation is intensely gross

title: 608: Jordan Takes The Wheel 7

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check back in on how Alex Jones is doing these days. In this installment, Alex is on an emotional rollercoaster that finds him yelling about the devil, targeting another high school student, and being fairly ambivalent about whether or not his listeners should kill their family members who aren't against vaccines.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/10/24/episode-609-october-20-2021 Episode #609: October 20, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex is in a very, very weird mood and seems to be lashing out the entire episode
*Alex claims that 132 countries had signed on to a global income tax, which is not true. This was [https://home.treasury.gov/news/press-releases/jy0419 a misreporting] of [https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/08/business/oecd-global-minimum-tax.html news about countries] and the [https://www.oecd.org/tax/beps/statement-on-a-two-pillar-solution-to-address-the-tax-challenges-arising-from-the-digitalisation-of-the-economy-october-2021.pdf OECD negotiating] a universal minimum corporate tax rate, which is aimed at fighting tax havens
*One of the main studies that folks like Alex cite to claim connection between the Covid vaccines and myocarditis [https://www.reuters.com/article/factcheck-preprint-myocarditiswithdrawn/fact-check-pre-print-study-that-claimed-1-in-1000-risk-of-myocarditis-following-covid-19-vaccine-was-withdrawn-due-to-miscalculation-idUSL1N2QX1WS was retracted]
*The Biden administration is not planning to inject everyone on Halloween. They are [https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2021/10/20/fact-sheet-biden-administration-announces-update-on-operational-planning-for-covid-19-vaccinations-for-kids-ages-5-11/ preparing for the possibility] that in early November, the Pfizer vaccine will be approved for everyone over the age of 5
*Alex's [https://www.theguardian.com/education/2021/sep/15/covid-teams-can-vaccinate-pupils-against-parents-wishes-schools-told headline about students in the UK] being forced to be vaccinated actually explicitly discusses how the students are not forced
*[https://ig.ft.com/coronavirus-lockdowns/ Financial Times lockdown tracker]
*[https://www.bsg.ox.ac.uk/sites/default/files/2020-04/BSG-WP-2020-032-v5.0.pdf Paper explaining the variables] measured for the tracker
*[https://na.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/ Current lockdown measures] in Namibia
*[https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/508956/venezuela-authorities-impose-flexible-covid-19-related-restrictions-through-aug-8-update-56 Venezuela's 7x7 plan] which [https://venezuelanalysis.com/news/15355 has been announced] to be over
*Alex builds a gigantic conspiracy about a few random dates he found in [https://www.fda.gov/media/151710/download a letter from the FDA to BioNTech/Pfizer]. The letter is an approval of their Biologics License Application, and does not prove any of the claims Alex makes
*Pfizer had a [https://www.pfizer.com/news/press-release/press-release-detail/pfizer-and-biontech-announce-positive-topline-results press release in September], announcing the results of the studies that Alex claims won't be available until 2024
*In October, Pfizer released [https://www.fda.gov/media/153409/download a longer-form version of their data]
*The FDA has given [https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/10/23/1048660468/fda-pfizer-vaccine-kids-effective an initial positive reaction] to the data provided by Pfizer
*The FDA has a lot of [https://www.fda.gov/media/140394/download opinions on milk], as well as about oranges and [https://www.fda.gov/regulatory-information/search-fda-guidance-documents/cpg-sec-550575-marmalade orange products]
*The story that Alex is reporting about a trans woman prisoner at a California prison impregnating her cellmate [https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2021/aug/18/viral-image/no-transgender-woman-didnt-impregnate-another-inma/ is not a real story]. It was based on a lie [https://mashable.com/article/steven-crowder-youtube-suspension-transgender-inmate-misinfo spread by Steven Crowder], which he got from a notorious [https://www.nbcnews.com/feature/nbc-out/conservative-group-hosts-anti-transgender-panel-feminists-left-n964246 TERF advocacy group]
*The [https://healthfeedback.org/claimreview/no-scientific-evidence-for-claim-by-pathologist-ryan-cole-that-covid-19-vaccines-weaken-the-immune-system/ Idaho doctor] referenced in Greg Reece's video is not a good source
*Greg Reece's video is based on [https://theexpose.uk/2021/10/09/risk-of-death-due-to-covid-increases-among-fully-vaccinated-18-29-year-olds/ a blog post on The Expose], which misrepresents some [https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/1023849/Vaccine_surveillance_report_-_week_40.pdf data from UK Health Security Agency]

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/b110f8b4-2459-4c0f-9988-7887988267f6/HSAVersion.JPG|thumb|none|alt=Spreadsheet, as it appears in the report from the Health Security Agency|Spreadsheet, as it appears in the report from the Health Security Agency]]

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/7822dd90-4176-42ed-a3a5-14cf15c257fd/ExposeVersion.JPG|thumb|none|alt=Spreadsheet, as it appears in the Expose blog post|Spreadsheet, as it appears in the Expose blog post]]

*Alex believes that the FDA did not really approve the Pfizer vaccine. [https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/fda-approves-first-covid-19-vaccine They did]
*The [https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/planning/school-located-clinics.html CDC's nefarious advice] about how to run a vaccination day at a school
