title: 637: January 13, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan poke around a little more about the recent Stewart Rhodes arrest news. In this installment, the gents discuss Alex's "previously unreleased" interview about Stewart being accused of being a fed, and meet the silliest insurrectionist.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/1/18/episode-638-see-you-at-the-cross-rhodes Episode #638: See You At The Cross-Rhodes]</ref>:

*Alex's "previously unreleased" interview with Stewart Rhodes, where they discuss whether or not he's a fed
*The [https://archive.is/O3tTN first Revolver article], and [https://americanfaith.com/federal-protection-of-oath-keepers-kingpin-stewart-rhodes-breaks-the-entire-capitol-insurrection-lie-wide-open/ the second], which insinuates/accuses Stewart of being a fed because he had not been arrested at this point
*[https://www.justice.gov/opa/speech/attorney-general-merrick-b-garland-delivers-remarks-first-anniversary-attack-capitol Merrick Garland's speech] on the anniversary of January 6, which explains how the investigation has progressed from more straightforward cases to more complex ones
*Stewart was [https://www.nytimes.com/2016/01/17/us/standoff-in-oregon-attracts-supporters-bearing-disparate-grievances.html ambivalent about the Malheur occupation], and also [https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/jessicagarrison/stewart-rhodes-oath-keepers-early-history-conflicts had some issues] [https://www.splcenter.org/hatewatch/2017/05/16/leader-josephine-county-oath-keepers-breaks-stewart-rhodes-over-leadership-style with credibility] after the Bundy Ranch went bad for the Oath Keepers, some of it involving Pete Santilli
*[https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2021/07/oath-keepers-january-6-capitol-insurrection-michael-simmons-person-ten/ Stewart's "operation leader"] [https://extremism.gwu.edu/sites/g/files/zaxdzs2191/f/Caldwell%20et%20al%20Fourth%20Superseding%20Indictment.pdf from January 6] has not been indicted
*Stewart [https://www.justice.gov/opa/press-release/file/1462481/download made multiple calls] that went on for at least a minute, which are unlikely to have been attempted calls
*Ali Alexander got a permit for a rally [https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/21059849/leopold-capitol-police-protest-permits-january-6-common-law-release.pdf under false pretenses]
*Stewart lies about almost every aspect of the events of the 6th, according to evidence provided in his indictment. He alleges that his people only went into the capitol to give Ashli Babbitt medical assistance, but they were inside the building before she had even been shot
*Alex should probably take this video down, or give it a different headline
*Oath Keeper Jeremy Brown was [https://web.archive.org/web/20211117141721/https://www.thedailybeast.com/alleged-jan-6-rioter-jeremy-brown-tries-to-sell-home-on-Zillow-accidentally-reveals-cache-of-explosives-fbi arrested for his participation in the 6th], and also [https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/21099005-brown-search-warrant accidentally posted images indicating his possession of explosives] in a Zillow listing when trying to sell his house

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on a very frustrating day on the Alex Jones Show.  In this installment, Roger Stone announces that he has/had Covid and is suing everyone, Alex tries not to make fun of Brian Stelter, and Mike Lindell once again announces he has evidence that will put Trump back in office.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/1/20/episode-639-january-17-2022 Episode #639: January 17, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex makes exaggerated claims about influencers being paid to promote vaccines. This has been done, like in [https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/21014896-cdphe-vaccine-campaign-comms-plan Colorado] and [https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/13/us/covid-influencer-instagram-tiktok-new-jersey-vaccine-trnd/index.html New Jersey], but it was in the form of a disclosed PSA.
*There was [https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/26/business/pfizer-vaccine-disinformation-influeners.html a strange campaign] to pay influencers [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/08/11/facebook-russia-disformation-covid-vaccine/ to spread misinformation] about the Pfizer vaccine
*Alex tries and fails to cover a Brian Stelter video without making personal attacks
*Conspiracies about Washington state creating internment camps for the unvaccinated are rooted in [https://app.leg.wa.gov/WAC/default.aspx?cite=246-100-040&pdf=true a statute passed in 2003], which was recently [https://www.nbcrightnow.com/news/wa-board-of-health-did-not-enact-covid-internment-camps-or-vaccine-mandate-for-students/article_b986f0ec-740c-11ec-8bf4-dff54e0fb521.html amended to remove stigmatizing language] surrounding HIV/AIDS
*The [https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/global-covid-19/shielding-approach-humanitarian.html CDC document] Alex believes is a plan to put unvaccinated in camps [https://www.factcheck.org/2021/08/scicheck-cdc-document-discusses-strategy-to-protect-displaced-people-from-covid-19/ has nothing to do with that at all]
*Alex believes that a [https://www.naturalnews.com/2021-08-19-fema-documents-isolation-quarantine-round-up-dissenters.html poorly written article on Natural News] reflects FEMA documents about their plans to create internment camps for unvaccinated people in rural areas. This article is actually just a reposting of another [https://steverotter.com/concentration-camps-for-the-unvaccinated/ blog post from a guy named Steve Rotter], who is misrepresenting [https://www.ok.gov/homeland/courses/documents/1505/MGT%20433-PER%20308%20Registration%20Flyer%20-%20Goldsby,%20OK_03-23-16.pdf training] provided by the Rural Domestic Preparedness Consortium Organization that long predates Covid
*Alex is close enough to right about [https://www.rasmussenreports.com/public_content/politics/partner_surveys/jan_2022/crosstabs_heartland_covid_january_5_2022 recent Rasmussen polling]
*Alex misreports on [https://www.sltrib.com/opinion/editorial/2022/01/15/utah-leaders-have/ an op-ed] from a Utah paper
*All of the documents posted on [https://app.leg.wa.gov/WAC/default.aspx the Washington legislature's website] say "certified on October 25, 2019" on them
*Roger Stone had Covid, and is planning to sue everyone
*Roger's story about Richard Nixon and Coretta Scott King is [https://ibw21.org/commentary/richard-nixons-secret-visit-with-coretta-scott-king/ possibly inaccurate]
*In 2008, [https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2008/06/02/the-dirty-trickster Roger took credit for the Brooks Brothers riot]
*Roger seems to have some racist takes about various Florida congressional hopefuls
*Mike Lindell is incorrect about [https://www.deseret.com/utah/2020/11/20/21587694/vote-by-cellphone-pilot-legislature-blockchain-voatz-election-security-cryptocurrency-smartphone alternative voting options] in Utah
*Alex thinks [https://www.vcstar.com/story/opinion/columnists/2022/01/13/column-california-should-abolish-parenthood-name-equity/6513756001/ a satirical article about abolishing parenthood] is a real article making a sincere argument

title: 639: January 17, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check out an "Emergency Saturday Broadcast" Alex put out this weekend.  In this installment, Alex appears to be trying to declare victory over Covid restrictions, while also lying about storms, and once again taking Bill Maher's show too seriously.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/1/23/episode-640-january-22-2022 Episode #640: January 22, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex believes that all around the world, governments are dropping Covid restrictions because he and his anti-vax friends have mounted too strong an opposition. This is almost entirely based on Boris Johnson's [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/uk-covid-restrictions-cases-boris-johnson-ends-rules-england/ recent decision] to lift Covid restrictions, which is a decision that is being criticized by many [https://www.forbes.com/sites/katherinehignett/2022/01/20/uk-covid-19-health-leaders-urge-caution-as-england-drops-restrictions/?sh=67957d1690f1 UK] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/jan/19/sajid-javids-axing-of-all-covid-restrictions-draws-warnings-from-nhs health organizations], and is very strongly suspected to be [https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/jan/20/the-guardian-view-on-dropping-covid-restrictions-follow-the-scandal a political move] meant to appease his party after it came out that he was having parties during the pandemic
*England is dropping their Covid restrictions, but [https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/jan/20/the-guardian-view-on-dropping-covid-restrictions-follow-the-scandal different plans are in place] in Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland. Ireland is [https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/ireland-set-rapidly-drop-almost-all-covid-19-restrictions-2022-01-21/ dropping some]
*Canada doesn't have uniform Covid rules. [https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/covid-19/info/restrictions British Columbia] is [https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2022/01/17/covid-19-restrictions-on-closures-gatherings-to-remain-in-place-in-bc.html maintaining their restrictions], [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/canadas-ontario-start-lifting-covid-related-curbs-quebec-more-cautious-2022-01-20/ as is Quebec, whereas Ontario is easing some up]. There is not uniform motion
*Data is clear that you are [https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#rates-by-vaccine-status more likely to die] and [https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/590748-cdc-unvaccinated-seniors-50-times-more-likely-to-be-hospitalized-than-those more likely] [https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#covidnet-hospitalizations-vaccination to be hospitalized] if you have not been vaccinated than if you have. Even [https://www.khou.com/article/news/health/coronavirus/vaccine/unvaccinated-more-likely-to-die-from-covid-texas/285-2573cd49-e20a-472f-b2cd-ab38129def08 data released by Texas] reflects this
*Albania had to [https://www.euractiv.com/section/politics/short_news/albanian-presidents-impeachment-trial-postponed-over-covid/ postpone impeaching their president] because of Covid
*Albanians are having [https://albaniandailynews.com/news/kosovo-tightens-covid-measures-due-to-grow-of-cases difficulty entering Kosovo] now that they have introduced new Covid restrictions both internally and on the border
*Belize is now requiring tourists entering the country to [https://www.travelandleisure.com/travel-news/belize-to-require-travel-insurance purchase travel insurance]
*Germany is [https://www.dw.com/en/germany-tightens-covid-19-restrictions-on-bars-and-restaurants/a-60355944 tightening their Covid restrictions]
*Italy is [https://www.thelocal.it/20220120/italy-tightens-covid-green-pass-requirements-for-hairdressers-and-shops/ adding new businesses] to those that require a Green Pass to enter
*Greece is going to begin [https://www.schengenvisainfo.com/news/greece-unvaccinated-elderly-to-pay-monthly-fines/ issuing fines to unvaccinated people over 60]
*Turkmenistan is [https://en.turkmen.news/news/turkmenistan-s-commission-to-combat-the-spread-of-disease-steps-up-restrictions-turkmen-news-exclusive/ ramping up Covid restrictions], including putting medical personnel at road-side checkpoints
*Alex misrepresents [https://thehill.com/blogs/in-the-know/in-the-know/576732-shatner-says-he-was-struck-by-fragility-of-this-planet-on-trip William Shatner's comments] upon returning to Earth
*The article "[https://www.wsj.com/articles/looking-forward-to-the-end-of-humanity-11592625661 Looking Forward To The End Of Humanity]" is not about what Alex pretends it is
*Winter storms are [https://www.foxnews.com/us/winter-storm-southeast-mid-atlantic in the forecast], so Alex's prediction of "cyber attacks" isn't really that much of a prediction, since power outages count as "cyber attacks" to him
*Bari Weiss is so on the left that she is trying to start [https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2021/11/bari-weisss-university-hitting-speed-bumps an "anti-Cancel Culture" university]
*[https://www.thedailybeast.com/former-proud-boy-leader-kyle-based-stickman-chapman-arrested-for-attacking-health-care-workers-in-idaho Based Stickman got arrested]
*Warnings about Russian troops heading to the border of Ukraine have been [https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/russia-ukraine-invasion/2021/12/03/98a3760e-546b-11ec-8769-2f4ecdf7a2ad_story.html on the radar for almost two months now]
*Alex's story about the 2021 winter storm in Texas is a complete fabrication, particularly the part about the Department of Energy not allowing Texas to increase energy production. [https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2021/02/23/fact-check-doe-order-let-texas-power-agencies-exceed-emissions-limits/4546085001/ The opposite is true]
*The [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/01/19/texas-pipeline-gas-power-winter/ $21.6 million that was being demanded that Luminant pay or else Energy Transfer LP would turn off the flow of gas] had nothing to do with federal regulations or government fines. It was a financial dispute between the two companies, and it actually had [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/01/20/texas-power-plants-gas-pipeline/ been resolved two days before] Alex recorded this episode

*Alex may have read Stewart Rhodes' indictment, and may have turned on him

title: 642: January 24, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan discuss Alex's return to the studio from his camping trip.  In this installment, Alex loves the Canadian trucker convoy, gets deeply transphobic (probably because of Minnie Mouse), and Roger Stone backs some weirdo Congressional candidates who won't make it out of the primary.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/1/30/episode-643-january-28-2022 Episode #643: January 28, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex is very excited about the Canadian trucker convoy
*There [https://www.statista.com/statistics/947317/canadian-trucking-industry-total-drivers/ aren't a million truckers] in Canada
*Numbers of participants [https://www.baytoday.ca/business/trucker-convoy-continues-east-to-winnipeg-after-making-overnight-stop-near-regina-4991652 have varied] depending on [https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/truck-convoy-rolls-into-kingston-ont-1.5756220 who you ask], but it's definitely lower than Alex thinks
*Canada Trucking Association [http://cantruck.ca/canadian-trucking-alliance-statement-to-those-engaged-in-road-border-protests/ released a statement] denouncing and discouraging the convoy
*[https://globalnews.ca/news/8532791/covid-unvaccinated-restrictions-tax-poll/ Ipsos poll] finds that the Canadian public is not opposed to public health measures
*The convoy was organized by Tamara Lich, the secretary of the Western secessionist Maverick Party. The party's leader Jay Hill has been using the convoy as [https://westernstandardonline.com/2022/01/maverick-party-says-it-supports-truckers-right-to-protest-peacefully/ a means to attack Trudeau]
*There are [https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/vaccine-protest-convoy-gofundme-donations-1.6330594 some suspicions] about the money coming in to the convoy's GoFundMe
*Canada Unity is [https://canada-unity.com/mou/ essentially calling for an overthrow of the Canadian government]
*[https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2022/01/29/small-group-of-protesters-set-up-blockade-at-houlton-woodstock-border-crossing-in-belleville.html Maine/New Brunswick border] crossing blocked

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/b22d23f8-1d98-4532-922c-d0633f67bcd7/SoupKitchen.JPG|thumb|none]]

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/1ab73cd3-6aff-4546-8b96-48f246f57500/SoupKitchen2.JPG|thumb|none]]

*[https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatoon/truck-convoy-vaccination-freedoms-1.6330176 CBC article] about the restrictions truckers are already under, including a [https://www.solvhealth.com/health-a-z/dot-physical DOT physical]
*[https://iop.harvard.edu/forum/strengthening-collaboration-fractured-world-featuring-special-guest-yo-yo-ma Full video] of the minute long clip of Klaus Schwab talking about [https://www.younggloballeaders.org/vision-and-mission the Young Global Leaders program]
*Mike Crispi has [https://ballotpedia.org/Mike_Crispi no chance in the primary]
*Jackson Lehmeyer is running [https://www.washingtonpost.com/religion/2021/09/15/pastor-donate-vaccine-religious-exemption/?pml=1&request-id=1cb4393c-dd8a-4891-8117-b911a1e163b5 a religious vaccine exemption con]
*The news about the [https://apnews.com/article/pennsylvania-voting-donald-trump-tom-wolf-31b4e7d0b16a996c63079c8aa3c3b121 Pennsylvania court's decision] about mail-in ballots is not as meaningful as folks like Roger may be making it
*The new version of the Ashli Babbitt killing is just [https://www.zerohedge.com/political/stop-no-dont-babbitt-tried-stop-attack-capitol-speakers-lobby-video-analysis-suggests based on a Zero Hedge post], and [https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/jan/21/youtube-videos/ashli-babbitt-vs-antifa-video-falsely-claims-babbi/ it's not true]

title: 643: January 28, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in to see how things went when Marjorie Taylor Greene dropped by to chat with Alex.  Also in this installment, Alex gets gross and then later gets real esoteric about touching eternity.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/2/3/episode-644-february-2-2022 Episode #644: February 2, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex misreports [https://sites.krieger.jhu.edu/iae/files/2022/01/A-Literature-Review-and-Meta-Analysis-of-the-Effects-of-Lockdowns-on-COVID-19-Mortality.pdf a meta-analysis] released by an entity within Johns Hopkins about lockdowns
*Some states in the US [https://ballotpedia.org/States_that_issued_lockdown_and_stay-at-home_orders_in_response_to_the_coronavirus_(COVID-19)_pandemic,_2020 didn't issue any] lockdowns or stay-at-home orders
*Alex misreports [https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/japans-kowa-says-ivermectin-effective-against-omicron-phase-iii-trial-2022-01-31/ an article from Reuters] about ivermectin
*Alex misreports the story about [https://www.washingtonpost.com/media/2022/02/02/cnn-president-jeff-zucker-announces-resignation-over-undisclosed-relationship-with-colleague/ Jeff Zucker stepping down] at CNN
*The guys who run the Brain In A Vat YouTube channel have taken down their video with Steven Kershnar, but the episode where [https://www.audible.com/pd/Unregistered-142-Stephen-Kershnar-Podcast/B08PK21JLF he is on the Unregistered Podcast] is still available
*Kershnar's [https://philpeople.org/profiles/15070/publication_attributions?page=2 publishing history], and the referenced issue of [https://reasonpapers.com/pdf/33/rp_33.pdf Reason Papers]
*Kirschnar wrote [https://philpapers.org/rec/KERTMS an article on this topic] in 2001 and [https://philpapers.org/rec/KERPAA-7 a book on it] in 2015
*Libertarians having a problem with age of consent laws is a subject that is so well-known that it's [https://knowyourmeme.com/photos/1901690-political-compass the basis for many memes]
*Alex misreports [https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2022/02/fact-check-dod-whistleblowers-mind-blowing-covid-vaccine-injury-numbers-were-not-based-on-accurate-data.html a story about Department of Defense data] about Covid vaccine side-effects
*Marjorie Taylor Greene does not have [https://ballotpedia.org/Marjorie_Taylor_Greene the best electoral record]
*Doug Kuzma [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/us/conspiracy-theorist-doug-kuzma-dies-from-covid/ar-AASvuiQ died from Covid] after attending the same Dallas rally Alex spoke at
*The Compete Act [https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/senate-bill/1260 passed the Senate in July], and the House version seems to include the word fentanyl [https://rules.house.gov/sites/democrats.rules.house.gov/files/BILLS-117HR4521RH-RCP117-31.pdf more than once]
*Greene's record on Jan. 6 [https://www.cnn.com/2021/03/24/politics/kfile-marjorie-taylor-greene-ally-us-capitol/index.html is not good]
*She is also a raving [https://www.vox.com/22254103/marjorie-taylor-greene-david-hogg-obama-hillary-facebook-posts conspiracy theorist]
*One Jan. 6 arrestee [https://www.businessinsider.com/capitol-riot-defendant-request-solitary-confinement-avoid-jan6-jail-wing-2021-10 asked to be sent to solitary confinement] rather than be in the Jan. 6 wing of the prison
*Trump's administration [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-47480207 increased drone attacks], [https://foreignpolicy.com/2017/08/09/donald-trump-is-dropping-bombs-at-unprecedented-levels/ dropped more bombs], and [https://www.newsweek.com/trump-has-already-killed-more-civilians-obama-us-fight-against-isis-653564 killed more civilians] than the previous administration, and should never be considered a force for peace

title: 645: November 4, 2014

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check back in on the present day of the Alex Jones Show.  In this installment, Alex reveals a confusing understanding of the world's power structure, overhypes a German mock trial full of weirdos, and the gents get fascinated with Roger Stone's online store.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/2/9/episode-646-february-6-2022 Episode #646: February 6, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex discusses a headline that was [https://nypost.com/2022/02/04/bloomberg-accidentally-reports-that-russia-invaded-ukraine/ accidentally published by Bloomberg] about Russia invading Ukraine
*Alex believes in a distorted version of events in the beginning of the Russia-Georgia war in 2008. All indications are that it had to do with Russia being [https://knowledge-fight.squarespace.com/config/pages/58cef54b8419c2ea932d683e staunchly against Georgia joining NATO], which was an aim that was affirmed in [https://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/official_texts_8443.htm the Bucharest Summit]
*Alex claims that chemical weapons attacks in Douma in 2018 were fake, and that videos of victims were faked. He believes this because of [https://theintercept.com/2018/04/26/russia-brings-syrians-hague-make-underwhelming-case-chemical-attack-fake/ a very suspicious video] that was released by Russia-24 news network that is at best unreliable. The [https://www.opcw.org/sites/default/files/documents/2019/03/s-1731-2019%28e%29.pdf OPCW final report] does not agree with the assessment that the attacks were fake
*The Dutch reporter in China [https://sports.yahoo.com/dutch-tv-reporter-who-was-dragged-away-during-live-olympic-segment-212647442.html was not disappeared] or taken to a facility
*Both Pelosi and the White House's comments about protesting in China during the Olympics [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/white-house-china-olympics-protesting-b2009657.html could have been expressed better]
*The [https://www.brandeis.edu/peace-conflict/pdfs/198-methods-non-violent-action.pdf 198 ways to nonviolently protest] was written by Gene Sharp, it's not from the Pentagon
*This [https://ratical.org/PandemicParallaxView/GrandJury-CourtOfPublicOpinion.html fake trial in Germany] is not going anywhere and is full of embarrassing weirdos
*Nancy Ana Garner wrote a judge [https://www.kob.com/albuquerque-news/backstreet-grills-attorney-reportedly-crosses-line-judge-threatens-sanctions/6242477/ a "truly shocking" letter]
*The [https://www.foxnews.com/politics/top-oversight-republicans-7-scientists-testify-covid-origins-wuhan-lab-leak republicans on the Oversight and Reform Committee] are going to question some scientists about Covid origins
*Roger is trying to re-run [https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2021/nov/03/roger-stone/why-roger-stones-claim-about-phantom-voters-florid/ his election fraud stories from last October]
*Issues between Russia and Ukraine likely have to do with [https://www.nato.int/cps/en/natohq/topics_37750.htm NATO membership], not necessarily just missile placement
*Mike Flynn has been calling for martial law and seizing the voting machines [https://www.newsweek.com/donald-trump-should-declare-martial-law-michael-flynn-retweeted-his-now-banned-account-1654226 since just after the election], publicly

title: 646: February 6, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan tune in to hear Alex go really overboard trying to drum up fear of Russia starting a thermonuclear war, only to have one of his guests ruin all the fun. Plus, Alex finds a fitting representative to speak about the Ottawa protests, and Ted Anderson drops by, but he's not selling gold.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/2/11/episode-647-february-8-2022 Episode #647: February 8, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex covers [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/video/vladimirputin/video-2608603/Video-Vladimir-Putin-warns-possible-nuclear-war-Ukraine-joins-NATO.html a Daily Mail article] about [http://en.kremlin.ru/events/president/transcripts/67735 a Putin speech], which he insists he did further research on, but absolutely did not
*Putin changed [https://www.armscontrol.org/act/2000-05/russias-military-doctrine Russia's military doctrine] to allow for nuclear strikes in more situations, which many view as a piece of using such threats as [https://www.politico.eu/article/nato-putin-russia-nuclear-weapons-ukraine-war/ a bargaining chip/propaganda tool], as they did with [https://www.rferl.org/a/1074816.html many situations] [https://thediplomat.com/2014/07/russia-threatens-nuclear-strikes-over-crimea/ in the past]
*Alex does not seem to understand what [https://www.nato.int/cps/en/natohq/topics_110496.htm Article 5] of the NATO's Washington Treaty
*The Capitol Police may be [https://www.politico.com/news/2022/01/24/capitol-police-social-media-00000948 looking into public information] about people who meet with congress members, but the claims about spying on House members [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/02/08/troy-nehls-investigation-capitol-police/ seems unfounded]
*Alex's guest to talk about the Ottawa trucker situation also [http://anti-racistcanada.blogspot.com/2020/02/jeremy-mackenzie-nova-scotia-based.html seems to have a livestream] where he speaks highly of notorious [https://www.splcenter.org/fighting-hate/extremist-files/individual/david-irving holocaust deniers like David Irving]
*[https://www.southernminn.com/blooming_prairie_leader/news/state/article_af48c1c1-f8ad-5cfe-b313-c2b4010cc504.html Ted Anderson is a co-defendant] in Alex's Sandy Hook lawsuit in Connecticut, through his companies Midas Resources and GCN
*Alex [https://www.dhs.gov/ntas/advisory/national-terrorism-advisory-system-bulletin-february-07-2022 misreports on a DHS bulletin]
*Joel Skousen thinks that the fall of the Soviet Union was a false flag
*Wayne Allen Root wants Trump to be Speaker of the House and he wants credit for the idea

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan follow Alex's advice to mark Feb. 11 on their calendars as the day that the Globalists' plot collapsed entirely. Also, Alex tries to walk back Rogan's apology for him, and explains what it's like to be in the literal presence of God.

Citations

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/2/13/episode-648-february-11-2022 Episode #648: February 11, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex claims that the crime rate in Ottawa is currently almost zero. [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/-just-dont-feel-safe-ottawa-residents-describe-fears-trucker-protest-c-rcna15218 There are] [https://www.ottawapolice.ca/Modules/News/index.aspx?lang=en&newsId=eea9ddff-2d3a-4327-8a2b-34fa5c39579c crimes happening] and a drastic [https://www.ottawapolice.ca/Modules/News/index.aspx?lang=en&newsId=6a1ea331-1152-4592-a365-884abcd8778c increase in reported hate-motivated crimes] compared to [https://www.ottawapolice.ca/en/news-and-community/resources/Hate-Crimes-2019-2020.pdf past years]
*The largest impact of the trucker blockade of the border has been [https://www.cnn.com/2022/02/10/business/canadian-trucker-protest-us-canada-auto-plants/index.html on the automotive industry], which may hurt the manufacturing sector in American jobs, which Alex should be worried about
*[https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/infection-rate-keeps-falling-as-covid-cabinet-set-to-debate-green-pass-scheme-1.10581685 Israel rolled back] their Green Pass system, but it wasn't for [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/coronavirus/1642963469-israel-s-health-ministry-considering-scrapping-green-pass-rules very inspiring reasons]
*Alex makes up a story about [https://physicsworld.com/a/graphene-biosensor-will-drive-new-innovations-in-brain-controlled-robotics/ a Physics World article] out of whole cloth
*There is an emergency declaration [https://ottawa.ca/en/news/mayor-watson-declares-state-emergency-ottawa-due-ongoing-demonstration in Ottawa] and [https://toronto.ctvnews.ca/ontario-declares-a-state-of-emergency-to-end-siege-in-ottawa-and-windsor-1.5777336 in Ontario]
*Alex [https://www.businessinsider.com/biden-wont-send-troops-rescue-americans-if-russia-attacks-ukraine-2022-2 misreports a headline] about Biden's comments about Russia

title: 648: February 11, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan enjoy the very special Valentine's Day edition of The Alex Jones Show. In this installment, Alex pushes a wild new medical conspiracy, celebrates a victory with Roger Stone, and interviews one of the more unhinged doctors ever on the program.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/2/15/episode-649-february-14-2022 Episode #649: February 14, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex gets on board the "vaccine gives people AIDS" (or "VAIDS") train
*He says that more heterosexuals are being diagnosed with HIV, but that is just a misreading of [https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/feb/09/hiv-infects-heterosexual-gay-bisexual-men-uk-testing-virus a recent Guardian article]
*The Moderna research into an mRNA HIV vaccine has been in the works for over a year now. They just launched their [https://www.healthline.com/health-news/moderna-launches-clinical-trial-of-its-mrna-based-hiv-vaccine phase 1 human trials]
*A new variant of HIV was [https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.abk1688 identified in the Netherlands], but all the details Alex describes about the story are made up
*Alex misrepresents [https://transcripts.cnn.com/show/fzgps/date/2014-05-25/segment/01 George Soros's comments] about Ukraine from a 2014 interview with Fareed Zakaria
*Alex and Roger Stone misreport the contents of the [https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.dcd.235638/gov.uscourts.dcd.235638.35.0_1.pdf Durham filing]
*[https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/14/us/politics/durham-sussmann-trump-russia.html NYT article] about Durham filing. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/02/15/heres-why-trump-once-again-is-claiming-spying-by-democrats/ Washington Post article] about Durham filing
*Alex's previous guest about the Ottawa convoy, [https://pressprogress.ca/meet-the-extremists-and-social-media-influencers-at-the-centre-of-the-far-right-siege-of-ottawa/ Jeremy Mackenzie], is also [https://www.antihate.ca/holocaust_denier_travelling_canada_building_up_far_right_militia_diagolon_alex_vriend the de facto leader of a neo-fascist group] that wants to create a new country called Diagolon. He also was recently arrested on gun charges, and a piece of body armor recently seized by Canadian police at the protests in Coutts [https://globalnews.ca/news/8621125/canadian-anti-hate-network-concerned-diagolon-coutts-border-protest-diagolon/ had a Diagolon patch on it]
*Alex interviews a guy named Dr. Marble who has nothing but bad ideas
*An insurance CEO [https://thehill.com/changing-america/well-being/longevity/588738-huge-huge-numbers-death-rates-up-40-percent-over-pre did say that deaths were way up] since the pandemic began, but he did not say that these are not Covid-deaths

title: 649: February 14, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan take a little breaky from the present to go back and experience some Alex Jones of the past.  In this installment, Alex interviews the parent of a high school whiz kid, and a guy who claims to be a former assassin for Interpol.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/2/17/episode-650-july-17-2003 Episode #650: July 17, 2003]</ref>:

*Alex incorrectly thinks that home-schooled children win [https://www.howtohomeschool.com/homeschool-advice/become-a-spelling-bee-champion all the spelling bees]
*Alex interviews Daniel Lipsman, the father of [https://www.bmcc.cuny.edu/news/early-riser/ a whiz kid] who was not being awarded a college diploma because she wasn't old enough to be given a high school equivalence degree
*Daniel Lipsman was trying to sue the New York School Board, which he had done [https://calculators.law/caselaw/decisions/59nNa7Vj8lJV/lipsman-v-new-york-city-board-of-education in 1999] and [https://www.nytimes.com/1993/09/10/nyregion/day-for-second-guessing-on-asbestos-delay.html in 1993], which is too many times for a person to sue a school board
*Daniel also may have written [https://books.google.com/books?dq=%22Daniel%20Jean%20Lipsman%22&hl=en&id=3T8hAQAAIAAJ&lpg=PA3122&ots=lmf_mFf4Dm&pg=PA3122&sa=X&sig=ACfU3U0B-BRE9q5BPiEwns5ns2xgapOuwQ&source=bl&ved=2ahUKEwjx0LHUg4b2AhWpmOAKHVwKAds4ChDoAXoECB0QAw#v=onepage&q=%22Daniel%20Jean%20Lipsman%22&f=false a book called The Jewish Connection], and he received [https://vote.nyc/sites/default/files/pdf/election_results/2020/20201103General%20Election/00100300013New%20York%20Representative%20in%20Congress%2013th%20Congressional%20District%20Recap.pdf two write-in votes] for a House seat in the 2020 election
*Alex interview a guy named Dr. David Race Bannon, who claims to be a former assassin working for Interpol to kill human traffickers
*David Race Bannon entirely [https://web.archive.org/web/20061014173440/http://www.charlotte.com/mld/charlotte/14897513.htm made up this story], and he was [https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2006/January/06_usncb_049.html arrested for criminal impersonation] a few years after this interview, and got [https://www.denverpost.com/2006/06/29/briefs-630-3/ five years probation]
*Part of the unraveling of Bannon's backstory was due to [https://web.archive.org/web/20071029061412/http://www.bullshido.net/modules.php?file=viewarticle&id=226&name=Reviews a martial arts message board] being offended that he lied about his black belt in hapkido
*It [http://www.newhorizonpressbooks.com does not appear] that New Horizon is [https://permissions.penguinrandomhouse.com/imprints.php an imprint of Penguin Books]

title: 650: July 17, 2003

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan sit down to discuss an episode of the Alex Jones Show where Alex makes it super clear he's on Russia's side regarding Ukraine.  Also, Alex makes up a bunch of stuff about the Canadian convoy situation, and prostrates himself in front of David Icke.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/2/20/episode-651-february-18-2022 Episode #651: February 18, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex has decided that NATO is invading "Russian-held areas in Ukraine" in an attempt to lure Russia into a war
*Alex wrongly claims that [https://web.archive.org/web/20111217151026/http://2001.ukrcensus.gov.ua/eng/results/general/nationality/ the Donbas region] is 98% Russian
*Russia's [https://huri.harvard.edu/files/huri/files/idp_report_3_burkhardt_et_al.pdf?m=1642520438 strategy of passportization]
*Artur Pawlowski was [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/pawlowski-charges-bail-denied-coutts-protest-blockade-1.6354354 arrested] and [https://calgaryherald.com/news/crime/street-church-minister-to-remain-behind-bars-pending-trial-for-allegedly-inciting-border-blockade has been denied bail]
*4 protesters at Coutts charged with [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/coutts-protest-charges-laid-court-appearance-bail-1.6352482 conspiracy to murder RCMP members]
*Bomb threats to a [https://o.canada.com/news/local-news/all-clear-given-after-bomb-threat-at-the-ottawa-hospital hospital in Ottawa], the [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/windsor/windsor-bomb-threat-arrest-1.6355526 mayor of Windsor], and [https://www.beaconjournal.com/story/news/2022/02/11/akron-area-man-calls-ottawa-ohio-make-bomb-threat-canada/6753322001/ Ottawa, Ohio]
*[https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/tamara-lich-bail-hearing-february-19-1.6358307 Tamara Lich], [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/convoy-organizers-charged-bail-1.6357263 Chris Barber], and [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/king-charges-ottawa-police-convoy-1.6358079 Pat King] all arrested and charged
*The police chief in Ottawa [https://www.nytimes.com/live/2022/02/15/world/canada-protests-news Peter Sloly resigned]
*Tow truck companies were [https://www.newsweek.com/canadian-towing-company-ignore-trudeau-order-disrupt-trucker-protests-1679957 not necessarily in support of the protest], but [https://globalnews.ca/news/8625386/canada-convoy-blockades-towing-companies/ seemed to be afraid to aid police] because of the possibility of reprisals from the protesters
*Making accusations of ethnic cleansing of Russians has been a consistent pattern of Putin (and Medvedev) prior to invasions in [https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSLC605039 2008], [https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/vladimir-putin-says-russia-will-not-allow-ethnic-cleansing-in-ukraine-1.2837324 2014], and now it's happening in the present
*In relation to both [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/jan/21/russia-human-rights-violation-georgia-war-echr-ruling the 2008 war with Georgia] and the [https://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/20/opinion/russia-is-trying-to-wipe-out-crimeas-tatars.html 2014 annexation of Crimea], there are very serious concerns that Russian forces actually were engaging in ethnic cleansing
*Biden said that he was [https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2022/02/18/remarks-by-president-biden-providing-an-update-on-russia-and-ukraine-2/ not going to send troops into Ukraine], but would support Ukraine and impose sanctions
*Chrystia Freeland's grandfather was the editor of [https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/politics/freeland-knew-her-grandfather-was-editor-of-nazi-newspaper/article34236881/ a publication that printed anti-Semitic content] based in Poland in WWII
*David Icke isn't crying, but he could be
*The [https://howbad.info/index.html How Bad Is My Batch website] is absurd

title: 651: February 18, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan trace Alex's positions in the days prior to Russia invading Ukraine, compared to what he says after the fact.  Also, Roger Stone still needs money for fake lawsuits and Alex is mad that CNN is doing a special about him.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/2/25/episode-652-february-21-2022 Episode #652: February 21, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex poorly navigates the lead-up to and the invasion of Ukraine
*Alex refers to the Donetsk Compact, which is most likely the [https://www.ft.com/content/ed40d675-16b3-4a35-a157-b9bf0078b507 Minsk Agreements]
*Alex misreports on [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2619860/Pro-Russian-crowd-storms-police-HQ-Ukraine-port.html a video of Ukrainian police from 2014], saying it's from Covid protests
*Alex lies that the LGBTQ community [https://www.reuters.com/article/russia-lgbt-attitudes/feature-arrested-and-harrassed-russias-lgbt-community-fears-crackdown-worsening-idUSL8N1W51TT aren't targeted] [https://www.state.gov/reports/2020-country-reports-on-human-rights-practices/russia/ in Russia]
*Alex doesn't really understand [http://en.kremlin.ru/events/president/news/67828 Putin's speech from Feb. 21]
*Alex claims that there is no Ukrainian resistance to the invasion, which is [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20220224-battle-underway-for-airbase-on-kyiv-outskirts not true]
*Alex claims that the question of siding with Russia or the West is 50/50 in Ukraine, which is [https://www.iri.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/FOR-RELEASE-2021-November-Survey-of-Residents-of-Ukraine_ENG.pdf not] [https://www.unian.info/society/some-64-of-ukrainians-stand-for-ukraine-s-accession-to-nato-poll-11395534.html true]
*Roger Stone claims that Jewish people are being made to register in Eastern Ukraine, but this is likely a reference to a [https://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/ukraine-crisis/who-behind-letters-ordering-jews-east-ukraine-register-n83926 hoax story] [https://time.com/67272/ukraine-jew-register-donetsk/ from 2014]
*[https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/22322 Alex lies] to pretend that Pelosi doesn't know what country Ukraine is

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan continue to track Alex's shameful coverage of the invasion of Ukraine.  Also, the gents deconstruct how Alex's video about predicting the invasion last year is a manipulative lie.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/2/27/episode-653-february-25-2022 Episode #653: February 25, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex's claim of having predicted the invasion of Ukraine back in fall/winter 2021 is a lie
*Alex believes that the invasion is the West's fault, for providing military aid to Ukraine
*Alex misrepresents comments about NATO possibly invoking Article 5 if Russia does a cyber attack. This is something that has been discussed [https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-49488614 going back to at least 2019], including in [https://www.prospectmagazine.co.uk/world/nato-will-defend-itself-summit-jens-stoltenberg-cyber-security an op-ed written by the Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg]
*[https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/02/12/AR2007021200555.html Putin's argument] that the West promised Russia to not expand NATO is [https://csis-website-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/s3fs-public/legacy_files/files/publication/twq09aprilkramer.pdf not totally accurate], and [https://www.rbth.com/international/2014/10/16/mikhail_gorbachev_i_am_against_all_walls_40673.html Gorbachev has even said] that this was not part of the negotiations that he was literally a part of
*Alex lies about [https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fviro.2022.834808/full a new paper about Covid]. He's only read [https://weather.com/en-IN/india/coronavirus/news/2022-02-26-new-study-finds-covid-19-dna-linked-to-moderna-patent-filed-in the Daily Mail article] about it, and is exaggerating things from there
*Alex makes up stories about some Chinese media [https://chinadigitaltimes.net/2022/02/minitrue-keep-weibo-posts-on-ukraine-favorable-to-russia-control-comments/ propaganda documents] that got leaked. Also, the [https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2022/feb/23/china-restricts-media-criticism-russia/ Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson has an identical position] about Putin's invasion as Alex does

Today, Dan and Jordan continue to be astounded by Alex Jones' terrible coverage of Putin's invasion of Ukraine.  In this installment, Alex throws a tantrum, either because the pressure is getting to him, or because he just prepared too much for this episode.

mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/3/1/episode-654-february-27-2022 Episode #654: February 27, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex tries to one-up himself in terms of bad coverage of Putin's invasion of Ukraine
*Alex claims that there are more studies coming out that show Covid was made in a lab, whereas the reality is that [https://www.biospace.com/article/new-studies-support-wuhan-wet-market-as-origin-of-covid-19/ studies are coming out] showing that it was almost certainly naturally occurring
*Alex blows up, threatens to leave the show, and goes on to rant about how Russia is the new America
*Alex decides that he also likes Belarussian dictator Alexander Lukashenko, [https://www.hrw.org/world-report/2022/country-chapters/belarus who sucks]

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan take a little breaky into the past to see what Alex was up to back in 2003.  In this installment, Alex reveals that most gay people are cannibals, gets annoyed at some callers, and a couple real weird militia guys come up.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/3/3/episode-655-july-18-2003 Episode #655: July 18, 2003]</ref>:

*Alex thinks gay people are mostly cannibals who want to get AIDS
*Robin Page [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/2496605.stm wasn't arrested for saying "homosexual"]
*Alex is misreporting on a [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/3286721.stm the story about Armin Meiwes], the German cannibal
*Rick Stanley [https://www.co.routt.co.us/DocumentCenter/View/1927/2002GeneralElectionOfficalResults?bidId= got 111 votes] in his 2002 Senate run
*Rick Stanley [https://web.archive.org/web/20020706125723/http://www.rockymountainnews.com/drmn/election/article/0,1299,DRMN_36_1244167,00.html posted a racist poem] in an online discussion about immigration
*Rick Stanley wasn't arrested for bringing a gun to a courthouse, it was for [https://alt.politics.libertarian.narkive.com/jw9dwJbH/libertarian-rick-stanley-sent-to-th-slammer-for-6-years threatening a couple judges]. He was found guilty and his [https://caselaw.findlaw.com/co-court-of-appeals/1469020.html appeal was rejected]
*In 1996, Gary DeMott [https://www.spokesman.com/stories/1996/sep/12/common-law-group-threatens-to-arrest-officials/ attempted to take over a county] in Idaho

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan continue to follow Alex's awful coverage of the invasion of Ukraine.  In this installment, Alex names his successor, declares that he's traveled beyond God's consciousness, and admits to framing a meme.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/3/6/episode-656-march-5-2022 Episode #656: March 5, 2022]</ref>:

*[https://www.bundesregierung.de/breg-en/news/policy-statement-by-olaf-scholz-chancellor-of-the-federal-republic-of-germany-and-member-of-the-german-bundestag-27-february-2022-in-berlin-2008378 Olaf Scholz speech] about Germany's [https://www.vox.com/22960493/germany-chancellor-reversal-defense-war-russia-ukraine change in policies]
*Scholz had spoken about Ukraine not entering NATO [https://www.politico.eu/article/ukraines-nato-membership-not-on-the-agenda-says-scholz/ prior to the invasion]
*The US has [https://www.state.gov/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/05-829-Ukraine-Weapons.pdf a weapons nonproliferation treaty] with Ukraine that involves helping modernize certain labs, but Ukraine runs them
*The theory that Ukraine has US-run bioweapon labs has been [https://www.thedailybeast.com/russia-china-team-up-to-peddle-insane-us-covid-lab-theory a conspiracy pushed by Russian media] for a while, and is not true
*Alex thinks that Ukraine is lying about [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2022/03/05/mariupol-ukraine-russia-evacuation-invasion/ Russia attacking humanitarian corridors], because he thinks that Ukraine and Zelensky are liars [https://www.dw.com/en/fact-check-ukraines-ghost-of-kyiv-fighter-pilot/a-60951825 for no] [https://www.cnn.com/2022/02/28/europe/snake-island-ukraine-russia-survivors-alive-intl/index.html good reason]
*Alex makes up a bunch of stuff about the [https://jhsphcenterforhealthsecurity.s3.amazonaws.com/spars-pandemic-scenario.pdf SPARS 2025 document]
*Alex printed out a meme based on [https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/wow-this-is-just-like-1984/photos/sort/oldest a format meant to make fun of people like him], who compare everything to 1984
*Alex doesn't realize Soylent Green is [https://www.theguardian.com/books/2020/mar/24/make-room-make-room-versus-soylent-green-can-film-trump-book based on a book] that is totally different from the movie
*[https://www.theblaze.com/news/review-the-federal-government-paid-media-companies-to-advertise-for-the-vaccines The Blaze article] does not include any information that would have been gathered by a FOIA request
*Alex has "seen beyond the consciousness of God"
*Alex lies about [https://www.statnews.com/2017/01/10/moderna-trouble-mrna/ a Stat News article]
*[https://asiasociety.org/video/when-societies-open-global-philanthropic-footprint-george-soros-complete Full version of Soros conversation] at the Asia Society
*Alex won't stop talking about memes

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on how Marjorie Taylor Greene has been showing up more on Infowars lately.

Content warning: this episode does cover a fair amount of transphobic territory

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/3/10/episode-658-its-easy-being-greene Episode #658: It's Easy Being Greene]</ref>:

*Marjorie Taylor Greene has been making more frequent appearances on Infowars
*Most of [https://www.congress.gov/member/marjorie-greene/G000596?q=%7B%22sponsorship%22%3A%22sponsored%22%7D&r=1 the bills Greene has introduced] are meaningless right-wing media bait
*When Teddy Roosevelt did his Man In The Arena speech, [https://www.archives.gov/milestone-documents/19th-amendment women couldn't vote]
*Unfortunately, the first woman in the Senate was [https://www.washingtonpost.com/history/2022/01/10/rebecca-felton-last-enslaver/ a full-on white supremacist who had slaves]
*The America First Caucus had [https://punchbowl.news/wp-content/uploads/America-First-Caucus-Policy-Platform-FINAL-2.pdf some pretty bad ideas], and also was [https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2021/04/16/trump-loyalists-start-america-first-caucus-promote-us-uniquely-anglo-saxon/ a complete bust]
*Elaine Chao's family has [https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/02/us/politics/elaine-chao-china.html business interests in China], but it doesn't seem to justify claiming she's "on the Chinese payroll"
*Greene [https://www.govtrack.us/congress/members/marjorie_greene/456814 has been fined approximately $78K] for refusing to wear a mask in Congress, which is about [https://censusreporter.org/profiles/50000US1314-congressional-district-14-ga/ 3 times the annual per capita salary of people in her district]
*Greene's [https://projects.propublica.org/represent/members/G000596-marjorie-taylor-greene voting record]
*The [https://www.losangelesblade.com/2022/02/19/non-binary-camp-counselors-enrage-parents-of-los-alamitos-fifth-graders/ underlying story] about the non-binary counselor at a science camp
*Camp Pali is [https://www.paliinstitute.com/best-luxury-science-camp-in-southern-california/ a pretty high-end camp], and the cabins are not rustic, outdoorsy cabins. [https://paliadventures.com/about/accommodations/ They are essentially hotels]
*Georgia is the state with the [https://williamsinstitute.law.ucla.edu/publications/trans-adults-united-states/ fourth highest population of people who identify as trans]
*Alex is lying about a story about [https://www.arabnews.com/node/1923996/sport an MMA fighter dying after a fight]
*[https://www.congress.gov/roll-call-votes List of roll call votes] in previous sessions of Congress
*[https://www.opensecrets.org/members-of-congress/marjorie-taylor-greene/contributors?cid=N00044701&cycle=2022&recs=100&type=I Greene's contributors] this election cycle
*[https://www.propublica.org/article/marjorie-taylor-greene-appeared-in-a-super-pac-ad-asking-for-money-that-might-break-the-rules Greene's shady behavior] with the Stop Socialism Now PAC
*Greene and Matt Gaetz's attempted PAC [https://www.salon.com/2021/10/17/matt-gaetz-mtgs-pac-has-blown-through-all-of-its-money-in-last-six-months-report_partner/ didn't work out]
*Greene was in Texas to [https://www.texasmonthly.com/news-politics/marjorie-taylor-greene-houston-collins/ try to support a losing candidate] in a GOP primary, along with Mike Lindell
*Roger Stone goes with the "[https://www.washingtonpost.com/investigations/interactive/2022/roger-stone-documentary-capitol-riot-trump-election/ deep fake defense]" for the videos of him doing shady stuff that got released by the Washington Post
*Greene's [https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-resolution/968/text Congressional Voting Accountability Act] is destined for failure
*Thomas Jefferson's [https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/HMAN-112/pdf/HMAN-112-jeffersonman.pdf Manual of Parliamentary Practice]

Citation
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/3/17/episode-660-february-11-2014 Episode #660: February 11, 2014]</ref>:

*It's Alex's 40th birthday, which barely comes up
*David Icke and noted Piss Doctor Edward Group drop by
*Alex overreports [https://www.realclearpolitics.com/video/2014/02/10/obama_the_good_thing_as_president_i_can_do_whatever_i_want.html a video of Obama] saying he can do whatever he wants
*Alex misreports [https://www.reuters.com/article/us-france-supertax/france-waves-discreet-goodbye-to-75-percent-super-tax-idUSKBN0K11CC20141223 France's tax brackets]
*Mark Witaschek's house was searched because of an [https://www.mediamatters.org/tucker-carlson/how-man-accused-threatening-his-wife-gun-became-conservative-media-hero ugly] [https://casetext.com/case/witaschek-v-dist-of-columbia divorce]
*A National Guard [https://web.archive.org/web/20130120060643/https://www.wsaz.com/news/headlines/Mock-Disaster-Training-Exercise-in-Scioto-County-187322931.html exercise in Ohio] involves a scenario featuring people mad about the second amendment, but plenty of [https://www.defense.gov/News/News-Stories/Article/Article/602957/northcoms-vibrant-response-exercise-reaches-midpoint/ other] [https://www.jbmdl.jb.mil/News/Article/826828/new-york-national-guard-tests-homeland-response-force/ exercises] [https://publicintelligence.net/north-carolina-national-guard-rrf-photos/ involve] [https://www.nationalguard.mil/News/Article/575698/special-operations-trains-in-hostage-scenario-with-south-carolina-national-guard/ different] types of characters
*Infowars fans Jerad and Amanda Miller killed three people in Las Vegas, and [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jun/09/las-vegas-shooting-false-flag-government-infowars Alex called it a false flag]. Jerad had [http://planet.infowars.com/offbeat/the-police-to-kill-or-not-to-kill posted on Infowars' message board] previously about how he was probably going to kill some cops
*The man who sheriff Nick Finch let out of jail would [https://www.splcenter.org/hatewatch/2016/09/28/man-freed-constitutional-sheriff-charged-murder go on to murder a guy] a few years later
*The story about Fort Hood was [https://kdhnews.com/military/fort-hood-tea-party-hate-claims-are-not-true/article_47174adc-404b-11e3-98c1-001a4bcf6878.html?mode=jqm not true]

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan reunite to check in on some recent Alex news.  In this installment, Alex covers the NY subway shooting, gives snake venom Covid theories a thumbs-down, and chats with champion-level weirdo Ali Alexander.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/4/18/episode-671-april-13-2022 Episode #671: April 13, 2022]</ref>:

*The NY subway shooter, Frank James, was definitely [https://nypost.com/2022/04/13/suspect-frank-james-was-spewing-racist-hate-well-before-brooklyn-shooting/ racist toward] [https://nypost.com/2022/04/12/frank-r-james-idd-as-person-of-interest-in-brooklyn-subway-shooting/ white people], but also toward [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/13/nyregion/frank-james-subway-shooting.html pretty much everyone]
*The Sutherland Springs shooter was [https://time.com/5012688/stephen-willeford-interview-texas-church/ not stopped by an armed church-goer], and the armed man who took over a pulpit in Nashville was [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/tennessee-pastor-tackles-disarms-man-who-brandished-gun-during-church-n1283448 stopped by an unarmed pastor]
*Alex misrepresents [https://nypost.com/2022/04/12/i-came-face-to-face-with-brooklyn-subway-shooter-rider/ a witness statement] about the subway shooting
*Alex misrepresents the details of the [https://abcnews.go.com/US/charleston-shooting-happened-inside-church/story?id=31855652 Charleston shooting from 2015]
*Alex's talking points about black-on-white crime are identical to the ideas specified as a motivation in [https://web.archive.org/web/20150620135311/http://lastrhodesian.com/data/documents/rtf88.txt%20 Dylann Roof's manifesto]
*Alex fudges some details on the [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/08/us/verdict-whitmer-kidnapping-case.html Whitmer kidnapping case]
*Alex poorly covers [https://nypost.com/2022/04/11/ny-handled-covid-19-lockdown-poorly-florida-among-best-study/ an article about a study] about Covid done by the [https://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/Committee_to_Unleash_Prosperity Committee to Unleash Prosperity]
*Alex doesn't understand [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/13/nyregion/subway-shooting-cameras.html the issue with the security cameras] in the MTA
*High 4:8 ratios [https://www.urmc.rochester.edu/encyclopedia/content.aspx?contentid=cd4_cd8_ratio&contenttypeid=167 do not necessarily mean lymphoma], which also [https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/01/health/covid-vaccine-lymph-nodes.html isn't a side-effect] of Covid vaccines
*Alex isn't even buying [https://rumble.com/v10mnew-live-world-premiere-watch-the-water.html the "snake venom" conspiracy], and the expert in the documentary has [https://www.thedailybeast.com/covid-conspiracy-theorists-are-at-war-over-snake-venom come out against the film]
*Ali Alexander's lawyer [https://www.wusa9.com/article/news/national/capitol-riots/virginia-court-disbars-attorney-representing-oath-keepers-in-capitol-riot-cases-jonathon-moseley-kelly-meggs-stewart-rhodes/65-9ac39a20-9451-4414-babc-fc7c207c9af9 got disbarred]

*Alex misreports on [https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2022-04-01/russia-ukraine-war-to-save-global-democracy-sign-up-a-few-good-dictators an op-ed that has a title about dictators], written by a guy who's written a lot on the topic [https://worldview.stratfor.com/article/good-mideast-dictators in the past]
*Julian Huxley was only the Secretary-General of UNESCO [https://en.unesco.org/director-general/former-dgs for two years]
*[https://www.cia.gov/library/abbottabad-compound/4A/4A92FD2FB4DAE3F773DB0B7742CF0F65_Coleman.-.CONSPIRATORS.HIERARCHY.-.THE.STORY.OF.THE.COMMITTEE.OF.300.R.pdf Conspirators' Hierarchy: The Story of the Committee of 300]
*[https://www.gutenberg.org/files/19229/19229-h/19229-h.htm H.G. Wells' "Aspirations"]
*John Coleman's mishandling of Wells' quotations in his text has had consequences to this day, including text from his misquoted passage appearing in new [https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/conspiracy-theorists-depopulation-text-does-not-appear-in-great-reset-book/ Great Reset conspiracy memes]
*Benton Partin was [https://www.af.mil/About-Us/Biographies/Display/Article/106051/brigadier-general-benton-k-partin/ an Air Force weapons developer], but no proof that he was in a secret space program. Also, he's a huge OKC truther
*Alex lies about Ukrainian president [https://patriots.win/p/141s2LD5IU/zelensky-gay-porn-video-leaked/c/ Zelensky having done gay porn]
*Robert Barnes pitches an arbitrary conspiracy theory about [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/apr/25/le-pen-thanks-forgotten-france-after-election-gains-in-overseas-territories the French elections]

title: 675: April 25, 2022

details_html:

Citations
mediawiki_citations:

*[https://www.foxbusiness.com/economy/goya-ceo-warns-world-on-precipice-of-food-crisis Fox Business interview] with Goya CEO
*[https://www.usfoods.com/our-services/business-trends/farmers-report/dry-commodity.html Dry Commodity report]
*Someone recently gave Alex [https://www.splcenter.org/hatewatch/2022/04/29/anonymous-donor-drops-1-million-bitcoin-alex-jones a million dollars worth of Bitcoin]
*Alex may be confused about [https://thenewsglory.com/french-farmers-dump-manure-outside-supermarkets-in-protest/ French manure protests], which [https://www.reuters.com/article/us-france-protests/french-farmers-dump-manure-outside-office-of-macron-party-lawmaker-idUSKCN1US0JC happen] [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2822120/French-farmers-dump-hundreds-tonnes-manure-streets-spray-city-building-slurry-day-protest.html all the] [https://www.iatp.org/news/french-farmers-dump-manure-at-mcdonalds-restaurant damn time]

title: 676: April 29, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on how Alex responded to the Supreme Court news.  It's part surprising, part not.  Also, Alex discusses a man who was beaten with tuna fins.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/5/5/episode-677-may-4-2022 Episode #677: May 4, 2022]</ref>:

*[https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2022/05/03/remarks-by-president-biden-before-air-force-one-departure-15/ Biden's comments] about the Supreme Court opinion regarding Roe v. Wade
*Biden [https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/29/us/politics/biden-abortion-rights.html voted for a 1982 bill] that would allow states to invalidate Roe v. Wade
*An amateur Spiderman [https://abc7news.com/man-climbing-salesforce-tower-pro-life-spiderman-maison-des-champs-climber/11815461/ climbed a tower in San Francisco]
*[https://thehill.com/news/campaign/3477112-the-trump-endorsed-candidates-that-have-won-their-primaries/ Trump has done okay] with current candidate endorsements, but his [https://ballotpedia.org/Endorsements_by_Donald_Trump overall track record] is way worse than Alex claims
*Alex discusses [https://news.yahoo.com/anthony-smith-attacked-jail-tortured-own-baby-091208848.html a 2018 prison beating] in the UK (not with tuna fins)
*Alex misreports [https://www.corriere.it/cronache/22_maggio_03/pope-francis-putin-e713a1de-cad0-11ec-84d1-341c28840c78.shtml the Pope's recent comments] about Ukraine
*Alex lies about the [https://www.factcheck.org/2022/05/unfounded-claims-about-frequency-and-causes-of-food-plant-fires/ situation with fires at food plants]
*[https://www.justice.gov/usao-dc/press-release/file/1499056/download Things aren't looking good] for Stewart Rhodes
*The WHO is working on [https://www.consilium.europa.eu/en/policies/coronavirus/pandemic-treaty/ an international pandemic treaty], and also there is a [https://www.who.int/about/governance/world-health-assembly World Health Assembly] happening in late May. They are not directly related, and the WHO treaty is set to have a progress review at next year's assembly. Jim Fetzer [https://jamesfetzer.org/2022/04/pandemic-treaty-will-hand-who-keys-to-global-government/ has been spreading conspiracies] about this stuff though

title: 677: May 4, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan take a little breaky to see how things were going in the past. In this installment, Alex interviews two people with fun names, and depression sets in when Alex mentions how old he is.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/5/8/episode-678-july-29-30-2022 Episode #678: July 29-30, 2003]</ref>:

*Alex makes up a lot of scary stories about DARPA's proposal for a [https://ciaotest.cc.columbia.edu/olj/si/si_2_9/si_2_9_lor01.pdf Policy Analysis Market]
*Alex misreports claims about alleged insider trading of Delta and American airlines prior to 911, which were debunked in [https://www.9-11commission.gov/report/911Report.pdf the 911 Report]
*Alex believes that [https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Luke%204&version=KJV the devil rules all governments], but forgets that [https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=John%208%3A44&version=NIV the devil is a liar]
*Global Research is a well known outlet full of conspiracies and [https://www.cbc.ca/news/science/russian-disinformation-global-research-website-1.5767208 laundered Russian propaganda], even [https://www.state.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Pillars-of-Russia%E2%80%99s-Disinformation-and-Propaganda-Ecosystem_08-04-20.pdf having 7 writers who weren't real people] but were fake identities used by GRU members
*Global Research also [https://apnews.com/article/conspiracy-theories-iran-only-on-ap-media-misinformation-bfca6d5b236a29d61c4dd38702495ffe spreads Covid conspiracies] and [https://marktaliano.net/the-neoliberal-neo-nazi-coup-in-ukraine-with-michel-chossudovsky/ Chossudovsky himself has argued] that the US is to blame for Russia invading Ukraine
*[https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/WCPD-2001-10-15/pdf/WCPD-2001-10-15-Pg1434.pdf Executive Order] establishing the Department of Homeland Security
*Colorado's marijuana legalization was [https://www.forbes.com/sites/roberthoban/2021/05/23/the-success-of-colorados-marijuana-tax-dollars/?sh=42f1a8d7529d a very successful state law experiment]
*Alex is mad about [https://www.schools.nyc.gov/schools/M586 Harvey Milk High School]
*Data from the [https://www.utep.edu/education/el3lab/_Files/docs/LGBTQ-Fact-Sheet---Student-Achievement-and-Educational-Attainment.pdf American Educational Research Association]
*Attempts have been made to create LGBTQ-oriented schools in [https://chicago.gopride.com/news/article.cfm/articleid/6567025 Chicago] and [https://thegavoice.com/news/pride-school-atlanta-closes-their-doors/ Atlanta], but they have not been successful
*Howard Kaloogian [https://www.mcall.com/news/mc-xpm-2004-06-23-3534097-story.html tried to shut down Michael Moore's film Fahrenheit 911], which earned the [https://web.archive.org/web/20040626154452/http://www.altpr.org/modules.php?file=article&mode=thread&name=News&op=modload&order=0&sid=201&thold=0 scorn of Kurt Nimmo]
*Kaloogian was also super in favor of the Iraq War, and [https://web.archive.org/web/20090904162153/http://tpmmuckraker.talkingpointsmemo.com/2009/09/legendary_gop_bamboozler_hitches_wagon_to_tea_part.php tried to create the Tea Party Express], the face of which got in trouble for [https://web.archive.org/web/20100723230621/https://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/2010/07/18/2010-07-18_tea_party_express_leader_mark_williams_expelled_over_colored_people_letter.html writing a very racist letter]
*[https://www.cga.ct.gov/PS98/rpt%5Colr%5Chtm/98-R-1540.htm You can't recall Senators] in the US
*Alex likes [https://www.adl.org/sites/default/files/documents/assets/pdf/combating-hate/Willis-Carto-Extremism-in-America.pdf the Liberty Lobby], which is an organization created by a neo-Nazi for the purpose of demonizing Jewish people

title: 678: July 29-30, 2003

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan see what Alex has been up to.  In this installment, Alex may or may not reveal who is behind QAnon (he doesn't).  Plus, he gets very defensive about January 6 stuff.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/5/10/episode-679-may-9-2022 Episode #679: May 9, 2022]</ref>:

*Children of Men will be coming true
*Bug populations [https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-52399373 are going down], although the picture is [https://earthsky.org/earth/insect-apocalyps-not-north-america/ more complex] [https://www.abc.net.au/news/science/2020-04-24/insect-apocalypse-new-research-less-severe/12172318 than Alex is pretending] it is
*The Albert Pike letter that Greg Reece reported on [https://aminutetomidnite.com/nwo-news/albert-pikes-three-world-wars-fact-or-fake/ is a hoax]
*A former employee of Noontide Press [https://www.splcenter.org/hatewatch/2009/06/11/alleged-holocaust-museum-shooter-planned-other-attacks did a shooting] at the Holocaust Memorial Museum
*Felons [https://www.factcheck.org/2008/11/felons-in-office/ can run for federal offices]
*The cases in [https://apnews.com/article/lawsuits-arizona-phoenix-constitutions-paul-gosar-fefc259cdb6cbf7cc9369c5f2f939c61 AZ] and [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/04/22/us/politics/marjorie-taylor-greene-jan-6-insurrectionist.html GA] had different interpretations of the lawsuits about congress persons who were accused of participation in the Jan 6 insurrection
*Alex pretends to know who started QAnon, but for some reason can't name names
*The Mayer Rothschild quote [https://history.stackexchange.com/questions/7887/did-rothschild-say-this-famous-quote-if-yes-what-did-he-mean-by-it is not] [https://books.google.com/books?dq=T.%20Cushing%20Daniel%20hr%20314%201911&hl=en&id=tWY3DwAAQBAJ&lpg=PA20&ots=Ay2wN1mFgl&pg=PA20&sa=X&sig=ACfU3U1FUagdkaUA9bksOUVvUUTeY9_6kw&source=bl&ved=2ahUKEwigua_UydX3AhU5kIkEHfpRDEIQ6AF6BAgSEAM#v=onepage&q=T.%20Cushing%20Daniel%20hr%20314%201911&f=false a real quote]
*Marjorie Taylor Greene thinks that it's suspicious that there are fires at food processing plants, but also seems to ignore fires at [https://www.wspa.com/news/local-news/fire-breaks-out-at-upstate-textile-factory/ textile plants] and [https://www.mytwintiers.com/news-cat/local-news/fire-breaks-out-at-jeld-wen-plant-in-wysox interior door factories]

title: 679: May 9, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan dip back to the past to see what they can find.  In this installment, Alex misreports a staggering number of stories, and warns people about the dangers of owning multiple toothbrushes.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/5/12/episode-680-july-31-august-1-2003 Episode #680: July 31-August 1, 2003]</ref>:

*Alex misreports a story about [https://www.cleveland19.com/story/949002/ohio-man-sues-over-camera-in-hotel-room/ spy cameras at a Marriott hotel]
*Alex misreports a story about how the Globalists were building dozens and dozens of BSL4 labs in the US. There are currently [https://theconversation.com/fifty-nine-labs-around-world-handle-the-deadliest-pathogens-only-a-quarter-score-high-on-safety-161777%20 13 in all of North America]
*Alex makes up conspiracies based on the 1998 [https://rosap.ntl.bts.gov/view/dot/13465 National Seatbelt Initiative]
*Alex makes stuff up about [https://www.hud.gov/sites/documents/DOC_7780.PDF occupancy regulations] and people getting arrested for having too many toothbrushes in their homes
*Alex misreports that people were [https://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2006/183/pdfs/uksiem_20060183_en.pdf not able to restock livestock] after a foot-and-mouth outbreak in the UK
*Alex misreports a story about a [https://www.ph.ucla.edu/epi/bioter/monkeyescapedavis.html monkey that escaped from a lab] at UC Davis
*Alex appears to be misreporting about an alleged Hannity and Colmes interview with someone who was claimed to be Kobe Bryant's accuser. It appears that he is referring to a [https://www.foxnews.com/story/equal-before-proven-guilty Hannity and Colmes interview with Tom Leykis] (who released the name of Kobe's accuser), and the fact that some people were [https://www.madjacksports.com/forum/showthread.php?104216-Woman-wrongly-identified spreading pictures of the wrong person online]
*Alex believes [https://www.military.com/undertheradar/2018/02/16/how-john-wayne-got-rid-kgb-agents-hired-kill-him.html very clearly fake stories about Stalin sending kill teams] to assassinate John Wayne. This was just from a biography written by someone who is [https://www.theguardian.com/books/2010/jul/25/michael-munn-biographer-interview-tim-adams accused of making up a bunch of stuff pretty regularly]
*A caller brings up [http://thematrixhasyou.org/13th-amendment/13th-amendment-missing.html a very weird idea] about republics being based on God's law, which was written by a [https://www.macaonline.net/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/MACA_Sovereign_Citizen_2019.original.1558455673.pdf huge sovereign citizen guy] who also [https://web.archive.org/web/20021003080942/http://antishyster.com/PDF/113pdf/113web10.pdf publishes some weird magazines] and [https://www.dmagazine.com/publications/d-magazine/1992/july/street-talk/ tried to run for the Texas Supreme Court] despite having never gone to law school

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan cover Alex's first response to the shooting in Buffalo, and rebuff Alex's claims that he predicted the attack.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/5/17/episode-682-may-15-2022 Episode #682: May 15, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex pretends that he predicted the Buffalo shooting
*To build a narrative that the shooting was a false flag, Alex misreports details about the shooter being red-flagged, but [https://www.syracuse.com/state/2022/05/buffalo-shooting-payton-gendrons-prior-threat-hospital-stay-face-scrutiny.html Alex] [https://abc7ny.com/buffalo-shooting-suspect-payton-gendron-conklin-new-york-tops-supermarket/11855987/ is] [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/05/16/nyregion/buffalo-shooting-suspect-discord-chat.html wrong]
*Alex's video that purports to show that he predicted the attack is strung together from out-of-context clips where he's talking about completely different topics

*Alex misrepresents information about [https://www.actionagainsthunger.org/world-hunger-facts-statistics people living with] [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/11/8/un-warns-of-sharp-rise-in-number-of-people-facing-famine food insecurity]
*Chicago has the [https://www.cbsnews.com/pictures/murder-map-deadliest-u-s-cities/62/ 28th highest murder rate] in the country

*[https://www.gofundme.com/f/well-never-forget-you-funeral-service-marcel GoFundMe for Marcel Fontaine]

title: 683: May 16, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on Alex, only to find that he's no longer so worried about his fears about a race war, and has pivoted over to theories about Covid vaccines causing monkeypox.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/5/22/episode-684-may-20-2022 Episode #684: May 20, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex has decided that the non-mRNA Covid vaccines cause monkeypox
*Alex misreports [https://www.aap.com.au/factcheck/claims-of-a-who-globalist-takeover-are-out-of-this-world/ news about the WHO] proposing [https://apps.who.int/gb/ebwha/pdf_files/WHA75/A75_18-en.pdf amendments to its International Health Regulations]
*There was [https://www.newsweek.com/monkeypox-cased-uk-massachusetts-case-vaccine-ordered-us-1708075 a case of monkeypox in MA], which led to orders of vaccines
*The [https://www.who.int/emergencies/disease-outbreak-news/item/2022-DON385 current monkeypox outbreak]
*The [https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/mm5227a5.htm 2003 monkeypox outbreak]
*[https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2021/s1119-smallpox-vials.html Story about vials] labeled smallpox being discovered
*[https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/01/us/cdc-monkeys-pennsylvania-truck-crash.html Story about truck] transporting monkeys crashing (the monkeys were [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/monkeys-loose-pennsylvania-highway-crash-rcna13149 promptly found])
*Alex claims that the Astrazeneca vaccine contains monkey DNA, but it actually just uses [https://extranet.who.int/pqweb/sites/default/files/documents/pl-azd1222-en.pdf a chimpanzee adenovirus], which is not the same thing
*Alex [https://factcheck.afp.com/doc.afp.com.329J2TA completely misreports a story] connecting a recent hepatitis outbreak with the Covid vaccines
*Alex overhypes [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC8354782/#:~:text=The%20autoimmune%20response%20or%20S1,mRNA%20vaccine%20against%20COVID%2D19. a case study of one person] who got meningitis after receiving the Covid vaccine
*[https://www.health.gov.au/initiatives-and-programs/covid-19-vaccines/is-it-true/is-it-true-does-the-vaxzevria-astrazeneca-vaccine-contain-animal-dna Australian health website] about whether or not the vaccine has animal DNA in it
