details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on an "Emergency Report" that Alex put out on the evening of May 24, hours after the shooting in Uvalde.  Spoiler alert: it's not great coverage.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/5/29/episode-687-may-24-2022 Episode #687: May 24, 2022]</ref>:

*The person who attacked Dave Chappelle [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/man-suspected-attacking-dave-chappelle-stage-says-show-was-triggering-rcna30057 was not trans]
*[https://mashable.com/article/trans-women-uvalde-school-shooting-disinformation Multiple trans women were the targets of 4Chan hoaxes], accusing them of being the Uvalde shooter
*[https://www.foxnews.com/us/texas-high-school-shooting-lockdown-arlington-mansfield Two examples] of [https://abc13.com/dexter-kelsey-charges-school-shooter-charged-yes-prep-southwest-houston-active-shooting/11072004/ Texas mass shootings] in the past year that Alex has not noticed happened
*List of [https://www.gunviolencearchive.org/reports/mass-shooting all mass shootings in 2022]
*Average annual [https://snowgaper.com/how-many-people-die-skiing/ skiing related deaths]
*Ken Cuccinelli is not a [https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/09/us/politics/homeland-security-russia-trump.html good source of information] and is [https://int.nyt.com/data/documenttools/homeland-security-whistleblower/0819ec9ee29306a5/full.pdf accused of ordering manipulation] of intelligence assessments to downplay the danger posed by white supremacist groups
*Uvalde shooter [https://www.cnn.com/2022/05/27/us/yubo-app-salvador-ramos-threats-invs/index.html made threats on social media] to rape and murder women in the past
*Alex and Owen baselessly insist that the Uvalde shooter was on psych meds
*Alex claims that the Parkland shooter was on psych meds, which is [https://www.sun-sentinel.com/local/broward/parkland/florida-school-shooting/fl-school-shooting-cruz-henderson-20180523-story.html%20 not the case]
*Alex claims that the Parkland shooter was not arrested previously in his life because a Soros-installed DA wouldn't allow people with Hispanic names to be arrested. [https://www.local10.com/news/2018/05/08/nikolas-cruz-was-referred-to-discipline-in-promise-program-didnt-participate/ This is not true]
*The state of Texas decided to pass laws in 2019 [https://www.politico.com/news/2022/05/26/robb-elementary-security-didnt-stop-massacre-00035332 hardening schools] [https://apnews.com/article/6adbebfa9a74407783258855cf551239 instead of taking on issues related to guns]
*Owen has the etymology of "[https://www.etymonline.com/word/pharmaceutical pharmaceutical]" [https://www.etymonline.com/word/pharmacy all wrong]
*[https://www.biblegateway.com/passage/?search=Numbers%2021&version=KJV Numbers 21:7-8]
*Gun buy-back programs generally screen turned-in guns against the database of reported stolen guns, and it is [https://nebraskalegislature.gov/laws/statutes.php?statute=28-1212.03 a felony to attempt to dispose of a stolen gun] in Nebraska
*There have been some [https://scholarship.law.uwyo.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1434&context=wlr strange prohibitions on gun ownership] in the history of the US
*[https://www.lvmpd.com/en-us/Documents/1-October-FIT-Criminal-Investigative-Report-FINAL_080318.pdf 2018 report] on the Las Vegas shooting
mediawiki_description: Today, Dan and Jordan check in on an "Emergency Report" that Alex put out on the evening of May 24, hours after the shooting in Uvalde.  Spoiler alert: it's not great coverage.
title: 687: May 24, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan continue to track Alex's response to the Uvalde shooting.  In this installment, Alex treads water for a bit, and leans on his callers to bring some weirdness to the conversation.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/6/2/episode-688-may-25-2022 Episode #688: May 25, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex whiffs on the meanings of both "[https://www.ancestry.com/name-origin?surname=salvador salvador]" and "[https://www.ancestry.com/name-origin?surname=ramos ramos]"
*Alex correctly reports out [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/05/24/uvalde-texas-school-shooting/ many of the details of the Uvalde shooting], though the details that were available early on have been somewhat unreliable
*Alex speaks with a caller who alleges they are a special education teacher who worked with the shooter, though there is [https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2022/05/25/uvalde-texas-school-shooting-gunman/ no concrete confirmation] he was in special education classes
*[https://nces.ed.gov/programs/digest/d18/tables/dt18_233.70.asp Statistics on schools with armed security]
*[https://www.edworkingpapers.com/sites/default/files/ai21-476.pdf Study on the effects of having armed School Resource Officers at schools]
*[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aWtY3xX1CqQ The Jeep in Aurora was speeding up] with seeming disregard that people were in the way
*[https://www.9news.com/article/news/crime/sam-young-sentenced-225-protest-shooting/73-58fb3028-e090-4ca1-8c8e-399f307ad574 Article about the protester] who shot at the Jeep
*[https://www.washingtonpost.com/investigations/2021/09/20/vaccine-lawsuits-thomas-renz-covid/ Profile of Thomas Renz], who is not an experienced lawyer
*The Pfizer CEO clip that Renz is trying to pass off as a recent announcement is [https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2022/01/12/fact-check-video-pfizer-ceo-microchip-pill-2018/9155684002/ an out-of-context clip from 2018]
*The current [https://www.bbc.com/news/health-61580089 Monkeypox has been traced] to the West African strain
mediawiki_description: Today, Dan and Jordan continue to track Alex's response to the Uvalde shooting.  In this installment, Alex treads water for a bit, and leans on his callers to bring some weirdness to the conversation.
title: 688: May 25, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan continue to view Alex's Uvalde shooting coverage.  In this installment, Alex implores the audience to not blame the police for anything, and workshops ways to make schools more like jails with a guy who used to work for Blackwater.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/6/5/episode-689-may-26-2022 Episode #689: May 26, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex's continued coverage of the aftermath of the Uvalde shooting
*Alex relies on some anonymously sourced information delivered by his head of security Tim Enlow to report that the shooting was not a school shooting, but was actually a hostage situation that led to murders
*Some of Enlow's details do coincide with information that would be revealed on May 27th, at the [https://www.npr.org/2022/06/03/1102689126/uvalde-shooting-police-response press conference held by Col. McCraw]
*[https://www.rethinktokyo.com/sites/default/files/gl-2021-cost-of-living-city-ranking-mercer-0622.pdf Living in Chicago is more expensive] than any city in Luxembourg
*Alex is wrong about many of the [https://www.npr.org/2017/11/30/567477160/how-the-loss-of-u-s-psychiatric-hospitals-led-to-a-mental-health-crisis dynamics surrounding the erosion] of [https://origins.osu.edu/article/americas-long-suffering-mental-health-system?language_content_entity=en mental health resources in the country]
*[https://www.nber.org/papers/w23510 NBER study] about the effect of right-to-carry laws
*[https://ajph.aphapublications.org/doi/full/10.2105/AJPH.2013.301409 AJPH study] about the effect of increased gun ownership
mediawiki_description: Today, Dan and Jordan continue to view Alex's Uvalde shooting coverage.  In this installment, Alex implores the audience to not blame the police for anything, and workshops ways to make schools more like jails with a guy who used to work for Blackwater.
title: 689: May 26, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan continue observing Alex's confusing coverage of the Uvalde shooting.  In this installment, Alex changes his mind and declares that there was a "stand down" and The Archangel Michael of Common Sense shows up to challenge Michael Moore to a debate.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/6/9/episode-690-may-27-2022 Episode #690: May 27, 2022]</ref>:

*Social Sentinel [https://www.vox.com/recode/23150863/school-surveillance-mass-shooting-texas-uvalde did not capture threats] in advance about Uvalde
*Angeli Gomez [https://www.ksat.com/news/local/2022/06/05/uvalde-mother-who-ran-into-school-describes-being-handcuffed-saving-kids-during-shooting-im-going-in-there/ rushed in to get her kids] out of the school, but [https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/officers-rescued-own-children-texas/ there is no evidence] that police officers did that
*At the time of this episode, [https://www.wsj.com/articles/uvalde-residents-voice-frustration-over-shooting-response-11653588161 there would have been reason] for Alex to think Ramos was outside the school for 12 minutes before the shooting, though [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/05/27/uvalde-texas-school-shooting-timeline/ that timeline is incorrect]
*A retired federal agent [https://www.salon.com/2022/05/27/buffalo-shooter-may-have-shared-plans-with-retired-agent-before-massacre-report_partner/ may have communicated] with the Buffalo shooter on racist websites
*Ted Nugent [https://www.wsls.com/news/2018/07/19/pro-gun-rocker-ted-nugent-turns-away-firearms-from-his-roanoke-show/ restricted guns at his concert], and his [https://www.rutheckerdhall.com/audience-safety-prohibited-items upcoming] [https://floridatheatre.com/venue-info/faq dates] are at venues that prohibit customers bringing in any weapons
*[https://www.nytimes.com/2022/05/31/us/politics/michael-sussmann-durham-fbi.html Durham failed] in his case against Sussmann
*Uvalde police chief [https://www.salon.com/2022/06/01/another-uvalde-claim-falls-apart--now-police-chief-refuses-to-cooperate-with-investigation/ stopped cooperating with investigation]

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/6/12/episode-691-june-6-2022 Episode #691: June 6, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex turns the corner and decides that maybe he should have called the Uvalde shooting a false flag after all
*Uvalde police [https://www.kens5.com/article/news/special-reports/uvalde-school-shooting/uvalde-cisd-police-chief-gives-details-of-what-happened-inside-robb-elementary/273-18734847-58ab-4374-9ddc-f55641a334a2 chief Pete Arredondo] was [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/06/09/us/uvalde-shooting-police-response.html on the scene] [https://www.cnn.com/interactive/2022/06/us/uvalde-police-narratives-texas-shooting/index.html at the shooting]
*Infowars and the Sandy Hook plaintiffs [https://news.bloomberglaw.com/us-law-week/infowars-to-dismiss-bankruptcy-after-deal-with-justice-department came to an agreement] about withdrawing his bankruptcy claim

title: Alex's Breaky Minisode

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan dip back to the past to check in on Alex's roots.  In this installment, Alex clarifies his position on the death penalty, gets all worked up about an op-ed, and dreadfully misreports the details of a 1982 bank robbery.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/6/19/episode-693-august-4-2003 Episode #693: August 4, 2003]</ref>:

*George W. Bush's signaling to support the assault weapons ban was almost certainly [https://www.nytimes.com/2003/05/08/us/irking-nra-bush-supports-the-ban-on-assault-weapons.html a political calculation] he had no intention of following through with, and he was [https://www.nytimes.com/2000/09/12/us/the-2000-campaign-the-endorsements-to-help-bush-nra-withholds-backing.html very tight with the NRA]
*[https://www.congress.gov/bill/108th-congress/house-bill/2038/actions HR 2038] was dead in the water by this point, and [https://www.congress.gov/bill/108th-congress/house-resolution/769/text an attempt to have it considered in 2004] went nowhere
*Alex misreports that the Supreme Court is under the sway of international courts, basing his coverage on [https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/2003/08/04/thinking-outside-the-us/c135a249-01e4-44c5-bc3c-67aeecaa9890/ an op-ed] that he clearly hadn't read pre-show
*Alex [https://www.abc15.com/news/crime/death-row-diary-the-arizona-executions-of-the-lagrand-brothers-causes-international-stir misreports a story] about two German nationals who were executed for committing a murder during a bungled bank robbery, [https://www.nytimes.com/1999/03/05/us/us-execution-of-german-stirs-anger.html which became] an [https://www.icj-cij.org/en/case/104 international incident]
*Alex's story of the origin of the term "kangaroo court" [https://www.wordorigins.org/big-list-entries/kangaroo-court is dubious]
*[https://forward.com/culture/449521/mel-gibson-anti-semitism-timeline-winona-ryder/ Mel Gibson] and [https://web.archive.org/web/20100212095132/http://moviecitynews.com/notepad/2004/040303_npd.html his dad] both have deeply antisemitic histories

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on Alex's reaction to the news of the Supreme Court overturning Roe v. Wade.  You may be slightly surprised by Alex's reaction, as well as by the intense bigotry of Judge Joe Brown.

Dreamy Creamy Fundraiser

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/6/26/episode-696-june-24-2022 Episode #696: June 24, 2022]</ref>:

*The Supreme Court [https://www.ktvu.com/news/five-conservatives-justices-give-legal-reasoning-for-overturning-roe-v-wade overturning Roe v. Wade]
*[https://www.nytimes.com/2022/06/16/us/florida-abortion-law-judaism.html Jewish congregation filing suit] in Florida challenging abortion bans
*[https://news.gallup.com/poll/350756/record-high-think-abortion-morally-acceptable.aspx 2021 Gallup poll] showing record high support for abortion
*[https://www.pewresearch.org/religion/fact-sheet/public-opinion-on-abortion/ 2022 Pew Research] showing that the youth support abortion by a huge margin
*[https://prochoice.org/national-abortion-federation-releases-2021-violence-disruption-report/ Huge increase in attacks] against abortion providers in 2021
*[https://www.cnbc.com/2022/06/25/ri-cop-allegedly-attacks-political-opponent-at-abortion-rally-after-roe-ruling.html Multiple attacks] [https://www.huffpost.com/entry/truck-driver-rams-into-protesters-roe-demonstration-in-iowa_n_62b66490e4b0cdccbe6b9399 on pro-choice protesters] over the weekend
*Biden [https://nypost.com/2022/06/22/biden-to-call-on-congress-to-pause-gas-taxes-for-3-months/ supports pausing the gas tax]
*Planned Parenthood in Wisconsin [https://apnews.com/article/abortion-us-supreme-court-wisconsin-madison-planned-parenthood-01f50d58b62f1f9b6ac87b0f1faff587 temporarily halted performing abortions]

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on how Alex is doing, and find him throwing out all of his news-covering plans after Roger Stone stops by to drop a bombshell on him.  Also, Alex interviews an annoying dork.

Citations

Dreamy Creamy Fundraiser
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/6/30/episode-697 Episode #697: June 29, 2022]</ref>:

*BRICS countries [https://www.rt.com/business/557627-brics-developing-global-reserve-currency/ considering their own reserve currency]
*Alex misreads a [https://thepressunited.com/updates/zelensky-demands-5-billion-from-nato-cites-security-in-europe/ headline about "NATO cities"]
*Transcript of [https://www.npr.org/2022/06/28/1108396692/jan-6-committee-hearing-transcript Cassidy Hutchinson's testimony]
*[https://memoryholeblog.org/2021/01/14/michael-flynn-interviewed-by-alex-jones Alex's interview with Mike Flynn] from the evening of January 5
*Alex, Roger, and Flynn [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tRUTm-ZIcow all speak at a rally] on the evening of January 5
*[https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2022/06/29/trump-defense-cassidy-hutchinson-peter-ornato/ More about] [https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/cassidy-hutchinsons-jan-6-testimony-comes-increased-scrutiny-rcna35994 Cassidy Hutchinson's testimony]
*[https://www.dmagazine.com/publications/d-magazine/2022/may/do-not-share/ D Magazine article] about Alex Stein
*SADS is [https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18508782/ a real thing]
*Trump was [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-10331943/Trump-flew-seven-times-Jeffrey-Epsteins-private-Lolita-Express-jet-flight-logs-reveal.html on Epstein's plane] multiple times, [https://www.salon.com/2021/12/22/ghislaine-maxwell-trial-flew-on-epsteins-jets-more-often-than-previously-known_partner/ as was RFK Jr.]

title: 698: For Squatch, There Are No Heroes

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on Alex's response to the 4th of July shooting in Highland Park, IL.  As it turns out, he doesn't talk about it much, and mostly just gets defensive about aliens and tries to whip up violence at the border.

Citations

Dreamy Creamy Summer
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/7/5/episode-699-july-4-5-2022 Episode #699: July 4-5, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex barely covering the parade shooting in Highland Park
*Douglas MacKinnon has written [https://www.foxnews.com/person/m/douglas-mackinnon some cool op-eds]
*Alex attempts to minimize the parade shooting by pointing to [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/06/28/san-antonio-truck-dead-migrants/ the migrants who died in a truck in Texas recently]
*Alex misreports [https://missingmigrants.iom.int/sites/g/files/tmzbdl601/files/publication/file/MMP%20annual%20regional%20overview%202021%20LAC_Executive%20Summary-ENG_0.pdf a paper put out by a UN organization] about how [https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/world/un-migration-study-deems-us-mexico-border-deadliest-land-route-in-the-world-based-on-2021-numbers/ar-AAZbnG7 the US-Mexico border is the most dangerous crossing in the world]
*[https://www.cnet.com/science/scientists-create-alien-life-form-with-artificial-genetic-code/ CNET article] Alex references about scientists creating "alien life," which was part of research [https://www.scripps.edu/news-and-events/press-room/2017/20171130romesberg.html that continued on], and Alex would be even madder if he knew that it progressed
*The new bacteria found on the ISS [https://www.theguardian.com/science/2021/mar/18/new-bacteria-lurking-on-iss-no-space-oddity-says-scientist may not be that big of a deal]
*The [https://www.fox10phoenix.com/news/xenobots-worlds-first-living-robots-can-reproduce-scientists-say self-replicating robots], or Xenobots, are [https://www.washingtonpost.com/science/2021/11/30/living-robots-reproduction-study/ not quite what Alex makes them out to be]
*Highland Park shooter [https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/highland-park-mayor-says-was-cub-scout-leader-person-interest-parade-s-rcna36666 dressed as a woman to escape the scene], but was not dressed as a woman when arrested
*John Hullihan's [https://ballotpedia.org/Jonathan_Hullihan failed House run]

title: 699: July 4-5, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan forget that it's their 700th episode, so they just do a normal show, covering a day where Alex is in a great mood because the Georgia Guidestones had been bombed the night before.

Citations

Dreamy Creamy Summer Fundraiser
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/7/7/episode-700-july-6-2022 Episode #700: July 6, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex talks a ton about how [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/georgia-guidestones-blown-up-explosion/ the Georgia Guidestones got blown up]
*Alex asserts that the English slab of the Guidestones was bombed, but that is not correct. It was the slab that featured print in Hebrew and Arabic ([https://georgiarecorder.com/2022/07/07/failed-gop-governor-candidate-cheers-satanic-georgia-guidestones-blast/ resources showing the bombed slab], comparisons can be made to [https://placeandsee.com/wiki/georgia-guidestones the slabs next to it], which features [https://www.newspapers.com/clip/105132194/georgia-guidestones-associated-press/ Chinese writing on one side and Hindi on the other])
*There is [https://www.newsweek.com/marjorie-taylor-greene-pushes-link-medication-mass-shootings-highland-park-1721631 no currently available evidence] that Robert Crimo was on psych meds, this is just [https://news.yahoo.com/marjorie-taylor-greene-baselessly-claims-143256079.html a claim MTG has been making]
*MTG pretends that there weren't anti-LGBTQ attacks, both [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2022/06/24/oslo-london-pub-shooting-pride-norway/ carried out] and [https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2022/jun/18/increase-anti-lgbtq-attacks-rightwing-extremist-groups planned], [https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2022/06/17/lgbtq-pride-violence/ during Pride month]
*[https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34102649/ 2021 study] about mass shooters and psychiatric illness

title: 701: June 23, 2004

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan explore a couple days of nonsense at the beginning of this week.  In this installment, Alex obsesses about Hunter Biden, brags about his documentary, and also threatens to cut his own penis off.

Citations

Dreamy Creamy Fundraiser
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/7/14/episode-702-july-11-12-2022 Episode #702: July 11-12, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex threatens to cut his finger off, then escalates to threatening to cut his penis off
*Alex is obsessed with news of Hunter Biden's [https://www.vice.com/en/article/g5vgwm/alleged-hunter-biden-leak-shows-icloud-can-be-iphone-securitys-weak-link?utm_medium=email&utm_source=substack iCloud account being hacked]
*German cities are [https://www.thelocal.de/20220712/no-one-should-freeze-german-cities-plan-public-warming-halls-for-winter/ setting up some warming halls]
*Sri Lanka signed onto Paris Accord [https://unfccc.int/node/61204 in 2016], and they [http://www.statistics.gov.lk/Agriculture/StaticalInformation/rubb4 aren't getting rid of all their cows]
*Clean coal [https://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/infrastructure/news/a27886/how-does-clean-coal-work/ is not a thing]
*Lots of CO2 is [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5380556/ not good for plants, nor people]
*Alex misreports [https://apnews.com/article/Fact-Check-Fire-Netherlands-Bill-Gates-527107720161 story about a fire in the Netherlands]

*Alex misreports [https://www.thesun.ie/news/9499371/camogie-player-untimely-passing-beloved-daughter-waterford-tribute/ a story about a young athlete dying]
*Alex reports bombshell [https://www.sgtreport.com/2022/09/study-94-of-mrna-jab-recipients-found-to-have-metal-like-objects-in-their-blood/ news about a study] [https://ijvtpr.com/index.php/IJVTPR/article/view/47 published in a disreputable anti-vax journal]
*Alex misreports news about [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/oct/05/poland-us-nuclear-wars-russia-putin-ukraine Poland requesting nuclear weapons]
*Alex misreports [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20221006-russian-elite-voice-growing-anger-as-losses-mount-in-ukraine an article about Russian elites] growing disapproval of Putin
*Alex loses it and avoids taking calls by listening to Frank Sinatra
mediawiki_description: Today, Dan and Jordan check in to see what Alex was up to while the closing statements were being made in his trial in Connecticut.  In this installment, Alex takes some calls, blows an AI expert's mind, and gets sentimental with the Chairman of the Board.
title: 733: October 6, 2022

details_html:
Today, Dan and Jordan check in on how Alex is doing while he waits for the jury to return with a verdict.  In this installment, Alex reveals that his cousin is an arsonist, announces that everyone's losing their job in a few weeks, and celebrates Kanye saying his name on Tucker.

Citations
mediawiki_citations:
Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/10/11/episode-734-october-9-2022 Episode #734: October 9, 2022]</ref>:

*Alex [https://www.verifythis.com/article/news/verify/national-verify/paypal-wont-fine-people-for-spreading-misinformation/536-dcbb5921-b2ce-47e7-8e7a-c6c9ef7b747c misreports a story] about PayPal's terms of service
*Alex discusses a press release put out by [https://www.wfla.com/community/health/coronavirus/florida-surgeon-general-ladapo-tweet-on-covid-vaccines-removed-restored/ the FL surgeon general], based on [https://floridahealthcovid19.gov/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/20221007-guidance-mrna-covid19-vaccines-analysis.pdf a Covid vaccine paper] that [https://www.medpagetoday.com/special-reports/features/101148 has significant problems]
*Alex runs cover for Kanye West's [https://www.thecut.com/2022/10/kanye-west-anti-semitic-tweets.html antisemitic] [https://www.tmz.com/2022/10/07/kanye-west-diddy-white-lives-matter-t-shirts-yeezy-text-messages/ comments], instead focusing mostly on how Kanye said his name on Tucker's show
*Tucker Carlson [https://www.vice.com/en/article/3ad77y/kanye-west-tucker-carlson-leaked-footage-antisemitism-fake-children cut out significant parts] of his interview with Kanye
*The [https://nypost.com/2016/10/09/clinton-staged-15-year-old-girls-question-at-town-hall/ 15 year-old at the Clinton townhall] was also [https://www.timesofisrael.com/jewish-student-helped-ensure-joe-bidens-path-to-presidency-on-a-day-of-crisis/ the Senate staffer on January 6]

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan discuss how Alex Jones responded to news that he'd lost about a billion dollars in the CT case involving his lies about Sandy Hook.  He whines a bit, acts tough, and then talks to a guy who physically met Jesus, which is all pretty on brand.

details_html: Today, Dan and Jordan sit down for a sneaky snake chat with plaintiff's attorney Mark Bankston, to get a handle on the news of Alex's recent almost $1 billion verdict in the CT case, and what the next steps are likely to be in the various litigations he's facing.

Today, Dan and Jordan celebrate Hot Shot Lawyer Norm Pattis mentioning them on his podcast by breaking down a deposition from the Connecticut case against Alex. In this installment, attorney Chris Mattei deposes long-time Infowars writer/editor Adan Salazar, and things get fishy.
